story:
Hello I'm Charlesetta Hawkins, the purpose of this campaign is to fund the legal and registration expense for a non-profit 501(c) 3. 

I am seeking to create a foundation in memorial of my son Brandon Blake Hawkins. The goal of this foundation is to provide assistance to individuals and families with disabilities by reducing stigma, promoting awareness, offering resources and  navigating them to various  developmental resource systems. Once the success of the BBHF non-profit status is obtained we look forward to partnering with like organizations, to open the first handicapped playground for the disabled in our community.We purpose to fund annual Christmas Galas for the mentally and physically challenged in various cities though out the United States.

Brandon was born November 16,1985 with Cerebral Palsy

Despite having a disability,he was such a fun loving person. In raising and caring for him I purposed to always give him the same opportunities that any child deserved and should have. I included him in a variety of things, I had no control over how others looked at him, I was more concerned on how Brandon looked at himself. 

Though out his life Brandon attended many special education programs starting at the age of 8 months old. Numerous developmental therapies to enhance his chances in life. Special Olympics, bowling, field trips overload, I can't name them all, zoos, petting zoos, farms, museums, operas ,dances, shopping trips, swimming, camping, horseback riding, gardening, his macaroni and rice art, finger, and brush paintings, clay sculpting, crafts I will forever cherish.

 

On October 10, 2008, my son had a terrible fall. As a result of that fall,the last year of his life, he faced much pain and suffering. Brandon fought a good fight, even in his illness he continue to succeed in winning the hearts of people. October 8,2009 Brandon passed on to a higher calling,no longer limited. He walked with a huge gape here on earth, I now image him running, leaping and jumping. His once 5 word vocabulary is no more, my belief is that he is a great orator in heaven.

 

So,now it is left up to myself and others to carry on his legacy. I want to share these opportunities in the same fun-loving, happy spirit as Brandon. This is how we give back,this is how we keep that spirit alive for others to share.

Sadly so many children and adults with disabilities miss out on these opportunities because of a lack of funding and resources.
We can uplift the quality of life for an under served, under acknowledged population of people.They deserve a chance to not just live, but really live, and live it up!
Please join me in launching the Brandon Blake Hawkins Foundation, where together we can make a difference!

Brandon Loved Life!!!

Thank You For Your Contribution  
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help

Please help me get the word out, help me make some noise about this campaign

Facebook http://www.facebook.com/brandonblake.hawkins

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jonathan and I live on a small island chain in the middle of the Atlantic ocean. I studied Engineering in the UK and have lived and worked in many countries in the world but now I am back on my island running my own internet business (which has absolutely NOTHING to do with this invention but it makes me sound all sofisticated and serious ... which I am, ofcourse.)

I have a pet hate. 

No, this doesn't mean I hate pets: There is something in this world that peeves me. 

One of the most frustrating things I find is when I am taking a plane off the island and I arrive at the check-in desk, and they have these loooong queue control barrier thingys with no-one waiting in line, I have to zigzag almost half a mile to get to the front of the line which is only 10 feet away from where I started.
And then I have to do it all over again in passport control ..... and again buying a coffee inside the terminal, and again boarding the plane ... and then all over again when I get off at the other end .... This also happens in cinemas, theme parks, shops, theatres .... I reckon millions of miles have been walked unnecesarily by people through-out the world!! I PLAN TO PUT A STOP TO THIS! (Shoe rubber manufacturers have tried to get ShortCutQ banned! We will not sucumb to their wishes!) ;-)

There are ways around this to be sure: I have tried ducking under, dragging the whole caboodle along with me when it snags on my backpack, I have tried uncliping the barrier, despite the dirty looks the security personell fire at me and then sheepisly cliping it back in when I am on the otherside ... or when I am with fellow travellers, passing the end of the tape to the person behind me in what resembles a bizare slow-motion-spinning-relay-race, I have tried going over; risking life and limb in a scissor kicking bid for freedom ... Even the employee at Duloc was forced into this degrading zigzagging ignominy .. I must admit I have yet to try Shreks solution .... but ... there is always a first. (See from 20" onwards)




BUT I have devised a simple solution: 

And I called it "ShortCutQ" 

Its a simple gate allowing you to skip the empty lanes. 

So simple; why hasn't anyone thought of it before?  They haven't. I checked.


Imagine NEVER having to zigzag all the way to the front of an empty queue again!
Check out the smile on this guys face - you can tell he is as happy as Larry using this new system. (Larry is the guy in the above picture)


What We Need & What You Get

The funding will go for the following:

  • 10000€ will go into obtaining a worldwide patent
  • 5000€ will go into developing and perfecting the shortcut gate
  • 10000€ will go into marketing and visiting trade fairs all over the world

If we dont reach the targets, we will fund the initial stages and then try to get Angel funding for the rest once the idea is protected and hopefully designed perfectly.


The Impact

Our aim is that NO ONE ever has to zigzag needlessly through queue control systems EVER again. 

If you contribute to this project, everytime you waltz up to the front of an empty queue through the ShortCutQ gate, you can smile proudly knowing that you just saved yourself, and everyone around you the time, energy, shoe rubber, humilty and boredom of zigzagging through empty queues.


I have obtained a Masters degree in Aeronautical Engineering, I have pulled a national telecoms company off its knees and into mega-profit, I have set up my own successful internet company .... but I have never made anything like this before. I have the passion and determination to make this work... but I need your help. 



Other Ways You Can Help

If you like this idea but cant contribute, just share this with your friends and you will one day never have to do that silly zigzagging thing again.


SAY NO TO

ZIGZAGGING HOO-HAA!

story:
What is Watershed Market?

Watershed Market (WSM) is a phased, urban marketplace in Houston, TX. When we say phased, we mean Watershed Market will start as a temporary marketplace, with four weekend markets planned for 2014. Our goal is to grow organically to become a permanent destination for Houston. WSM will be a place where you can spend the day shopping, grab a local beer, browse the farmer’s market, and see live music all in one location. The Market will showcase local food, artisans, and innovative product makers of all kinds. With Houston well on it's way to becoming the 3rd largest city in the United States, we need to establish a permanent, locally-sourced marketplace where people can meet, shop-n-stroll, and experience local food and culture on a regular basis. 

We've got this all planned out!

This is a potential layout for the marketplace. 


  • 2.13 acre market space
  • Blue squares = Vendor spaces (that's almost 100 local vendors)
  • Orange rectangles = Food Trucks
  • Grey squares = MORE FOOD!!!
  • Yellow squares = Local "Adult beverages" 
  • We have a 50'x100' platform for our entertainment area (an old building foundation, we love to re-use!)
  • We have space for bikes to safely park, and receive repairs
  • Tons of seating
  • Don't forget plenty of bathrooms!

You can help Launch WSM!!!

What We Need?

Of course, we would love to receive a million dollars from this campaign! With a million dollars, we could bypass the need for the market to start as a temporary venue and go straight into building a permanent home for Watershed Market. We envision a marketplace built out of re-used materials, such as train cars and shipping containers, repurposed to be vendor stalls and restaurant booths.

We dream BIG at Watershed Market!!!

Until then, Watershed Market is asking for a minimum of $5,000, to help fund the infrastructure of our first weekend market, on March 22nd & 23rd, 2014 @ 2322 Polk St. Houston, TX 77003. 


Your donation will help fund:

Insurance and Permits - You’ll help us cut through the red tape like a hot knife through butter!

Equipment - Generators, stage, audio & visual equipment, bike racks, vendor tents, seating, medical kits (Safety First!); plus tools to prepare and keep the land looking beautiful.

Support a Vendor - Help fund a booth for an up-and-coming vendor, educator, or entrepreneur with a really great idea.

Staff & Volunteer Uniforms - So you can spot all the hard working volunteers supporting Watershed Market and stop us to say, “HI!”

Recycling Program - Watershed Market will be a “No Trace Left Behind” destination, it is our goal to reduce trash by running a recycling program, encouraging our food vendors to use only recyclable/compostable containers, and providing water for reusable water bottles.


The Impact

Houston is changing both physically and mentally. Everyday more people move to Houston to build families and businesses. We must lay down the foundation for sustainable communities. Watershed Market vendors must meet a quality standard we have dubbed GLASIR. This means GREEN, LOCAL, ADAPTIVE, SUSTAINABLE, INNOVATIVE, RE-USE. Watershed Market will help bolster this standard by being a place that encourages local commerce through supporting local creatives and pedestrian culture. WSM will promote educating citizens about alternative transportation lifestyles, such as walking, cycling, and public transit - rather than driving their car. It will provide a place for people to have access to fresh produce from a daily farmer’s market, in an area that is currently considered a “food desert”. WSM will be a home for the arts by creating a venue for live performances. Watershed Market is a stepping stone to creating stronger communities in Houston!


Thank you for your support!

Along with custom WSM “Launcher” T-shirts and WSM branded collapsible, reusable water bottles, a number of Watershed Market artisans have donated one of a kind art pieces to thank our gracious "Launchers". Check out the great rewards we have for you below. Contribute and help launch Watershed Market a reality for Houston, TX!

- For our "Launchers" in Houston, we will be hosting a "Pick-up" Party in January to receive all rewards! You will receive information about the party through email in the future. 

- For "Launchers" needing shipping, WSM will require extra funding for S&H.

 

PERKS!!!


"Ally"



WSM Re-usable Water Bottle



 WSM 'Launcher' T-shirt



"Hipster"



"Explorer, Traveler, Adventurer"



"Optimist"



"Saint"



"Outlaw"



"Conservationist"


"Fashionista"



"Lady"



"Dandy"



"Multi-tasker"



"Foodie"



If you would like to support Watershed Market but do not have the resources to do so, please consider joining us as a volunteer and telling your friends about Watershed Market. Even if we don’t reach our monetary goals with this Indiegogo Campaign, the Watershed Market Team will continue to push forward to create what we feel is a necessity for Houston. We are determined to provide Houston with a permanent, locally-sourced marketplace!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Fred Baker III, but I have been known throughout my life as Trey. I am the primary provider for two children (5 and 6) and have been unemployed since Sept 2012.
 
I have provided logistical support for Missile Defense and NASA for the last 8 years and have currently re-enrolled in the culinary arts. I have been cooking since I was 19 and figured if I can't get a job in my field because of sequestration, I might as well be doing something I have a passion for while providing financial stability for my children. 

I am in dire need of books, uniforms, equipment and tuition for the Summer semester until my Pell Grant kicks in next term.

The Impact

My business "Extreme EnTreys" will be the creation of my passion. I plan to start with a food truck in the Huntsville metro area combining elements of culinary tradition with progressive new world artistry. In other words, fusion cuisine. I have traveled overseas and have had the opportunity to bask in the culinary sensations of ethnic and world styles.

There is a market for up and coming culinary artists and I believe I have what it takes to sell gourmet street food, but I need your help to get me there.

I am not asking for huge deposits. $1 here, $5 there, $10 if you're feeling generous. The money will fund my endeavor to finish school and open my own restaurant after graduation. The benefits range from my own personal accomplishment to not only providing top notch food to Huntsvillians and surrounding communities, but help boost our local economy and maybe in the future, expanding to other areas of the United States.

All of my purchases will be catalogged here so you you can track my progress and with your help, I know I can get it off the ground.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this campaign with your friends and family so they too can see how dedicated I am and will become as my talents progress.

story:
**UPDATE** In less than 48 hours we have all come together to be able to purchase a generator for Kylah’s family!  They are now on the waiting list to be able to get one!  THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!!!

We are still leaving the donation site open as we can still help more!  Food, water, medicine, lanterns, batteries and other needs can still be met.  We will be shipping boxes of goods which cost $70 each to ship.  Any additional funds will help ship the goods to Kylah’s family.  We will update with photos so you can see your donations at work!!  =) 

Thank you again!  This has been SO AMAZING to see the good of people coming together.  This fills my heart with joy!!  Thank you all!  BLESSED!!!! 

Hello everyone!  Thank you for your time and stopping by our fundraising page.

My goal is to help buy a generator, food, water, medicine and other emergency items for my best friend's family in the Philippines who have been affected by Typhoon Haiyan. A generator will help bring them consistent electricity for their daily lives where running water and electricity are never guaranteed. 

They are like family to me and I'm hoping through family, friends and friends of friends we can all come together and make a difference in their lives.

Please help Kylah and her family!  Here in the U.S. we forgot how fortunate we are to have the everyday conveniences we have and I am hoping we can help!

If we all even pitch in a few dollars, together we can make a huge difference in their lives!!  Every bit counts! Please share this page with others so we can reach our goal of helping Kylah and her family!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute money and that is ok, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Share this page. Maybe someone else you know can help!
  • Donate goods: Canned food, children’s fever medicine, batteries, battery operated candles, radios, crackers, first aid kits, nutella, peanut butter etc.
  • Say a prayer.

I will update this page to keep you informed of our progress. You may reach me at kleekc@gmail.com if you have any further questions.

THANK YOU!!!!

story:
HEY ALL!

THANKS SO MUCH FOR HELPING US MEET OUR GOAL!
But we're not done, but not by a long shot. Every dollar you continue to give past this point helps us continue to help women in the Chicago area. Please consider giving, even though you see our goal as "met" our needs are still great and your help is still vital to our cause.

Who we are

The Chicago Women's AIDS Project (CWAP) mission is to empower women to take control of their own health and to live as fully and productively as possible. CWAP provides prevention, education, advocacy, and support for women at risk or living with HIV.

What We Need and WHY

Our resources are very limited and as government funding get's cut we could use every dollar you can give to help us provide support to the women we serve. The money you give goes to support these services.

  • Support Groups
  • Free Therapy Services
  • Project SASS- a prevention for positives group held in five week cycles in partnership with other agencies and clinics that address the needs and issues of women's health and adherence. 
  • Sisters Reaching Out- Peer health mentoring for HIV+ and HIV- women who have been previously incarcerated within the last year. Graduates become prepared to educate and make a difference in their community. 

How your money helps

Even small donations help CWAP go far in the support services that it offers. Some examples of reasonably sized donations that go the distance in helping CWAP are: 

  • $30 donation provides a healthy lunch to for 20 women at CWAP’s new Empowerment Group.
  • $50 donation provides bus card transportation to 20 women to get to crucial medical and support services.
However, please do not feel obligated to give donations this size, even the smallest donation can help us to grow and help women across the Chicago area!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able at this time to financially contribute to CWAP please consider donating your time by volunteering, or getting the word out about our needs!

  • Visit http://cwapchicago.org/volunteers-interns.html to learn more about volunteering 

Thanks again for your time and contributions
story_txt:
HEY ALL!THANKS SO MUCH FOR HELPING US MEET OUR GOAL!But we're not done, but not by a long shot. Every dollar you continue to give past this point helps us continue to help women in the Chicago area. Please consider giving, even though you see our goal as "met" our needs are still great and your help is still vital to our cause.Who we areThe Chicago Women's AIDS Project (CWAP) mission is to empower women to take control of their own health and to live as fully and productively as possible. CWAP provides prevention, education, advocacy, and support for women at risk or living with HIV.What We Need and WHYOur resources are very limited and as government funding get's cut we could use every dollar you can give to help us provide support to the women we serve. The money you give goes to support these services.
Support Groups
Free Therapy Services
Project SASS- a prevention for positives group held in five week cycles in partnership with other agencies and clinics that address the needs and issues of women's health and adherence. 
Sisters Reaching Out- Peer health mentoring for HIV+ and HIV- women who have been previously incarcerated within the last year. Graduates become prepared to educate and make a difference in their community. 
How your money helpsEven small donations help CWAP go far in the support services that it offers. Some examples of reasonably sized donations that go the distance in helping CWAP are: 
$30 donation provides a healthy lunch to for 20 women at CWAP’s new Empowerment Group.
$50 donation provides bus card transportation to 20 women to get to crucial medical and support services.
However, please do not feel obligated to give donations this size, even the smallest donation can help us to grow and help women across the Chicago area!
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are not able at this time to financially contribute to CWAP please consider donating your time by volunteering, or getting the word out about our needs!
Visit http://cwapchicago.org/volunteers-interns.html to learn more about volunteering 

Thanks again for your time and contributions

story:
Join our collaborative movement,

We value growing our team to include you!  We need support to manifest our vision  to bring forth our educational journeys to Peru and other sacred journey locations around the globe while benefiting the local communities and children. We have wonderful social projects including solar light distribution, important nutrition permaculture projects while enriching the lives of the orphans children.

We are so proud of the great work taking place on the ground in Peru but they desperately need our support this year.  Sacred Valley Initiative, a registered non-profit 501c3, would like to partner with you this year in collaboration. Through crowd funding we aim to bring you the most amazing experience of a life time. We inspire to share this work with you first hand as we bridge magic places with educational experiences and special community outreach programs that opens us up to a new paradigm that unifies the globe and the supports the people on it.  



Please see our full Executive Summary and know we are looking for thoughtful companies, groups and universities to partner with to build a collaborative co-creative model bringing forth a better world and sustainable future for all of us.  Let us facilitate a once in a lifetime experience for you to come to Peru and participate in broadening your horizons while moving the planet toward a more sustainable and rewarding place for all of us to thrive. 

Prepared by: Kimberly Kaplan, Executive Director

Sacred Valley Initiative, 501c3 non-profit

Website: www.sacredvalleyinitiative.org 

Email: kim.sacredvalleyinitiative.org

Telephone: (314) 732-1278

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Objective

Sacred Valley Initiative, a 501(c)3 non-profit is dedicated to creating a more meaningful culture in North America where universities, corporations and social groups can support and participate in giving programs connecting sponsors to social service projects around the world.  Through enriching relationship based giving campaigns, service tours and global leadership educational programs, we facilitate collaborative efforts for the sustainability of the planet and prosperity of the lives involved. 

Problem

America is currently undergoing a systemic shift where corporations are beginning to implement green initiatives, sustainability acts and awareness and giving programs, where money is deducted from employee paychecks and other incentives to give to charitable projects.  However, in the midst of all this, donors lack a meaningful connection to charitable causes. The current model commonly keeps donors at arms-length and disconnected from beneficiaries-you don’t interact or exchange benefits with them.

Solution

Our projects are mutually beneficial for all parties, both the donor and the recipients.  We identify projects that would potentially bring the donors closer and give them a sense of connection to where their funds are going. There is a gap where Sacred Valley Initiative can tap into a huge need and reach companies and employees wanting strong personal connections and a real face to their giving.  Indigenous villages have many lessons to share and we will incorporate this rich wisdom tradition from the communities that we support to empower and impact Americans to live and work in more harmonious ways and more in balance with the Earth.

Target Market

We are attracting and appealing to a broad donor base.  They range from a wide variety of places; corporations, active/ adventure groups, progressive universities, and cultural, spiritual and global enthusiasts.  These are people that already have a giving culture and helping them see where their funds are going and forging that sense of connection has intrinsic value to them. Providing that connection can both better retain their giving over time and in many cases dramatically increase it. Secondly, we tap into previously under-served markets. There are people that want to give but aren’t. By offering a wide range with different levels of involvement and participation, we attract and have an appealing aspect of what we offer to support our social projects and bring connection. For companies and organizations, there are many layers of involvement that can take place, for example, employees can visit Peru first hand on a service trip and cultural tour or a more structured leadership training can take place.  Corporate giving can occur as well. There are also under-served potential people in Peru. We will support ongoing poverty, malnutrition, orphaned and abandoned children and environmental concerns that we will address.  Within the first two years, we would be approaching progressive companies and universities that would be taking their giving programs to the next level of involvement while improving the global economy.

Competition

As Sacred Valley Initiative is a relatively new and small player in giving, we want to be cognizant that there are probably organizations with a bigger footprint, more renowned, established or have been around longer to the extent with greater economies of scale and access to more funds.  And while that is a real challenge, we think that there are several ideas that work to out advantage.  With our Executive Director, Kim Kaplan having lived in Peru the past three years, we have an advantage of the deep relationships and experience we have established on the ground.  These connections are invaluable as they have allowed us to start partnership giving programs immediately without being crowded yet and start the right authentic ones that allow meaningful relationships.  Sacred Valley Initiative has the advantage to travel to cities where the ideal markets and development needs are.

Team

We are working with experts on the ground in Peru with our project developments in sustainability and global initiatives to improve the quality of life with the utmost integrity while sustaining the indigenous cultures. We are closely connected with the Presidents of the Indigenous communities with which we work and with accredited permaculture and sustainable agriculture players in the design and development of green houses and support for our nutrition programs.  Key partners on the ground in Peru also include deep relationships across the hotel, restaurant and tourist sections, including high-end luxury resorts down to all price point levels of accommodations that can meet any leadership training or group tour needs. We have a wide range of top-level NGO’s (non-governmental organizations) we are working closely with in the development sector of projects we support.  We have sustainable tourism partners who are an accredited and insured travel agencies to organize the trips and events in Peru that are flawless streamlined experiences surpassing all parties expectations.  An international team of experts are available to build, train and lead substantial curriculum for leadership trainings and service trips who include, book authors, environmentalist, and industrial psychologists integrated with local Shaman and culture history specialist to maximize an enriching culture experience.  We have the team that covers all aspects necessary for the success of our mission.  To the extent it is scalable, we will need legal and accounting council as we grow and increase staff.

Social Impact

The social impact of connecting meaningful corporate giving programs to Sacred Valley Initiative will bring awareness and create a more cohesive work environment by enriching and satisfying the human desire to give.  Donors will gain satisfaction, wisdom, while bridging the globe with cultural awareness and deeper human connection. This is forging a new horizon benefiting all participants on a global platform.  The future of Peru and our children’s projects, including orphan aid, educational programs and school development projects with nutritional agriculture aspects: brings forth health, well-being and the actualization of positive self-esteem to underprivileged children that would otherwise not receive opportunities to develop ideally.

Milestones

At six months, we will have talked to eight businesses, universities, and interest groups and expect to have 500,000 dollars committed from our sponsors.  The building development of a school and cultural interactive center in Peru is underway.  At one year, we will have talked to 20 businesses, universities, and interest groups and expect to have 300,000 dollars committed from our sponsors.  So by year end, we will have a total of 800,000 dollars committed by our sponsors.  Also, at the end of year one we will have achieved the following milestones: Completed our first school development project, supported eight orphaned children with aid and subsidized a community with solars lights which currently do not have electricity. However, if we have not been successful we will withdraw our requested stipend until the time we have achieved the year one business objectives. In addition, we will provide each investment group bi-monthly progress reports including successes, issues, problems, and new opportunities. And to ask for their recommendations and suggestions. etc.  Year three-five: emerging into new markets with model in other geographical areas for trainings and social initiatives. i.e. Africa, Tibet and Nepal.

Budget

For our social enterprise of educational journeys to Peru and other remote locations in the world to manifest, we need $8,000. This start-up initiative has been inspired by Founder, Kimberly Kaplan's work with executive summary writing at Washington University's Skandalaris Center of Entepreunerral Studies and her work with Channel 9 Network- KETC digital storytelling class enabling her to be a community producer with the station. 

Our sustainable and orphan children's support in Peru and stateside to flourish we need, an overall annual requirement of $18,000.

Description

Time/Quantity

Unit Price

Cost

Marketing: Web hosting, design, maintenance, and printing.

First year

$  3,000

$  3,000
Travel to promote and bring development journeys to the green audience. First year $10,000 $10,000

Legal/ Accounting Consulting Fees

First Year

$ 2,000

$2,000

Equipment: Video Camera, Communication Supplies

 (in-kind donations welcomed)

First Year

$ 1,000

$  1,000
Orphan Aid: Clothes, education, supplies, and health care 

First Year

$  1,000

$  1,000
Solar Light Distribution to families without electricity  First Year $800  $800 
Education for a Special Child's Life.  Impacting one at a time. First Year $200 $200
       
       
       

Total

$18,000

*Travel expenses for pitching the idea to companies and universities in key markets and building travel to Peru and other global initiatives this upcoming year.


IN KIND DONATIONS:

Airline Miles for travel and fundraising campaign trips for Tours and Corporate Funding

Video and Camera Equipment

Water Filters

www.sacredvalleyinitiative.org

www.kimkaplanyoga.com

story:
The story of Nova Runda (New Round)

Who is behind Nova runda?

Marko Filipin finished faculty of mathematics and he currently works in a bank, but every free moment, during last 5 years, he used for homebrewing. He is the head brewer of Nova runda, and there's no an obstacle which will stop him to use every ingredient possible to make quality beer. Miroslav Šuvak finished faculty of economics, and he recently quit his job so he can 100% focus all of his efforts to establishing their dream - Brewing a craft beer in Croatia. He worked as an IT Specialist at his previous company. He enjoys visiting beer festivals where he can try new beers. America will be his next beer travelling adventure, but that will have to wait - Brewery first, everything else - second :). Marko and Miroslav are friends since childhood, and that's also one of the reasons why they are so devoted to accomplishing their goal, they know each of theirs advantages and disadvantages.

    

Rewards - Perks

Rewards start from stickers, beer mats, and T-shirts with our brewery logo, and will be topped off with some specials - such as a beer paddle for the beer flight. The most valued reward, and probably the coolest one is -> a chance to name our beers!! A few of you will have a chance to brand our beers - one beer which will be one time brewed only, and one which will be season brewed!!! 

To take full advantage of some of the rewards, you will have to be in Croatia - our ultimate backers will enjoy brewing with us in the brewery! You will have your dreams come true and become an assistant brewer!  As assistant brewer, you will help our head brewer with everything from milling the grain to pitching the yeast!! You will see what craft brewing looks like, from the beginning to the end!!

Great wall of Founders

Maybe it's not tangible or as big as the Great wall of China, but in the digital world, it's the wall of great importance!! Your brick helped build that wall, and helped us achieve our dream. This part of our web site will never go off!!! We will always be proud of you.

Custom made wallpaper

The man responsible for our logo - our designer - will make you a beautiful wallpaper with our logo on it. As a proud backer, your name, or whatever else you choose, will be written on that wallpaper! 

Sticker

Take it off, and put it wherever you want - let it be a reminder for you and all of your friends how you backed a noble cause - the Croatian craft beer revolution!!!!

Beer Mat

It has our logo printed on both sides making it a great place to put your favourite beverage.

Voucher

Come on, admit it. You always wanted to visit Croatia! Now you have the most important reason - to try our beers in pubs all over the Croatian capital, Zagreb. With this voucher, you have the right to order 1 pint of our beer for free, so come on, hop on a plain and come to Zagreb, we are waiting for you!!!!

T-shirt

A colored T-shirt in all sizes. Oh, did we mention they have our logo in the front and the back!!

Tote bag

Pint

Our pride - the Holy pint!! It doesn't matter which beer style you are pouring into it, because our logo will be visible even if it's the darkest Stout or if it's the lightest Helles! Cheers!!!!

Beer paddle

Paddle? For what? Well for the beer flight, of course :) 

Every paddle is unique because it's hand crafted by one small craft shop near the city of Varaždin. You'll have an engraved logo of Nova runda craft brewery on it, and there will be holes for 3 different beer samplers to put on it!!!! Or you can simply put it on your wall as a souvenir.

The Impact

The Croatian beer market is overpopulated with classic commercial euro lagers, and it's dominated by 3 biggest breweries. Until recently, only lager type beers were being produced in Croatia. We want to start something that will change and disrupt our boring beer market! Help us bring our beloved craft beer to the Croatian market and help us pursue our homebrewing passion. The Croatian market deserves this, as well as Croatian consumers.

We love the craft beer movement, and the idea behind it because it's focused on 3 things:

  • Beer
  • Individual (Brewer)
  • People

These 3 things create an infinite loop which can only be improved over time. We are passionate about our beers, and we want to make them better with every new batch.

We want to brew ales - our biggest idols are craft breweries from USA, UK and Ireland, but we also love British brewers of cask ales. We are thrilled by the fact that in the USA are more then 2700 breweries and that they can coexist by brewing beer out of passion and love. Last year when we visited UK, we were surprised by the amount of beers offered in pubs and with the overall beer appreciation. We want something similar here in Croatia. So, our plan is quite simple - we are going to produce only kegged beers, un-pasteurized and un-filtered, so our consumers can enjoy beer when it's fresh - to feel all hoppy aromas and malt characteristics. We will use as many Croatian ingredients as we can, but we will also import hops. Aromas given by American hops should be noticed when the beer is being poured on tap. Our first beer will be Nova runda APA (American pale ale), but after that, we are planing to brew IPA, Porter and Brown ale. With this standard styles, we are preparing some surprises as well :). At some point, we would like to offer cask ales on a regular basis, but that moment will have to wait - for now! 

First, we were planing to buy a new brewery for us, and last year we finished our business plan for it.  We knew we can only count on ourselves, but a new opportunity knocked at our doors. One brewery offered their existing facility in which we will brew our beers - allowing us to slowly start with our business of raising beer awareness in Croatia - so we became the first Croatian contract brewers!!!


Our friends!!!!

We bet you liked that song in the background of our video. That's one of the best Croatian bands - Stoner rock band C O J O N E S!!! Guys are cool and they allowed us to use their song "Rocker" in our video!!!! They just came back from their European tour, and they are available for future gigs! There'll be maybe a beer/music collaboration in the future :). Tnx again Cojones!!

All Croatian digital community and Internet portals were great support to us, as well as American and UK beer bloggers which posts were battery charges during our planning of this campaign. Rory, Nate, Mark, Justin, Andy, Tim, Pete, Reuben, Melissa and others - thanks!!!!!! We have to mention great community which respects great beer - Campaign for really good beer (CAMRGB) of which Miroslav Šuvak is proud member!!! They learned us not to be a beer snobs, but to respect beers!

Special thanks to the guys from Enegren Brewing Company. When we were in the researching mode, these fellows answered all our questions, and also helped us with their advices. They are similar to us - long time friends and homebrewers (ok, there's 3 of them, and 2 of us :)), decided to open a small scale brewery and now they are doing great. We hope one day we'll visit them in Moorpark, California and try their beers!!!!


Other Ways You Can Help

We hope you have found this project interesting, and that you'll back us!!! We are doing all of this because we love to brew beer, and we love to drink craft beer! Since on Croatian beer market currently doesn't exists a single craft brewery which makes hoppy American ales, help us by sharing our project on your social networks, and tell your friends about it!  

Oh yeah, and don't forget, you' re helping to start something great in Croatia. 

Croatian craft beer revolution!!!!!

Until recently, only lager type beers were being produced in Croatia. We want to start something that will change and disrupt our boring beer market! Help us bring our beloved craft beer to the Croatian market and help us pursue our homebrewing passion. The Croatian market deserves this, as well as Croatian consumers.We love the craft beer movement, and the idea behind it because it's focused on 3 things:
Beer

Individual (Brewer)

People

These 3 things create an infinite loop which can only be improved over time. We are passionate about our beers, and we want to make them better with every new batch.We want to brew ales - our biggest idols are craft breweries from USA, UK and Ireland, but we also love British brewers of cask ales. We are thrilled by the fact that in the USA are more then 2700 breweries and that they can coexist by brewing beer out of passion and love. Last year when we visited UK, we were surprised by the amount of beers offered in pubs and with the overall beer appreciation. We want something similar here in Croatia. So, our plan is quite simple - we are going to produce only kegged beers, un-pasteurized and un-filtered, so our consumers can enjoy beer when it's fresh - to feel all hoppy aromas and malt characteristics. We will use as many Croatian ingredients as we can, but we will also import hops. Aromas given by American hops should be noticed when the beer is being poured on tap. Our first beer will be Nova runda APA (American pale ale), but after that, we are planing to brew IPA, Porter and Brown ale. With this standard styles, we are preparing some surprises as well :). At some point, we would like to offer cask ales on a regular basis, but that moment will have to wait - for now! First, we were planing to buy a new brewery for us, and last year we finished our business plan for it.  We knew we can only count on ourselves, but a new opportunity knocked at our doors. One brewery offered their existing facility in which we will brew our beers - allowing us to slowly start with our business of raising beer awareness in Croatia - so we became the first Croatian contract brewers!!!Our friends!!!!We bet you liked that song in the background of our video. That's one of the best Croatian bands - Stoner rock band C O J O N E S!!! Guys are cool and they allowed us to use their song "Rocker" in our video!!!! They just came back from their European tour, and they are available for future gigs! There'll be maybe a beer/music collaboration in the future :). Tnx again Cojones!!All Croatian digital community and Internet portals were great support to us, as well as American and UK beer bloggers which posts were battery charges during our planning of this campaign. Rory, Nate, Mark, Justin, Andy, Tim, Pete, Reuben, Melissa and others - thanks!!!!!! We have to mention great community which respects great beer - Campaign for really good beer (CAMRGB) of which Miroslav Šuvak is proud member!!! They learned us not to be a beer snobs, but to respect beers!Special thanks to the guys from Enegren Brewing Company. When we were in the researching mode, these fellows answered all our questions, and also helped us with their advices. They are similar to us - long time friends and homebrewers (ok, there's 3 of them, and 2 of us :)), decided to open a small scale brewery and now they are doing great. We hope one day we'll visit them in Moorpark, California and try their beers!!!!Other Ways You Can HelpWe hope you have found this project interesting, and that you'll back us!!! We are doing all of this because we love to brew beer, and we love to drink craft beer! Since on Croatian beer market currently doesn't exists a single craft brewery which makes hoppy American ales, help us by sharing our project on your social networks, and tell your friends about it!  Oh yeah, and don't forget, you' re helping to start something great in Croatia. Croatian craft beer revolution!!!!!

story:
ACHIK

Achik is an organization that dedicates to promote the Guatemalan handcraft around the world, Achik was born as an iniciative to help the growth of small communities of Palopó, Guatemala. We went as a vacation trip and we observed the value of the handcrafted goods of the community, but they develop on a harsh life style, with poor incomes and without the opportunity to expand. So we decided to bet for this Guatemalan handcrafted goods in order to help them reach a global opportunity. 

We initiated by connecting with different workshops of Palopó, such as Ken Edwards Pottery. We proposed to all this workshops create a joint website platform in which they will be able to expose their products around the world and export this handcrafted goods. 


Achik is compromised with all these little communities and workshops to develop this project. However, they don't have the economic resources to start these operations worldwide. So, the purpose of this campaign is to obtain the financial support to start the project of selling via internet. We want people worldwide be able to collaborate with these poor communities and workshops in exchange of Guatemalan handcrafted goods and personal gratification.

                                                    What we need?

To start the joint website project we are asking for $6000. These money will be mainly used to develop Achik platform of handcrafts of Palopó, Gutemala. Also will be used to buy cameras and laptops for this workshops so they can upload all of their handcrafts by themselves. Once we have accomplished our goals towards the workshops and developed an efficient joint website, Achik will continue helping these communities by giving goods (clothes, shoes, food, etc.) to the children and families of Palopó.


                                        PERKS

$1 - Thanks 
We appreciate every help. You will be receiving a grateful e-mail for your contribution.


$5 - The people of Palopó already loves you!
You are contributing for the poor communities of Palopó to growth their opportunities. You will be receiving e-mail post cards of the beautiful landscapes of Palopó.
$10-  You got yourself a valuable photograph of the kids of the community!
We will be sending you by courier beautiful pictures of the kids of the community with a big THANKS smile.
$20- A video full of greetings from Palopó! Yei! and a Doll!
We will send you a special e-mail with a video of the kids and people of the community yelling special thanks to YOU! Additional handcrafted doll to remember this beautiful place.

$50- Your Brand New T-Shirt! 
You will be receiving a special handcrafted mayan T-shirt with all the colorful weavings that represent Palopó. 
$100- You need a new set of pottery? You got one random piece of original and unique handcrafted pottery from Guatemala.
We will send you a brand new set of handcrafted pottery to remember Guatemala everyday!

$150-You want more souvenirs ? We will be send you several handcrafted goods
You will be receiving a special T-shirt, handcrafted dolls and a special piece of pottery for your home! sounds great? 

         Do you make a difference? You sure do!

When people around the world think of Guatemala, what comes to mind are the weavings and handcrafted goods, their unique designs and their bright colors. Guatemala is recognized as the home of the Mayan culture with beautiful landscapes, lively markets and rich culture. All of these attributes are captured in each of the handcrafts and give as a result something delightful. 

By supporting Achik you will be contributing for the people around the world get in touch with these beautiful weavings ad handcrafts, in order to expand the Guatemalan talent. Also you will be contributing for the growth of these poor communities by giving workshops opportunities to grow and giving the families and children a better future.

  ONE LITTLE DONATION FOR BETTER FUTURES


The project of ACHIK requires a primary high investment, and we are aware that is difficult to find the financial resources. So if we do not accomplish the goal we are asking for, we assure you will receive all of your perks and the little profit we get will be used to buy goods of first order needs (food and vesting) which will be donated to the people of the communities in Palopó, Guatemala. But in the long term we will continue pursuing the development of these poor communities.

                    The Risks of Our Project 

All projects have risks, ours is not the exception. Our biggest obstacle is the lack of education of these communities and the poor conditions of living of all the workshops and families. It will be hard road to make people capable to use the joint platform and upload the photographs of all the portfolio of products. However we already have the key connections with workshops and institutions that dedicate to the promotion of these communities, one of our biggest allies is Ken Edwards. Ken Edwards is the founder of the pottery workshops, now he is not completely involved in the management of the workshops, he delegated de charge to Guatemalan persons of his trust, he admires the capacity of the Guatemalan people, he realizes that they are plenty capable of learning, understanding and specializing in the development of manufactured good. He began his journey in México, as an adventurer who is moved by art, handcraft, and working people. Later on he go to Cuba, other countries of central América, finally arriving to Guatemala, where he is committed to impulse the development of the Palopó communities. 

Hand by hand with Ken, we gain the trust of the people in Palopó, he is known as a man of word, because of what he had contributed to the community, so with his advice and support we will get the people to listen us, to understand the reach of our protect, and to learn from us. 


                       Other Way to Help ACHIK

We will appreciate every type of help! Please share this campaign with all your friends and family so we can have a greater awareness worldwide. Help ACHIK, Help Guatemala, Help each family have bigger opportunities we all be grateful with YOU!

story:
Communautique fait appel à vous pour soutenir le développement de son atelier de fabrication numérique : échoFab, engagé dans la 3e révolution industrielle!

Une invitation à venir vous familiariser avec les imprimantes 3D, découpe laser, et bien plus. Un accompagnement par une démarche avec photos, vidéo, rédaction, positionnement, brainstorming, pour documenter et bonifier votre journée d'exploration.

Les Fab Labs visent à ouvrir les portes de la production d'objets au public comme l'Internet a démocratisé le journalisme, les communications et le monde de la publication.

Ils accueillent des communautés qui collaborent autour de projets réalisés à l'aide d'imprimantes 3D, découpe laser, micro fraiseuse numérique, équipements d'électronique, techniques traditionnelles et plus.

Ainsi, échoFab est un espace de participation où tous peuvent accéder aux technologies, apprendre à créer, réaliser leurs projets et partager leurs connaissances. Il offre un lieu de vulgarisation, d'invention et de fabrication de solutions concrètes au travers la co-création d'objets de nouvelle génération documentés, réplicables et améliorables.

Après 3 ans de recherche et développement, échoFab arrive dans le Quartier de l'innovation de Montréal où il pourra accueillir davantage de participants et participantes, de nouveaux équipements et offrir de nouveaux services.



échoFab offre à la communauté

  • d'actualiser et rehausser les compétences et les connaissances des participants et participantes au Fab Lab dans ce nouvel environnement technologique;

  • de favoriser la collaboration entre pairs, la valorisation des expériences;

  • l'opportunité de réaliser un projet personnel ou collectif;

  • d'encourager l'innovation et la création en ouvrant aux individus l’accès à des équipements polyvalents, des matériaux variés et des réseaux d'échange de connaissances;

  • de sensibiliser aux avantages de la revalorisation des matériaux, la réparation et la réutilisation des équipements;

  • de fournir un lieu public pour explorer les nouvelles technologies et participer à leur développement d'une manière responsable;

  • d'être un phare pour le démarrage de Fab Labs au Québec.


Votre soutien permettra à échoFab :

  • d’offrir à différents publics l’accès aux équipements et à l'accompagnement;
  • d’acquérir de nouveaux outils de fabrication;
  • de contribuer au développement d’autres Fab Labs.

Nous vous sollicitons pour un montant de 1 000 $ en tant qu'organisation ou entreprise, 125$ pour participer à un groupe, ou tout autre montant pour un reçu de charité !


Nous espérons vous compter parmi nos donateurs. N’hésitez pas à partager dans vos réseaux et à mutualiser vos possibilités pour former un groupe.
Pour vous inspirer :
  • Le site d’échoFab;
  • La chaîne vidéo d’échoFab;
  • Imaginons nos Fab Labs;
  • Le site de Fab Labs Québec;
  • Fab Labs : Démocratiser l'innovation, Article de Marine Corniou, Magazine Québec Science, mars 2014;
  • Apprends-moi ce que tu sais, je te dirai qui nous sommes, par Maud Emmanuelle Labesse, revue Kaléidoscope, Vol.1, no.1, mai 2013.

L'équipe de Communautique - échoFab vous attend !

Au Carrefour d'innovation INGO

situé au 355 rue Peel, suite 111

Montréal (métro Bonaventure)

Locaux accessibles aux fauteuils roulants.


Communautique est une organisation bien ancrée au Québec, reconnue pour ses pratiques en réseau, en innovation citoyenne, en culture ouverte, en entrepreneurship collectif, en biens communs et en inclusion sociale.


Communautique est enregistré à titre d'organisme de charité au numéro : #885686725RR0001


    Imaginons nos Fab Labs

story:
Who We are & What We Do

My company is called cartridge for a cause LLC.  The concept is simple- we collect empty/unused ink and toner cartridges and cell phones at no charge and donate a portion of the proceeds to Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank.  All materials that we CAN recycle we do.  Therefore we are focused on keeping these items out of our nation's landfills while at the same time alleviating hunger in Western Pennsylvania.


We need a work van and operating expenses to take this business to the next level and increase our donations to Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank. The Food Bank does VERY important work.  They are a non profit that collects and distributes food through a 380 plus member network in 11 counties in Western Pennsylvania. Our company exists to help their cause. 



    The Impact

    Every cartridge/cell phone that we collect can result in the equivalent of ONE MEAL OR MORE donated to Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank.  With your donations we will be able to reach more businesses and service larger accounts thus resulting in larger donations to the Food Bank and help for more people who need it.

    Our company is under a year in existence currently, and already we have been able to donate the equivalent of 7,880 meals to the Food Bank.  We have over 100 business partners in Western Pennsylvania and counting.  About half of these partners are listed currently on our company website.

    Don't forget- September is Hunger Action Month!


      Our Challenges

      Currently we are servicing all of our accounts out of an '08 Ford Fusion which does not allow for a big volume of ink/toner cartridges to be carried in one run. Thus the need for a larger vehicle, not only for this fact, but to be able to service larger clients on a regular basis.
      We also offer our services to our clients FREE OF CHARGE.  We offer the recycling bins free and pick up the product at no charge as well.  Therefore an influx of funding will be very helpful to keep up with the costs of the bins, gas, supplies, etc.

      Where the Money Will Go

      $8,000 to $12,000

      We are looking to purchase a used extended work/cargo van that is reliable, with a warranty, and that will last at least a few years. 


      $2,000 to $3,000

      This amount is earmarked for purchasing recycling bins (public and back office) for new clients.  This includes graphics for the bins.

      $1,500 to $2,000

      This money will be used to pay Indiegogo fees and to donate directly to Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank from "perks" chosen resulting from your donations. This will also be used to pay for some of the actual perks offered.

      $1,000

      This amount will be used to purchase shipping boxes, packing tape, shipping supplies, etc.

      $1,000

      This will be used for marketing to secure new clients for the program.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      We recognize that not everyone will be able to make a monetary contribution to this cause.  If you feel strongly about it, please spread the word to get to others that may be able to contribute.

story:
The Outsider received a $250 matching fund for donations received between 5/19 and 5/23. If you are thinking about making a small donation to support independent media and the arts, use this opportunity to double the value of your contribution.



Donate Bitcoin to wallet address: 12MA58iQi4ThnQR1kJLGg8qMdWnvHgZUyb


The Outsider is a San Francisco Bay Area community driven new media project that combines local news and arts coverage with a free multi-vendor online store platform exclusively featuring Bay Area DIY makers. By launching The Outsider we are creating a new self sustaining model for local journalism while strengthening local economy for artists, artisans and creative innovators.

We need your support to help launch this project and give us a chance to take root. By contributing to our Indiegogo campaign you are supporting local independent media and local DIY economy.

Local makers with shops hosted at The Outsider will form the backbone of our community, so rather than creating a media organization beholden to large corporate advertisers or an affluent boards of directors, the compass of The Outsider points towards our community.

Our online store platform makes strengthening local DIY economy an achievable reality. We will work to include the tailors, jewelers, CSA farmers, bands, artists, furniture makers and others already working in our area in our free and accessible DIY marketplace. Vendors will never pay any fee to The Outsider to operate their online store and unlike other online marketplaces they will not be lost in a sea of competing accounts.

Driven by a fee added to sales on The Outsider's online shops we will create a newsroom of professional journalists with a commitment to the Bay Area's unique cultures and communities. We are already working with some outstanding local talent and are expanding our team. We intend to create a steady diet of in depth local news that will inform and reflect on the important issues facing our community.

But the project can't work without your help to bridge the costs of our launch and allow us to establish our place in the market. Unlike many not-for-profit media ventures, The Outsider just needs a push to become self sustaining.

A new effort for independent local journalism couldn't come at a more critical moment. Media consolidation has left many of the once independent voices in the Bay Area bought out or consolidated. Corporate interests exert increasing pressure, and increasing influence, over our political system and development pressures are displacing our communities.

To build this new model for local journalism we have invested in a cutting edge website that hosts the online store platform, serves its own video and is devise responsive. But there are still things we desperately need. We need upgraded equipment to bolster the multi-media style that will be at the heart of the project. We need a place to work out of and we need to treat those people putting their effort into the project fairly. Please help us create this important community resource.

To those of you who have supported this project in some way already, we deeply appreciate your help. Thank you! Please take a moment to help us spread the word by sharing this page on social media. Also help put us in touch with Bay Area based makers in your social circles as we reach out to make this project the broadest possible community effort.

Questions about the project? Contact us at Editors@TheOutsiderNews.com

story:
Hello Everyone!

Hrothgar here again-  Are you ready to make awesome *yet again*?
This year's Crystal Mountain Pony Convention is going to be great- But we're gonna make it even better- Because that's what we're here to do!  We're making another CMPC Commemorative Medallion and this is your chance to help make it happen! (and get this coin for as cheap as they'll ever be offered!)
Just to give you an idea- Here's what we're making this year-
  • Completely new designs made by Convention Artist Sciggles and our own Courtney!
  • Make CMPC that much more awesome- Commemorative Medallions!
  • We did a huge thing last year-   This year we have the chance to make one Even Better!

So why do you need my moneys!?

Put simply, I need money to make this happen-  I'm asking for 500, but the coin is actually going to cost around $800... or more.. but we'll get to the stretch goal in a bit~  Here's approximately where the money's going.

*apologies for pie charts


That's right,  100% of this is going toward making the coins and shipping them around.  Any excess from this project will be going toward the artists and funding CMPC directly.  That excess means:  Any extra money left over from making and shipping the coins and any extra coins, which will be sold at the convention itself-

So, what do you get?

For starters, check out last year's coin~

We're making a whole new coin this year-  The only things staying the same with this coin the size and the serial numbers.  So check out what's coming!

New Designs!

Animator CrickeyDave will be designing our tails this year, and our very own Courtney will be designing Heads!  Stay tuned, the designs are coming soon!

New Finish!

We're going with a Black Nickel finish-  Check out this google images search of black nickel coins for an idea of what that looks like!

Stretch Goal!

This year we're going bigger than ever-  If we hit $800 before May 25th  (EXTENDED- now we have until June 1st), Not only will we have that beautiful, bold black, we'll have gold on it too-  I went looking for images of it.. but it's evidently too awesome to post-  We'll just have to imagine that bright gold against the black nickel~

Perks-

  • $1 At this level, you get our thanks for helping to make this happen-  We love you!
  • $20 You'll have one coin waiting for your at CMPC!
  • $30 You'll have 2 coins waiting for you at CMPC!
  • $100 Not only will you have 2 coins waiting for you at CMPC-  We'll shoot one with a gun of your choosing (provided we have access to it), record it and give you the casing, coin, and bullet (if we can find it)
  • Also, don't miss the early bird specials-  get this year's coin at last year's fundraiser prices!
Addons- (please note, none of these addons may applied to the $1 perk)
  • (EXPIRED- Reserve your serial number as soon as you donate!) +$5 Priority Serial Number selection!  You can pick your Serial number(s) as soon as you donate! You only need to add this once to select numbers for all of your coins! (Regular reservations will open when the campaign closes)
  • +$5 Domestic Shipping-  Get your coin shipped to you anywhere in the US!
  • +$10 International Shipping- Get your coin shipped to you anywhere customs will allow me to!
  • (Expired, only donations from before June 2nd are elgible) +$15 Extra coins! Get one extra coin per $15 
So what happens if we don't make $500?
Well, that's... kinda tough for me-  I'll be rustling up the funds out of my own pocket to make sure the coin happens this year-  But no matter what, a coin is happening!

So what do coins do for CMPC?

They make CMPC probably the only Pony Convention to have their own coin~  And even if someone else makes one-  We were the first-  The coins are a big way to help CMPC be more awesome in a couple ways- 

  • Coins are freakin' awesome!
  • Last year's coins were a big part of helping CMPC stay afloat for this year-  Help CMPC and get something awesome in return!
  • You were with us last year and we did it- Made it all the way-  How cool is that!  Now let's do it 2 years in a row!
  • I'm committed to making this happen this year-  I'm putting about $800 of my own money where my mouth is-  Won't you join me?

So, what could go wrong?

Last year, we had a few problems-  Between having a decent way to deliver the coins at the convention and that, aside from the coins, I had nothing else to give to CMPC from the coin campaign-  This year we're going to  address that.

  • It's true.. Last year's perks cut things way too close.  This year won't have that same problem
  • Shipping!  Last year I hadn't enabled international shipping- yet I still found 4 donations from other countries-  It was amazing, so this year we're adding international shipping as a real option!
  • The coins could be delayed at the mint and miss the convention-  I'm prepared for that too.  You'll get your coins.  I'll find a way to get them to you-  

So, aside from money, how can I help?

Share!   Make videos!  Draw!  With the limited amount of time for this campaign, there's less time to get the good word of CMPC commemorative medallions around! And don't forget to use those share links~  They'll take people directly here!

story:
Short Summary

This October 23,000 Detroit properties will be auctioned off to the highest bidder for prices starting at only $500. This is an incredible opportunity for investors and speculators, but also a personal tragedy for the estimated 20,000 occupants of these properties. Most of these people face eviction and displacement when someone else buys their home.

We are contributing $500 each to 10 deserving families, which we initially selected because they had tricycles or other signs of young children in the front yard.

Help deserving Detroiters STAY PUT instead of MOVE OUT. 

Help them own their own homes.

Help turn a traumatic life event into an opportunity.

Help keep people in Detroit who want to stay.

Help preserve the family home of a child.

Help us give them a fresh start. 

What We Need & What You Get

We're raising $500 to buy Detroit houses at auction for 10 deserving families for a total of $5,000. (The goal of $5555 is for indiegogo and other fees). 

  • If we meet our goal, each family will have enough to place the starting bid to buy their home.
  • Families are all expecting that their houses will sell for over $500, but what we earn will help them get closer.
  • The United Community Housing Coalition, will apply the money toward the purchase of each house at auction. 
  • If we exceed our goal, there is more to go around!  Additional funds will be 1) spread out among the 10 families for house prices greater than $500 and property taxes. 2) Applied to covering the [minimal] costs of running this campaign and 3) Handed over to the UCHC which will apply it to auction purchases for more than just our 10 original families.
  • We are already on target to well-exceed the fundraising goal. Vetting for additional families has begun!

Who We Are

The Tricycle Collective has a 3-tiered approach:

1) Root Cause Activism- Work with local government and non-profits to reduce foreclosure

2) Education- Inform and empower residents of foreclosed homes with information about the foreclosure and the auction.

3) Direct Action- Raise money to help buy auctioned properties and so residents can stay put rather than moving out. All of our candidates live in houses with tricycles in the front yard- these are homes to young children. THIS is what the fundraising campaign is about.

Our team includes:

  • Michele Oberholtzer- is a Detroit writer, engineer and community activist 
  • The United Community Housing Coalition- is a Detroit non-profit that has helped buy over 1,000 homes at auction. They provide counseling, legal support, financial counseling, and expertise in the auction process. They charge only $25 for all their auction services and also provide ZERO% INTEREST loans where possible, to those who cannot pay the full amount of their home's auction price. 
  • The Families- Represent thousands of other Detroiters who face hard times for various reasons and, in many cases, deserve a second chance. We will profile each of the families throughout the campaign. 
What do you get? How about the chance to make a disproportionally massive positive impact on someone's life for astoundingly little money? Not enough? Check out our perks. We try to show you love but we don't spend big money to thank you for spending money because that's really not the point. 

Impact

Every time we help a family stay in their home, we offset the traumas of foreclosure and positively impact all levels of community. 

  • The Residents: Foreclsosure abruptly displaces people in ways that almost always lead to reduced quality of life. Eviction can mean children pulled out of school, parents losing jobs after missing too much work, entire families victimized by scammers or other predators.
  • The Property: Properties sold at auction often become blighted buildings as scrappers strip them of valuable pipes, wiring, and appliances as soon as the former residents move out.  
  • The Neighborhood: Communities are fractured by foreclosure. Fewer neighbors mean fewer eyes on the street and a weaker community network. Fewer occupied houses means lower property values and greater risk of crime. 
  • Local Government: Some people displaced by foreclosure will move away, lowering city population. Everything from school budgets to utility bill rates are affected when population drops. Some people displaced by foreclosure will stay, increasing the number of people in the city who need government support, such as housing, to survive.

All this can be avoided when we help people STAY PUT instead of MOVE OUT

Risks & Challenges

  • You never know what will happen at the auction! A few rich speculators can make the prices of these homes soar with the click of a button. Prices start at $500 but UCHC predicts that our homes will sell for an average of $1250. Even then, there's no guarantee. 
  • WORST CASE SCENARIO, we will buy a home for only one family. Projections based on past year's experience tell us we will be able to serve many more.

  • Our fundraiser will end before the auction begins so that the money is in place to bid on the properties. Donors will not know the outcome of the auction until a few weeks after their contribute, but don't worry, we will absolutely follow up.

Other Ways to Help

We understand not everyone can contribute, here are some other ways you can help:

  • Share our story! Follow, Like, Comment on and Share our activity Facebook, Twitter and Instagram
  • Educate yourself about the tax foreclosure issue:
http://www.occupy.com/article/exposed-tax-evictions-could-displace-20000-detroit-property-owners
http://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/27/us/detroit-needs-residents-but-sends-some-packing.html?_r=0
http://www.huffingtonpost.com/michele-oberholtzer/detroit-auction-preview_b_5765322.html
  • Come and see us in Detroit sometime. We'd love to have you!

We understand not everyone can contribute, here are some other ways you can help: 
Share our story! Follow, Like, Comment on and Share our activity Facebook, Twitter and Instagram
Educate yourself about the tax foreclosure issue:

http://www.occupy.com/article/exposed-tax-evictions-could-displace-20000-detroit-property-owners
http://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/27/us/detroit-needs-residents-but-sends-some-packing.html?_r=0

story:
Short Summary

"IOTA LABS" - Israel IoT HUB will be an innovation center that includes all of the activities relating to the "Internet of Things" (IoT) in Israel, the Israel IoT HUB Eco-System, and Israel IoT StartUp Community.

Join our efforts and be part of this technological revolution!  "IOTA LABS" - Israel IoT HUB will be an innovation center that includes all of the activities relating to the "Internet of Things" (IoT) in Israel, the Israel IoT HUB Eco-System, and Israel IoT StartUp Community. Our IoT Meetup group is the largest IoT community in Israel with almost 800 developers, entrepreneurs, investors, and startups, and these dynamic meetings showed us the need for an Israeli Hub in the IoT field.  The startup nation is the best place for innovation, and such a hub will be a true melting pot between developers, entrepreneurs, vendors, and investors.

Founders : 

Sasha Tabak - CEO and founder IoT ( Internet of Things ) Israel MeetUp 

                             (aprox. 800 members)

http://www.meetup.com/Internet-Of-Things-IoT-Israel/

                         CEO and founder IOTA LABS - Israel IoT HUB 

http://www.meetup.com/IOTA-LABS-Israel-IoT-HUB/

                         CEO and founder Robotics Israel MeetUp (more then 450 members)

http://www.meetup.com/Robotics-Israel/

                            CEO and founder RoboGeek - Israel Robotics HUB

http://www.meetup.com/RoboGeek-Israel-Robotics-HUB/

Eyal Hay - Co-CEO and Co Founder of- IOTA LABS - Israel IoT HUB and IoT Israel Meetup.

http://www.meetup.com/Internet-Of-Things-IoT-Israel/

http://www.meetup.com/IOTA-LABS-Israel-IoT-HUB/

  

What We Need & What You Get

$500,000 will allow us to establish and maintain the world’s first IOT Hub raised and built by its own community.  We will be able to establish sharing space, meeting space, a hub accelerator for startups in early stages, and an IOT Hub Fund for advanced IoT startups.  Additionally, we will be able to continue to stay at the forefront of IoT technology through a research unit and an advanced educational unit.  We will be able to maintain Israel’s place at the head of the IoT world through an international relations unit, for cooperation with foreign investors and startups. We will be building the best eco system in the industry in the heart of the Startup nation.

We have a wide variety of perks based on different levels of support, from a coffee cup at the Hub to board membership and right of first refusal for new startups.  There are opportunities to present your ideas to the meet up group, have research for your business done by hub members, and much more.  Every dollar of support counts, and every contributor will be a member of the hub community.

In more details:

We need 500K $ for cover following expenditures:

Permanent:

rent (aprox 500 sq. m.)

land tax

electricity

water

refreshments

management

One time:

renovation

furniture

fridge

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Perks:

 deal-flow entrance  

coworking space ( Open Space 200 m, Test Lab 150 m, 250 Office Space )

Test Facility ( Testing Lab )

Accelerator entrance ( 3-5 month program with 200K$ support and Demo Day,

subject for criteria suit)

Direct funding ( seed, round A, round B, round C )

Educational unit ( most advanced tools , industrial courses)

Research Unit ( most advanced research )

MeetUps and Seminars

In-house conference discounts

International Unit ( quick time to market for HUB StartUps, foreign Investors  )

more details:

http://www.meetup.com/IOTA-LABS-Israel-IoT-HUB/

If goal not be reached money will be returned or 

place less then 500 sq. m. will be rented

The Impact

Building HUB based on crowdfunding  campaign will give equal opportunities

to all HUB members.

HUB directed to early startups developers (their membership fee will cost around 25-30 $ per month for space at HUB)

HUB will be focal point for most advanced IoT ( Internet of Things ) StartUps

and entire eco-system ( investors, business developers,vendors)

HUB will based on IoT ( Internet of Things ) Israel MeetUp community members : 

http://www.meetup.com/Internet-Of-Things-IoT-Israel/

and now contain aprox 800 ppl, IoT startups innovators, developers, university students, researchers, lecturers, makers.

We believe that "IOTA LABS" - Israel IoT HUB will become the unique center for all IoT activities in Israel. Your support of "IOTA LABS" is vital to ensure building the most innovative IoT Technologies worldwide. 

Risks & Challenges

HUB will be established if at least 200 ppl (developers, funded startups, vc, biz developers, vendors, lawyers, auditors) will join hub.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our Crowdfunding campaign in all digital media:

fb, in, twitter an dmore

"IOTA LABS" - Israel IoT HUB will be an innovation center
that includes all of the activities relating to the "Internet of
Things" (IoT) in Israel, the Israel IoT HUB Eco-System, and Israel IoT
StartUp Community.
Join our efforts and be part of this technological revolution!  "IOTA LABS" - Israel IoT HUB will
be an innovation center that includes all of the activities relating to the
"Internet of Things" (IoT) in Israel, the Israel IoT HUB Eco-System,
and Israel IoT StartUp Community. Our IoT Meetup group is the largest IoT
community in Israel with almost 800 developers, entrepreneurs, investors, and
startups, and these dynamic meetings showed us the need for an Israeli Hub in
the IoT field.  The startup nation is the
best place for innovation, and such a hub will be a true melting pot between
developers, entrepreneurs, vendors, and investors.

Founders :  
Sasha Tabak - CEO and founder IoT ( Internet of Things ) Israel MeetUp 
                             (aprox. 800 members)
http://www.meetup.com/Internet-Of-Things-IoT-Israel/
                         CEO and founder IOTA LABS - Israel IoT HUB 
http://www.meetup.com/IOTA-LABS-Israel-IoT-HUB/
                         CEO and founder Robotics Israel MeetUp (more then 450 members)
http://www.meetup.com/Robotics-Israel/
                            CEO and founder RoboGeek - Israel Robotics HUB
http://www.meetup.com/RoboGeek-Israel-Robotics-HUB/

Eyal Hay - Co-CEO and Co Founder of- IOTA LABS - Israel IoT HUB and
IoT Israel Meetup.
http://www.meetup.com/Internet-Of-Things-IoT-Israel/
http://www.meetup.com/IOTA-LABS-Israel-IoT-HUB/
  
   What We Need & What You Get
$500,000 will allow us to establish and maintain the world’s
first IOT Hub raised and built by its own community.  We will be able to establish sharing space, meeting space, a
hub accelerator for startups in early stages, and an IOT Hub Fund for advanced
IoT startups.  Additionally, we will be
able to continue to stay at the forefront of IoT technology through a research
unit and an advanced educational unit.  We
will be able to maintain Israel’s place at the head of the IoT world through an
international relations unit, for cooperation with foreign investors and
startups. We will be building the best eco system in the industry in the heart
of the Startup nation.
We have a wide variety of perks based on different
levels of support, from a coffee cup at the Hub to board membership and right
of first refusal for new startups.  There
are opportunities to present your ideas to the meet up group, have research for
your business done by hub members, and much more.  Every dollar of support counts, and every
contributor will be a member of the hub community.
In more details: 
We need 500K $ for cover following expenditures:
Permanent:
rent (aprox 500 sq. m.)
land tax
electricity
water
refreshments
management
One time:
renovation
furniture
fridge
