Perks:
 deal-flow entrance  
coworking space ( Open Space 200 m, Test Lab 150 m, 250 Office Space )
Test Facility ( Testing Lab )
Accelerator entrance ( 3-5 month program with 200K$ support and Demo Day,
subject for criteria suit)
Direct funding ( seed, round A, round B, round C )
Educational unit ( most advanced tools , industrial courses)
Research Unit ( most advanced research )

MeetUps and Seminars
In-house conference discounts
International Unit ( quick time to market for HUB StartUps, foreign Investors  )
more details:
http://www.meetup.com/IOTA-LABS-Israel-IoT-HUB/
If goal not be reached money will be returned or 
place less then 500 sq. m. will be rented
  The Impact 
Building HUB based on crowdfunding  campaign will give equal opportunities
to all HUB members.
HUB directed to early startups developers (their membership fee will cost around 25-30 $ per month for space at HUB)
HUB will be focal point for most advanced IoT ( Internet of Things ) StartUps
and entire eco-system ( investors, business developers,vendors)
HUB will based on IoT ( Internet of Things ) Israel MeetUp community members : 
http://www.meetup.com/Internet-Of-Things-IoT-Israel/
and now contain aprox 800 ppl, IoT startups innovators, developers, university students, researchers, lecturers, makers.

We believe that "IOTA LABS" - Israel IoT HUB will become the
unique center for all IoT activities in Israel. Your support of "IOTA LABS" is
vital to ensure building the most innovative IoT Technologies
worldwide. 

Risks & Challenges  
HUB will be established if at least 200 ppl (developers, funded startups, vc, biz developers, vendors, lawyers, auditors) will join hub.

story:
Educational Services has been supporting agricultural

entrepreneurialism in Haiti to the benefit of many Haitian families.

It became personal after several team members survived the earthquake side by side with millions of shaken Haitians. Their request was help creating jobs in agriculture and help selling Haitian coffee. The once famous Haitian coffee industry was in ruins and its great taste was lost to the world. 

Now we have a chance to replant, re-educate and rebuild this once famous industry bringing back a vital livelihood to family farmers and reforesting the hillsides with trees that will change lives.

                                       

A seed planted today yields coffee in two years

Working in collaboration with Makouti Agro Entreprise, Partners of the Americas' Farmer to Farmer program and Haiti Coffee, our goal is to plant 250,000 seedlings over the next 5 years.  
We currently are planting 25,000 seedlings in 10 locations at a start up cost of $4 per tree.
Each tree is estimated to produce a net profit of $1 in its first harvest two years from now and more in subsequent years. Not only is this vital to the environment, but to the livelihoods of the coffee producing families who are wrestling against climate change, coffee beetles, coffee rust, deforestation and a lack of capital to replant. Your assistance can make all the difference.
                                   

Haiti once produced 50% of the world's coffee

It's hard to imagine that political strife, embargoes, deforestation and climate change could take that away from us. Image what that means to those whose livelihood depended on those trees. In the 1940's coffee made up 40% of Haiti's GDP.  Replanting coffee will once again have a huge impact but it has to start with planting the seeds and re-educating the industry. Haitian coffee has the potential.  It closely resembles Jamaican Mountain Blue.  And yes, we are planting the Blue Mountain Varietal.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us spread the word about our campaign and about Haitian coffee
  • Follow our progress on Facebook
  • The more people hear about Haitian coffee the more people will ask for it at their local coffee shop
  • Close the loop from farm to cup by visiting HaitiCoffee.com and try it.  It's awesome!

story:
Updates:

  • Matching donor contributed $25,000. Let's raise the rest to get to keep this pledge!
  • eBook now offered as a reward


What is AidGrade?

AidGrade is a 501(c)(3) non-profit that gathers results from impact evaluations and synthesizes them using the most rigorous statistical methods to tell you what works where. We are uniquely situated to tell you what works where, but we need your help to get more results out.

What is an Impact Evaluation?

How effective development programs are has traditionally been guesswork. NGOs now pay a lot of attention to evaluation, but there are many different ways in which projects might be evaluated. Impact evaluation specifically refers to a causal evaluation that can attribute a particular effect to the program itself.

What’s the difference? Suppose one observes that after a program provided textbooks, test scores rose. This would be observable through monitoring and evaluation. However, if one does not know what would have happened to test scores in the absence of the program – the counterfactual – one cannot say that test scores rose because of the program. Perhaps test scores would have risen for everyone, regardless of whether they or their class received textbooks. Impact evaluation allows one to say whether a program itself was responsible for an observed outcome.

"Randomized controlled trials" are one example of a method often used in impact evaluation, but other impact evaluations use quasi-experimental methods.

What is a Meta-Analysis?

A meta-analysis is the best way to synthesize information for evidence-based action. If you want to donate money to charity or be an activist for a cause, you'd like to know which types of interventions are most effective so you can really have an impact! 

Meta-analyses take the results of multiple studies and combine them to get a better understanding of the effectiveness of a type of program. An individual study’s results could be affected by random chance or by the specific setting in which it was conducted. By combining multiple studies, a meta-analysis provides more accurate and precise estimates of the effectiveness of a type of program. A meta-analysis can also tell us how the results of a program vary with its setting. This is useful to know if you want to predict the impact a program will have in a new setting.

What Role Does AidGrade Fill?

Meta-analyses are widely used in medical research and other fields to reach practical conclusions on the effectiveness of different drug therapies, surgical procedures, etc. However, meta-analyses are much less frequently used in development economics. Academic economists have few incentives to conduct them, and most NGOs and other development organizations lack the capacity.

This is where AidGrade comes in: we have the technical skills to rigorously carry out these meta-analyses and are devoted to covering a broad range of topics to help NGOs and other development organizations maximize their impact.

Our Meta-Analysis Innovations

We also have made three innovations to the way meta-analyses are currently carried out.

First, our search process is very inclusive. By taking a broad approach, we maximize the use of the data we collect. Typically, if a group of researchers wants to conduct a meta-analysis, they will do a comprehensive literature search, screen the papers and determine a set they want to use for the analysis. If another group of researchers disagrees with the screening criteria, they have to start again from scratch. We take a different approach: we collect data on all sorts of papers but code up their characteristics, so that if someone later wants to restrict attention to the set of papers that meet more restrictive criteria, they can do that. This saves time and effort in the long run and provides a public good.

Second, we are able to do this while keeping costs down by breaking down the meta-analysis process into small enough steps that they can be done by interested volunteers who have undergone training. This is citizen science!

Finally, we want our results to be widely used, so we developed a unique meta-analysis app that lets people conduct their own meta-analyses using our data. First, we have online tools that show the effects of a given program (e.g. unconditional cash transfers) broken down by different outcomes (e.g. enrollment rates). As you can see below, we provide both the effect size and a confidence interval for each outcome, and one can easily look at all of the effects for a given program. 

Similarly, one can easily compare the effects of many programs for a given outcome, as shown below:

Some filters are also provided on our meta-analysis app so as to enable one to restrict attention to a subset of papers that meet certain criteria (e.g. blinded randomized controlled trials).

The Need

We have already completed 10 meta-analyses covering a few hundred impact evaluations; developed a website with a unique meta-analysis app that allows you to conduct your own analyses using our data and provided download functionality; and have another set of 10 meta-analyses nearing completion.

Incredibly, everything we have done so far has been for less than $100,000 - you won't find anyone else able to do this so cost-effectively.

But we need your help to keep going. Over the next year, our priorities will be to:

1. Finish off our second set of 10 meta-analyses

Our second set of meta-analyses includes mobile phone-related interventions, micro-health insurance, and women's empowerment programs, among others. We want to finish these and add them to the website.

2. Promote the results from all 20 of our meta-analyses

We will be producing a series of briefs, working papers, blog posts, and other content to package the findings from our meta-analyses in ways that NGOs, development organizations, individual philanthropists, and academics can easily use to maximize the impact of our work.

3. Add new filters to the meta-analysis app

Want to search results by something else, such as by region? Support us and we'll implement these changes to the online meta-analysis app. We have dozens of filters we could add which are already coded in the data.

4. Complete new research on how much we can extrapolate from past results and under which conditions, as well as on other issues such as specification searching and publication bias

We are in the unique position of being able to answer the question of how much one can generalize from past results and under which conditions. With a database of a few hundred impact evaluations, we can also shed some light on how much publication bias and specification searching affect the field. If you want to learn more about our early work in this area, click here.

5. Conduct meta-analyses of new topics

There are many more important programs to be covered. You can help us get there.

Perks

In exchange for your support, we can offer you the following perks:

  • Infographics: As part of our promotion strategy we will be producing infographics that compare the effects of different programs. We will also explore other issues aside from these "core" infographics, such as how much funding certain programs receive compared to how much we know about their effects. These will be available as either digital graphics or as posters. You can also get your name on these posters, as a key supporter of innovative economic research!
  • Beta invites: Whenever a site is updated, early users are needed to test it out. Want a sneak peek at our results?
  • Tweet shout-out: You are wonderful for helping. We let the world know!
  • eBook: Get an electronic copy of "What Works in Development: 10 Meta-Analyses of Aid Programs".
  • Join the party: You will be invited to an exclusive event in DC.
  • Grey T-shirt with text: "I gave... to help you give better" or "Effective Altruism" (choice of T-shirts).
  • Tote bags: Support our work while being trendy!
  • Chat with Eva: An in-person, phone or Skype chat with AidGrade's founder, Eva Vivalt.
  • Custom literature review: A literature review on your topic of choice, featured on the AidGrade website.
  • Custom meta-analysis: A meta-analysis on your topic of choice, featured on the AidGrade website (conditional on feasibility - contact if interested!).

Other Ways You Can Help

You are very important. You can help get the word out! E-mail your friends and colleagues and share on facebook and other social media.

story:
SAVING OUR STANDARDS MEANS SAVING OUR JOBS AND CLIMATE ...       

Problem:  The notion that we can't afford positive change is unacceptable. Even in mid-term scenarios we will all end up losing if we continue with production methods and consumer behavior that can best be called cheap. We don't need cheap things that eliminate our own income and standards and add to the destruction of a human-friendly world.

(Part of the) Solution:  Our own daily purchasing decisions determine economic demand for products and services. If we want responsible businesses, then we will have to be responsible consumers. This will even save our jobs. We need to start preferring goods that are based on our values, which include high wages for workers and high environmental standards that we have established over centuries. Choosing this path is the first and foremost element of any successful strategy for overcoming our economic and environmental calamities. 

With EURESPONSIBLE, we want to help organize positive change by bringing together responsible citizens and companies. 

Structure and Tasks EURESPONSIBLE

  1. EURESPONSIBLE will conduct and commission scientific research & responsible market analysis. 
  2. EURESPONSIBLE will advise companies on Responsibility Management & Reporting. It will also advise consumers on responsible market behavior.
  3. The EURESPONSIBLE Responsibility Index is to make "the good" visible to consumers, also at the point of sale. It will provide a platform for those companies that are willing to contribute to shaping a better and more sustainable economy. 
  4. EURESPONSIBLE will use part of its income to plan and implement responsibility projects that aim at creating sustainable business models at a small scale. It will also plan and implement social and ecological offsetting projects.

The founder will form EURESPONSIBLE as a non-profit social enterprise (German corporate law) by the end of the year and use the donations raised here for a) commissioning research and b) funding journalists (currently unemployed) that we plan on hiring for eco-social reporting from European countries. 

Thank you very much for taking part in positive global change! 

Please visit the website for more information:

www.euresponsible.eu (English)

www.euresponsible.org (Deutsch)

Please also like us (and become friends) on Facebook!

https://www.facebook.com/euresponsible


BACKGROUND: (Please take a few minutes to read)

Despite a multitude of scientific reports that urge us to radically change the way we organize our societies and economies, there is continued failure to acknowledge that we must act now to preserve a human-friendly earth. 

We need to ask businesses to add to market stability through creating new jobs and applying the highest social and ecological standards. But we must also recognize our own responsibility.

Preferring ethical and locally produced goods will help sustain and perhaps even increase our own wealth, while at the same time preventing further destruction of natural resources, the most important being our climate. We will also stop unfair labor practices in other countries.

EURESPONSIBLE will have the task of informing and convincing fellow citizens and companies on the necessity and benefits of behaving repsonsibly. 

It will have four departments:
1) Research (part of the money is for commissioning research or employing graduates)
2) Information & Education for citizens (eco-social journalism and info campaigns)
3) A Consulting Department that helps companies become more responsible (this is to become a main income source later) 
4) A Social Project Department (this is where a big chunk of income will go, once the enterprise is established and generates income)

Activities will include establishing a company index, which lists companies that commit to building an economically, socially and environmentally responsible market. The index will show member companies’ actual commitment, which in turn will provide guidance for citizens. With a rising number of supporters, the index will hopefully help establish new thinking among business and society at large.

EURESPONSIBLE INDEX

The consulting business will advise index companies on how to apply the principles of responsible behavior to all company activities. The company will also educate citizens on the potentials of participatory democracy and economy. We would like to work with official petitions and EU Citizen Initiatives, which have become part of the European Union’s official legislative process.

We also want to create a publication that will report on eco-social impacts of certain events in European countries. We would like to commission journalists in several EU countries that were laid off as a result of downsizing of media, following the economic crisis. This is to prove that citizens can organize themselves if they are interested in certain issues.

The social projects that EURESPONSIBLE will plan and implement will be designed to help less fortunate people in Europe as well as in other regions, predominantly Africa. Africa deserves attention: it is probably the least developed continent in the world. This is highly regrettable. On the other hand, it also provides for an opportunity to get things right from the start when really starting to develop the continent. Hence, EURESPONSIBLE will plan and implement development projects with a positive social and ecological impact, which can serve as lighthouse examples.

In general, EURESPONSIBLE will focus on Europe, as the founder is European. Some parts of the “buy local” theory may appear protectionist from a non-EU perspective. They are, in fact, protectionist in the sense that we should protect high standards that we have built over centuries. The only way to do that is to predominantly prefer goods and services that respect these standards: our own.

However, preferring ethically valuable and locally produced goods is a fundamental principle of responsible consumer behaviour everywhere around the world: this may be the only way to build a thoroughly sustainable world market, with common standards and the same set of rules and regulations, which can produce wealth for all, without destroying nature. Thus, the idea is global and if implemented globally we will all be better off. I would love to see more people being more responsible and helping to promote the idea. Therefore, the findings of our research (a holistic approach to society, economy and environment) will be shared with citizens around the world.  

We want to set up EURESPONSIBLE as a non-profit social enterprise (German law). A non-profit social enterprise needs to spend most of its earnings on activities with a positive impact on society. So, even if equipped with generous funding and income generated from advising companies on social responsibility, there will be clear limits to wages (including CEO) as well as administrative spending. Moreover, EURESPONSIBLE will not have to create any financial shareholder value, as the owner (the founder) of a non-profit social enterprise (German law) may not receive any dividends from operations. Thus, indirectly, the actual shareholders of a non-profit social enterprise are the citizens, through the provision that our activities must be non-profit-making and of public utility.

sustainable economy. 

EURESPONSIBLE will use part of its income to plan and implement responsibility projects that aim at creating sustainable business models at a small scale. It will also plan and implement social and ecological offsetting projects.
The founder will form EURESPONSIBLE as a non-profit social enterprise (German corporate law) by the end of the year and use the donations raised here for a) commissioning research and b) funding journalists (currently unemployed) that we plan on hiring for eco-social reporting from European countries. 
Thank you very
much for taking part in positive global change! 
Please visit the website for more information:www.euresponsible.eu (English)www.euresponsible.org (Deutsch)Please also like us (and become friends) on Facebook!https://www.facebook.com/euresponsibleBACKGROUND: (Please take a few minutes to read)
Despite a multitude of scientific reports that urge us to radically change the way we organize our societies and economies, there is continued failure to acknowledge that we must act now to preserve a human-friendly earth. 
We need to ask businesses to add to market stability through creating new jobs and applying the highest social and ecological standards. But we must also recognize our own responsibility.Preferring ethical and locally produced goods will help sustain and perhaps even increase our own wealth, while at the same time preventing further destruction of natural resources, the most important being our climate. We will also stop unfair labor practices in other countries.EURESPONSIBLE will have the task of informing and convincing fellow citizens and companies on the necessity and benefits of behaving repsonsibly. It will have four departments:1) Research (part of the money is for commissioning research or employing graduates)2) Information & Education for citizens (eco-social journalism and info campaigns)3) A Consulting Department that helps companies
become more responsible (this is to become a main income source later) 4) A Social Project Department (this is where a big chunk of income will go, once the enterprise is established and generates income)
Activities will include establishing a company index, which
lists companies that commit to building an economically, socially and
environmentally responsible market. The index will show member companies’
actual commitment, which in turn will provide
guidance for citizens. With a rising number of supporters, the index will
hopefully help establish new thinking among business and society at large. EURESPONSIBLE INDEXThe consulting business will advise index companies on how to apply the principles of responsible behavior to all company activities. The company will also educate citizens on the
potentials of participatory democracy and economy. We would like to work with
official petitions and EU Citizen Initiatives, which have become part of the European
Union’s official legislative process.We also want to create a publication that will report on eco-social impacts of certain events in European countries. We would like to commission journalists in several EU countries that were laid off as a result of downsizing of media, following the economic crisis. This is to prove that citizens can organize themselves if they are interested in certain issues.
The social projects that EURESPONSIBLE will plan and implement will be designed to help less fortunate people in Europe as well as in other regions, predominantly Africa. Africa deserves attention: it is probably the least developed continent in the world. This is highly regrettable. On the other hand, it also provides for an opportunity to get things right from the start when really starting to develop the continent. Hence, EURESPONSIBLE will plan and implement development projects with a positive social and ecological impact, which can serve as lighthouse examples.

In general, EURESPONSIBLE will focus on Europe, as the founder is European. Some parts of the “buy local” theory may
appear protectionist from a non-EU perspective. They are, in fact,
protectionist in the sense that we should protect high standards that we have
built over centuries. The only way to do that is to predominantly prefer goods and services
that respect these standards: our own. 
However, preferring ethically valuable and locally
produced goods is a fundamental principle of responsible consumer behaviour everywhere around the world: this may be
the only way to build a thoroughly
sustainable world market, with common standards and the same set of rules
and regulations, which can produce wealth for all, without destroying nature.
Thus, the idea is global and if
implemented globally we will all be better off. I would love to see more people being more
responsible and helping to promote the idea. Therefore, the findings of our research (a
holistic approach to society, economy and environment) will be shared with citizens around the world.  
We want to
set up EURESPONSIBLE as a non-profit social enterprise (German law). A non-profit social enterprise needs to spend most of its earnings on activities with a positive impact on society. So,
even if equipped with generous funding and income generated from advising
companies on social responsibility, there will be clear limits to wages (including CEO) as well as administrative spending. Moreover, EURESPONSIBLE will not have to
create any financial shareholder value, as the owner (the founder) of a non-profit social enterprise (German law) may not receive any dividends from operations. Thus, indirectly, the
actual shareholders of a non-profit social enterprise are the citizens, through the
provision that our activities must be non-profit-making and
of public utility.

story:
Project Vision

The Civil Rights Movement of the 1950s and '60s changed minds and laws, opening the door for many people to claim their human and civil rights: African Americans, Native Americans, women, Asians, Latinos, gays and lesbians, people with disabilities, and more every year. Today’s headlines remind us that rights must always be renewed and reaffirmed. This summer marked the 50th anniversary of countless civil rights milestones, beginning with the historic March on Washington for Jobs and Justice in 1963, where Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. gave his remarkable “I Have A Dream” speech. 

To give that cherished legacy its full weight, we all have stories that need to be told: those who were part of earlier movements know firsthand earlier struggles for civil and human rights in their own lives and communities; and younger generations standing today for equality, justice, and opportunity have the task of keeping those struggles alive.

All Together Now, a national project sponsored by the Center for Digital Storytelling, engages communities and individuals by using first-person stories to increase awareness of civil and human rights. All Together Now seeks to honor the legacy and impact of civil and human rights movements of the 1950s to the present day by collecting intergenerational and global stories of civil and human rights.

Stories will be shared in educational contexts, museums and public exhibitions, and community conversations around the world. The stories compiled in this project will support those who see themselves at the center of our collective story of social justice.


Support This Project

We have a wonderful group of local and national partners for this Storied Session series. They are helping to get the word out to workshop participants — and when the stories are available online, helping us invite others to contribute their own stories.


Make a Donation

We are donating our services to offer these Storied Sessions free of charge, and there are travel and overhead expenses as we take them across the country. If you can make a donation to help cover these costs, we'd be deeply grateful.

Match Your Gift

Ask your employer if your company will match your donation. If you would like to sponsor a matching gift, contact us for help.

Become a Supporting Partner

We'd love to talk to you about your organization becoming a cosponsor, lending your name to this project and helping recruit participants. Some sponsors are also providing Storied Session venues and lunch for participants (we need spaces large enough to accommodate 10 participants and two facilitators, with tables, chairs, and online access available. Access to computers for word processing is also helpful.) 

We are planning a second phase to this project, with a circuit of multi-day digital storytelling workshops. If you'd like to consider sponsoring or underwriting one, please email Allison at atn@storycenter.org.

story:
Who we are

I am Blerina, from Gjakova, Kosovo and I represent mothers of children up to 12 years old. In a developing country with a struggling economy, where people barely make their existence, bad habits flourish. Such habits include but are not limited to small businesses offering services on: violent video games, gambling, lotteries; drug use; clubbing; etc . Since these are the only activities our children are offered in their spare time, it has resulted in our children becoming violent, less oriented towards reading, school, health and the worst becoming practitioners of criminal acts.  We are highly concerned with the orientation our children have taken, therefore our future.

Our Campaign

Since schools can only afford to pay salaries for teachers and the rest of the teaching is theoretical, we have organized voluntarily to create a facility for our children, where they can spend their spare time. In this facility children will be offered different activities to play, read, exercise, create through crafts, paint, learn etc. This campaign is very important to us, because it will support us open this facility where we will try to pull children away from streets, drugs, gambling and violet games. Without your contribution, we cannot start operating the facility.

Why we need you contribution

In order to open the facility we need 10500$. So far, we were able to collect from our own contribution 3000$, but we need your contribution for 7500$ more, broken down as follows:

·  1500$ rent of the facility for three months

·  4300$ interior (wall painting, restoring bathrooms, small kitchen to serve water, drinks and snacks)  

·  2500$ inventory (seats, tables, shelves, drawers, carpets, shades, )

·  1700$ equipments (books, craft materials, paints, papers, pencils, scissors, costumes for theater acts, toys, etc.)

·  500$ electricity generator (since we experience electricity cuts daily)

 The calculations are made, to fit 50 children at a time. The funds are needed to start up the facility, since the objective is to make it self-sustained, by selling children art crafts, paintings, and theater shows.

What you get

In return to your contribution, we will send you by mail real perks made by children, such as: paintings, greeting cards and crafts. Not only you get a product, but you will also get a piece of emotions from every child.

In case we don’t reach our funding goal, we will still try to open the facility, but in that case it would be a smaller one. So, please help us with your contribution so we give a chance to every child in Gjakova to be positive, healthy and creative.

The Impact

This campaign is not only important for mothers of Gjakova and their children, is also important to our future. The children of today, are the leaders of tomorrow. Let us help them choose better options – read instead of videogames, play with children instead of gambling, handmade crafting instead of drug use, outside walks instead of wandering the streets.

story:
The Dream Defenders is a student run human rights organization at colleges throughout Florida. They are on the front lines sitting in at the Florida Capitol until Rick Scott convenes a special session to repeal the Stand Your Ground Law. They are doing important, life saving work.

I know so many of us want to do more, myself included, but many of us don't know where to start. So, we decided to start with what we know best. Cooking.

Cassandra Tucci and I are driving to Tallahassee on Thursday morning to feed the Dream Defenders a healthy, delicious lunch and dinner. We are also going to make some “sustenance packages” for them. We will be making food for approximately 50-60 people. We would be very grateful if you will assist us in buying groceries. We hope to raise about $500 and all of the money will go towards groceries. Anything we raise above and beyond the $500 will go towards creating an extra bountiful sustenance package. We are going food shopping on Wed morn so we have about 48 hours to raise this.

 Thank you in advance for your generosity and thank you to Chef Anthony of Chef Anthony's Ambroisias for providing us with fresh pressed juice.

Here is a video of them: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tb8w8W8AUeU

story:
Short Summary

HI my name is Louise Mckay and i am the grandma to Tatiana and Krista. I am a 53 yr old woman who loves her grandkids with all her heart.

Origanally this film was made to raise money for a home. But that didnt go well so we now just want to beable to take Tatiana and Krista traveling and show them our country and possably some of the USA and take them to the zoo and to Drumheller to see the Dinasaurs and take them and their siblings to Disney world.  We never know from day to day if our sweet little angels will be with us and we want to do as many things as we can with them and enjoy life and make memorys to keep in our hearts .  

We are on a strict income so we are reaching out to ask for help to make two little girls dreams come true. Please we dont know if tomorrow is promised for them and it would mean the world to us to  do these things with them. Please help us make their dreams come true. Your kindness will help us to take them across Canada and possably down in the USA  to do the things that the girls wish to do

What We Need & What You Get

The money that you donate will go for gas and  getting the girls into the places that they want to go and see. The funds will still go towards travel if we dont make our goal. We will just keep it in their savings account until we raise the amount we need to do the traveling. Please help these little girls dreams come true

The Impact

This is important to us as it will give our family alot of memories if by some awful chance God decides it is time to take our angels home.  We will know that they went happy because they seen the things that little girls long to see.  We did a campaign for their glasses as Krista is legally blind and raised more then enough to pay for glasses and our trip to vancouver to get them. Thank you to those that made that dream a reality. This campaign is  really important to us as the Girls suffer from seizures and have type one diebetes.  Please help our cause


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you cant help with donations could i ask you to please send this to your friends and family or someone that you might know who would be interested in my campaign.  Please use the Indiegogo share tools. I thank you from the bottom of my heart and God Bless you

story:
Refresh Farms

Refresh is about solutions.  Solutions to the problems facing the environment, our global food and water supply and our health.  At refresh, we are rethinking food, redesigning the farm and redefining agriculture.  By donating to our fundraising campaign, you’ll help us to continue to innovate and develop new technologies to farm more efficiently. 

The integration of hydroponics and aquaculture, aquaponics is a balanced ecosystem that virtually eliminates the harmful waste and environmental pollution common in many farming operations.  Aquaponic farms like ours can be located within city spaces preventing deforestation and reducing transportation.  Each day around the world, thirty billion gallons of freshwater are pumped for agriculture.  Our farm uses about five percent of the water that is used with traditional irrigation techniques by using recirculating aquaponic systems.  These systems also increase output, up to four times more food is produced per acre than with traditional soil farming. 


 

We are asking for $19,500 to increase the size of the farm and to make it more sustainable.  Farming more efficiently means less electrical dependence.  To accomplish this, we plan to build a greenhouse aquaponic system to reduce the use of artificial lighting.  In addition, the money raised would be used to purchase solar panels to reduce our electrical expenses.  Two thousand watts of solar power will cut our current electrical bills in half.  Your donations will create less draw from the grid, less impact on the environment and lower operating costs.

By using production techniques that foster the environment instead of depleting our resources, we can simultaneously produce more healthful and nutritious food.  Growing food sustainably involves using no chemical fertilizers, herbicides or pesticides. It means working with nature, instead of against it and not interfering with natural cycles in our environment.

 

What We Need

We need to raise $19,500 for the following additions:

$6,500 2000W Solar Panel System
$11,500 Greenhouse Aquaponic System

 

What You Get:

$5   A big high five and thank you!
$10  Bumper Sticker
$25   Beverage coozie printed with the refresh logo  (80 available)
$50   Tote bag printed with the refresh logo  (40 available)
$100 A reFresh t-shirt.  (50 available)
$250 A t-shirt, tote bag, coozie and bumper sticker. (20 available)
$300 A 2013 Refresh Farms CSA share.  We are offering lettuce, basil, kale, beets, carrotts, cucumbers, pumpkins, snow peas, winter squash, watermelons, sage, and a variety of tomatoes including san marzano, amish paste, green zebra, striped german, cherokee purple, and brandywine.This CSA will run for 18 weeks from the middle of June until late September.  Pickups will be at the farm on Thursdays throughout the season. 
$500 Spend a day on the farm.  Visit the farm for some hands on learning.  See how we run our aquaponic systems.   
$1,000 you’ll get a personal consultation.  Your choice of on location at the farm, at your location within 100 miles of Syracuse, or online via Skype.  An opportunity to ask questions and to learn about aquaponics and sustainable farming. 
$5,000  Have one of the new aquaponic growbeds dedicated in your honor
$10,000 We'll come to your location (within a 250 mile radius of Syracuse, NY) and build an aquaponic system like the one we have on the farm in your space. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! About Refresh and about aquaponics.  Tell everyone!

Like us on facebook   www.facebook.com/refreshfarms
Follow us on Twitter   @refreshfarms
Find us on Instagram   http://instagram.com/refreshfarms

story:
Short Summary

My name is Courtney Hollenbeck and I recently graduated from Anderson University with a degree in Music Education. My passion has always been in the performing arts, whether that be onstage, in front of a camera, behind a camera, or in the classroom.
Upon nearing the end of my student teaching, my fantastic cooperating teacher, Sarah Hassler, noticed that I still had a bit of the performing bug, to say the least. She referred me to a local talent agency named Helen Wells Agency. It is THE largest and most reputable talent agency in the entire Midwest. Some of Helen Wells clients include Reebok, Febreze, Proctor & Gamble, Adidas, Macy's, and so on. (www.helenwellsagency.com).
 
I would love to be able to become an actress. This has always been a dream of mine since a very young age. My mother can attest to this fact: sometimes I would spend hours playing out scenarios in my room, or I would make up my own songs and dances and perform them for the family. However, as a newlywed, it is difficult to come up with the funds necessary for this endeavor. That is where YOU can come in! :)

What I Need Help With

I attended an open call audition in Decemeber, where I gave them my headshot and resume. A few days later, I received the exciting phone call that they wanted to use me in their agency and get me started on auditions! The only requirement to join their agency is a photo shoot.

This photo shoot is a 2 hour appointment where I model 5-6 different looks. From these photos, the agency will put together a "comp card" which will include my headshot, all of my stats, and then 4 different smaller looks on the back of the card. This card will be sent out to various clients, upon which they will decide if they want to see me for an audition.

The photo shoot costs $650. The additional $50 that I added onto that cost was for any clothing I may need to purchase for the shoot, and also for gas money as I have to travel 45 minutes both to and from the location.
 
The money will jumpstart me towards an ambition I have had my whole life, but have never really thought I was capable enough, or good enough, to accomplish. Now that I see the dreams are becoming more attainable, the only thing that is difficult about this dream is the funding to get there.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

I am not asking for someone to give $100. I am not even hoping for $50 from one person. All I am asking is for $5 to $15! If 47 of you who are reading this gave me $15 a piece, I will have reached my goal!! ((If paying with Paypal, please note that it is still under my maiden name of Courtney Monk. This is indeed me, do not be thrown off by this! :) )
 
I realize that money is tight right now. Believe me, I understand as much as anyone! But any donation will help. And I will be so grateful for this opportunity. Who knows where it may lead me! It may end up not working out. It may end up being a fun, every so often weekend hobby. Or it may end up being quite a substantial form of income for my household!
 
If you cannot help fund, I would appreciate it if you could just share this link to people on your Facebook friend's list, or in your email list.
 
I appreciate all of the help and support already!
 
My parents have always told me to find something that I LOVE to do, and then find a way to get paid to do it. I have found that something. Now I just need your help to get me there.
Thank you so much!
 
-Courtney Hollenbeck
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Courtney Hollenbeck and I recently graduated from Anderson University with a degree in Music Education. My passion has always been in the performing arts, whether that be onstage, in front of a camera, behind a camera, or in the classroom.
Upon nearing the end of my student teaching, my fantastic cooperating teacher, Sarah Hassler, noticed that I still had a bit of the performing bug, to say the least. She referred me to a local talent agency named Helen Wells Agency. It is THE largest and most reputable talent agency in the entire Midwest. Some of Helen Wells clients include Reebok, Febreze, Proctor & Gamble, Adidas, Macy's, and so on. (www.helenwellsagency.com).
 
I would love to be able to become an actress. This has always been a dream of mine since a very young age. My mother can attest to this fact: sometimes I would spend hours playing out scenarios in my room, or I would make up my own songs and dances and perform them for the family. However, as a newlywed, it is difficult to come up with the funds necessary for this endeavor. That is where YOU can come in! :)


What I Need Help With
I attended an open call audition in Decemeber, where I gave them my headshot and resume. A few days later, I received the exciting phone call that they wanted to use me in their agency and get me started on auditions! The only requirement to join their agency is a photo shoot.
This photo shoot is a 2 hour appointment where I model 5-6 different looks. From these photos, the agency will put together a "comp card" which will include my headshot, all of my stats, and then 4 different smaller looks on the back of the card. This card will be sent out to various clients, upon which they will decide if they want to see me for an audition.
The photo shoot costs $650. The additional $50 that I added onto that cost was for any clothing I may need to purchase for the shoot, and also for gas money as I have to travel 45 minutes both to and from the location.
 
The money will jumpstart me towards an ambition I have had my whole life, but have never really thought I was capable enough, or good enough, to accomplish. Now that I see the dreams are becoming more attainable, the only thing that is difficult about this dream is the funding to get there.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
I am not asking for someone to give $100. I am not even hoping for $50 from one person. All I am asking is for $5 to $15! If 47 of you who are reading this gave me $15 a piece, I will have reached my goal!! ((If paying with Paypal, please note that it is still under my maiden name of Courtney Monk. This is indeed me, do not be thrown off by this! :) )

 
I realize that money is tight right now. Believe me, I understand as much as anyone! But any donation will help. And I will be so grateful for this opportunity. Who knows where it may lead me! It may end up not working out. It may end up being a fun, every so often weekend hobby. Or it may end up being quite a substantial form of income for my household!
 
If you cannot help fund, I would appreciate it if you could just share this link to people on your Facebook friend's list, or in your email list.
 
I appreciate all of the help and support already!
 
My parents have always told me to find something that I LOVE to do, and then find a way to get paid to do it. I have found that something. Now I just need your help to get me there.
Thank you so much!
 
-Courtney Hollenbeck

story:
Heidi’s Story

You probably know Heidi. If you do, you’ll know that she has chosen to devote her life to the care of others, serving some of New York’s most traumatized and underserved children and youth through drama therapy. You’ll know that she is a loyal friend, always ready to help. You’ll know that she has a big heart with ample space to love a child. You’ll know that she is courageous, smart, passionate, creative and more than well equipped to be a single mom in NYC! 

In winter 2012, Heidi entered into a carefully thought-out process of adopting a child from Honduras. For those of you who are unfamiliar with this part of the world, Honduras is a gorgeous country with an incredible array of natural resources and rich cultural history, from ancient to modern peoples. At the same time, 50% of the Honduran population lives below the poverty line and children become available for adoption in the neediest cases or in cases of abuse/neglect, where reconciliation has failed.

International adoption is lengthy, costly and an emotional rollercoaster for the parent-to-be. When we found out about Heidi’s plans, we decided that this was an adventure she should not have to travel solo. We invite YOU to join US in helping bring this extraordinary mother-to-be and her child together by making a financial contribution that will make a difference.

Your entire donation will go directly to Heidi’s adoption fund, bringing a child from Honduras to a family – and village - of love.

“Wait!” you say, “I have some questions!” 

We thought you might. So we asked Heidi to tell us a little more about her decision before requesting your support. 

 Heidi, what made you choose to adopt? 

All my life, I’ve wanted to have children and always thought about the possibility of adoption.  There are so many children out there who need homes and the idea of sharing my home with a child who would not otherwise have a safe place to live feels like an important gift that I can give.

 Why have you chosen Honduras as your adoptive country?

I did my research! Poverty in Honduras has left many families with little choice but to abandon their children on the street or place them in orphanages. The Honduran orphan population is at an all time high. The good news is that the orphanages take good care of these children, assuring that they have the best possible beginning in the most difficult circumstances.  In addition, Honduras is one of a few countries still open to single women adopting and is close enough to NYC geographically for my adopted child to be able to continue a relationship with his or her country of origin.

 How much will the adoption cost? 

  • AGENCY FEES: $9,000  
  • HOME STUDY + Post-placement/Administrative costs: $5,000 HONDURAS PROGRAM FEE: $19,000                       
  • TRAVEL to/in HONDURAS: $8,000                                   
  • IMMIGRATION & GOVERNMENT FEES: $1,225 
  • TOTAL ADOPTION COSTS: $42,225

What do you look forward to most about being a mom?

Everything that I anticipate is wonderful about raising a child and everything that I don’t know is ahead of me!!! 

What has been the most surprising/crazy/exciting/anxiety-producing/fun part of the adoption process thus far?

The amount of paper work is no joke and although I was forewarned. I don’t think any adoptive parent could be prepared for what’s involved.  However, I think the most surprising thing is how supportive my community has been. Everybody I know, especially my friends in NYC, are extremely busy and yet they took on this project and this feels like the biggest gift to me ever.

 What do you want to say to all your fans out there?

I am so grateful for everyone’s support of me during this exciting but difficult and emotional process. I can’t wait for you all to be a part of this child’s life – he or she is going to love and need you too!!!

 What do you want to say to your future child?

I am sitting here thinking of you. I don't know anything about you yet. I don't know if you are a boy or a girl or even how old you will be when we meet. I sit here wondering what you will be like, what you will sound like, what your personality will be, what you will like to do. Will you like sports or music? Will you be a writer or a doctor or an actor? Will you be laughing all the time or making others laugh or will you be serious and pensive, contemplating the deep things of life. No matter what, you will be perfect to me.

Your life will a bit different though. You will have two families and be from two countries, which I think will be pretty cool because most kids belong to one. But the best part for me is that I get to be a part of your life in NYC.

All I know is that I want you to live to the fullest potential you have and do anything you want to do. And my greatest desire is to be your mom and walk with you through this world.

I love you so much already, even though I don't know where you are or even if you are born yet. I can’t wait to bring you home and introduce you to your whole family.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that money’s tight and that not everyone will be able to make a substantial financial gift but there are other ways you can help.

  • Get the word out to your loved ones, especially people you know who might be moved to help with this campaign
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! We want to see Heidi’s campaign all over Facebook and other social networking sites! 

We look forward to celebrating September 10th -- Honduras' Dia del Nino (Children's Day)-- knowing that we have raised the funds needed to bring Heidi's child home.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that money’s tight and that not everyone will be able to make a substantial financial gift but there are other ways you can help.


Get the word out to your loved ones, especially people you know who might be moved to help with this campaign

Use the Indiegogo share tools! We want to see Heidi’s campaign all over Facebook and other social networking sites! 
We look forward to celebrating September 10th -- Honduras' Dia del Nino (Children's Day)-- knowing that we have raised the funds needed to bring Heidi's child home.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Ryan Donnelly and The San Francisco Bachelor Auction

My name is Ryan Donnelly and I am helping The Guardsmen raise money for at risk youth by putting myself up for auction at The 9th Annual San Francisco Bachelor Auction on June 21, 2012.

 

I'm a friendly and outgoing guy who just moved to San Francisco from New York.  Right before moving out here, I spent a month and a half in Botswana working at an aids orphanage and doing HIV/AIDS research. When the Guardsmen asked me to help their cause, I jumped at the chance.


The Guardsmen

Through fundraisers, such as The Bachelor Auction, The Guardsmen sends 2,500 youth to outdoor education programs and provides scholarship support to more than 250 students at Bay Area private schools each year.

However, there are many more Bay Area kids that need help, and that is why The Guardsmen have partnered with IndieGoGo to raise money online.

Please help me raise $1000 in the next 2 weeks through IndieGoGo - enough money to send 5 local kids to camp for a week this summer.

 

Help me raise $1000 to support The Guardsmen 

$1000 is what it costs The Guardsmen to send 5 kids to camp for a week this summer, or provide a scholarship to a child for one semester.

The Guardsmen is committed to making sure that fundraising dollars are spent wisely, with the greatest need and highest returns always in mind. In fact, greater than 90 cents of every dollar raised goes directly to support programs for kids.  In comparison, most top rated charities generally spend 75% of their budgets on programs.

 

More About Me

You can find out more about me by viewing My Profile on The Bachelor Auction website.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Share my campaign on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Attend the Bachelor Auction in person.
  • Contact The Guardsmen and get involved!

story:
Who is York Grooming Co.?

We create handmade grooming and skincare products specially designed for men from natural products, the finest essential oils and safe synthetics and deliver them right to your door.

We use great ingredients like shea butter...

and natural coconut oil

Shaving with proper products is really important

A man will shave approximately 20,000 times in his life. Twenty thousand times, passing tiny blades that slice the hairs just above the skin, trimming between 5,000 and 25,000 hairs each time you shave. Without the proper products his skin will feel the consequences! Proper shaving has become a lost art. Today’s average male has no clue about the fine art of the traditional wet shave that their grandfathers and some of their fathers used to take part in. Instead, they’re accustomed to the cheap and disposable shaving products that companies regularly market. I’m not sure when or why it happened, but the tradition of passing down the secrets of a clean shave abruptly stopped. Thankfully, this glorious male ritual is making a comeback.

Most products that exist are not good for you...

With that said, there are few companies that exist that are creating high quality men’s grooming and skincare products. The big box companies create products that have more bad things in them than good. If you’re like most guys, you’ve probably been getting your shaving cream from a can; this blue/green, chemically laced goop does nothing for your skin and smells like a hospital.

We've created a better way!

We believe that there are three elements to a perfect morning ritual:

Introducing the York Grooming Co. Shaving Kit

We have designed three products that will give you a great morning ritual and a clean, fresh appearance. The formulas we have created are unique and absent of irritating ingredients:

The money will help us manufacture the products.

We will be using our raised funds to help us manufacture the products. We have bundled these three products together to make the the York Grooming Co. Shaving Kit. By doing so, we are able to give you a dramatic discount on your purchase, and if you buy a longer subscription, you'll get an even bigger discount.

We want to make it easy and convenient to get our products to you

To do this, we have created a subscription model.  We deliver a 2 month supply of our products every two months, automatically, if you subscribe to a 6 month or 1 year plan. If you subscribe to the 2 month plan, you will recieve one shipment.  For example, if you subscribe to the 6 month plan, you will initially get a 2 month supply sent right to your door.  After 2 months, another package will arrive with a new set of products.  If you don't need them yet, just let us know and we'll delay shipping.  If you need them sooner, same thing, let us know, and we'll get you the products sooner.  It's easy!

You can help by contributing and/or sharing with friends

And that’s all there is to it.

FAQ

Q/ The perks say it will last for 2 months, how do you know?
A/ The product sizes are actually 60ml, which, with regular use, is about a 2 month supply.  The great thing about York Grooming Co. is that it is a subscription service, so if you order the 6 or 12 month supply you will get a new set of products every two months.  Don't worry, you will get an email before we send anything where you can delay shipment if you havent used up your supply.

Q/ Is shipping included?
A/ We are offering free shipping to Canada and the United States for our Indiegogo backers!

Q/ When will you start to manufacture?
A/ Once we get to 100 kits we’ll begin production immediately. I hope you can help us bring this great product to market.

Q/ Do I need a straight razor or shaving brush to use these products?
A/ You don't need to use a straight razor or shaving brush with our products, but you can!  You can use the same tools that you use now, but a shaving brush does help getting a better lather.  Basically, you can substitute our products for what you are using now and you will get a better product.

Q/ What is the ingredient list?
A/ Our initial ingredient list for each of the three products is as follows (note the INCI names on the package may differ slightly)

The face cleanser has water, coconut oil, almond oil, sunflower oil, olive oil, glycerin, potassium hydroxide, steric acid, citric acid, vitamin E, beeswax, boric acid

The shaving cream has water, glycerin, shea butter, coconut oil, sunflower oil, steric acid, glycerin, potassium hydroxide, vitamin E, cetyl-stearyl alcohol, boric acid, kaolin clay, citric acid

The post shave moisturizer has water, shea butter, almond oil, stearic acid, cetyl-stearyl alcohol, Vitamin E, beewax, glycerin, carbomer, potassium sorbate

story:
Step by Step Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to enhancing the lives of underprivileged children. At Step by Step every day we work to create change and to make the dreams of children around the world become a reality. This is why we created a partnership with Horses N Heroes.

 Horses n Heroes is a non profit organization dedicated to providing an equine learning and mentoring experience for young children who come from families with extreme financial constraints. At no charge, these kids are given the opportunity to bond with horses and are taught all aspects of horsemanship including but not limited to riding, grooming, feeding and caring for the donated horses.

Horses N Heroes completely runs on donations, which is why we need your help

What We Need & What You Get

For every $15.00 you give us , we buy Shavings for one week for one horse, and you receive a Step by Step Foundation Wristband.

For every $25.00 you give us, we buy a bag of food for one horse for one week, and you receive 5 Step by Step Foundation Wristbands.


For every $120.00 you give us, we buy hay for one month for one horse , and you receive 5 Step by Step Foundation Wristbands and  an inspirational book.  

The Impact

You will provide 100% horse care and help this community continue with the program.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help, but cannot help us with donations, its okay. Please use the Share Tool provided by Indiegogo, and share our campaign with all of your family and friends and help us help these children!

Also please visit our website at www.stepbystepfoundation.com and follow us on Facebook and Twitter @StepbyStepOrg to see other ways how you can help.

Visit www.horsesnheroes.com
story_txt:
Step by Step Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to enhancing the lives of underprivileged children. At Step by Step every day we work to create change and to make the dreams of children around the world become a reality. This is why we created a partnership with Horses N Heroes.
 Horses n Heroes is a non profit organization dedicated to providing an equine learning and mentoring experience for young children who come from families with extreme financial constraints. At no charge, these kids are given the opportunity to bond with horses and are taught all aspects of horsemanship including but not limited to riding, grooming, feeding and caring for the donated horses.
Horses N Heroes completely runs on donations, which is why we need your help
What We Need & What You Get
For every $15.00 you give us , we buy Shavings for one week for one horse, and you receive a Step by Step Foundation Wristband.
For every $25.00 you give us, we buy a bag of food for one horse for one week, and you receive 5 Step by Step Foundation Wristbands.
 For every $120.00 you give us, we buy hay for one month for one horse , and you receive 5 Step by Step Foundation Wristbands and  an inspirational book.  
The Impact
You will provide 100% horse care and help this community continue with the program.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you want to help, but cannot help us with donations, its okay. Please use the Share Tool provided by Indiegogo, and share our campaign with all of your family and friends and help us help these children!
Also please visit our website at www.stepbystepfoundation.com and follow us on Facebook and Twitter @StepbyStepOrg to see other ways how you can help.
Visit www.horsesnheroes.com

story:
1.2 Million Drops in the Bucket

A $1 donation can help those who lost their furniture and housewares in the flood begin to rebuild their lives. We know what you're thinking: $1 is just a drop in the bucket. And you're right! However, as we learned from the recent floods, 1.2 Million drops in the bucket adds up to a lot. That's why we've set the lofty goal of raising $1.2 Million in just one month. That's a $1 donation from every person in the Calgary area. (Of course, you're more than welcome to donate more than $1 if you'd like).

What $1.2 Million will Buy

All funds raised will be used to purchase Ikea gift cards for those who lost their furniture and housewares in the recent floods. That's 2,000 $600 gift cards, 3,000 $400 gift cards or 12,000 $100 gift cards. Exact amounts will be determined based on need.

Once we've raised the funds, we'll set up a date and time in August to disperse the cards. Proof of address will be required. Online registration may be used to help us better organize dispersement. Should we have gift cards left over, we will reach out to families in other Alberta communities affected by the flood of 2013.

Leave a Message for Flooded Families

Please leave a message with your donation. Messages will be printed and distributed with gift cards to show those who've lost so much just how much we care.

Who We Are

My name is Michelle Caplan and I'm a Calgary-based Non-Profit Marketing and Fund Development Professional. I moved to Calgary four years ago and am blown away by the incredible people who live in this city. Myself and a group of my friends and colleagues in the Calgary non-profit sector decided we wanted to start a campaign to help people rebuild their lives once they'd had a chance to remediate and renovate their homes. 

Please help us show flooded families in Calgary how much we care and help us raise $1.2 Million during the month of July. Your $1 donation will be more than a Drop in the Bucket.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign with friends, family and local media
  • Promote this campaign on social media using the Indiegogo share tools
  • Volunteer, donate to other campaigns and show people what this city is made of :)

story:
Hello from CheekyChaCha! We are a new company that creates unique and exciting personal lubricants.

WE SHIP DISCRETELY! No one will know ;)

We present to you:

Blowpaste: The revolutionary oral sex lube that is good for your teeth.

How we came up with Blowpaste:

The creator originally came up with the idea after discovering that the oral lube that she was using contained aspartame and candy-like substances. Knowing that she was going to sleep with a dirtier mouth than before, she was determined to make a product that eliminated having to brush her teeth again. With Blowpaste, she was able to peacefully fall asleep in her lover's arms.

The Creators:

The creator of Blowpaste loves musical theater: singing, dancing and acting. She has spread love and joy around the world through performing. Theater doesn't quite pay the bills and shows are far and few between. So she and her partner are on a mission to spread joy and love through a different outlet. She also cares about her teeth.

Your beautiful contributions:

Our goal is to make Blowpaste a staple in personal lubricants around the world. Your contributions will go towards marketing, promotions, and inventory. We are also making tubes and pillow pack samples to help promote Blowpaste.

Our goal and your help:

We set our goal at $5000 but are hoping to exceed that goal. Some of the events we are looking into are Exxotica, AVN, and AdultCon, which cost about $2500 each to display. These events are necessary to introduce Blowpaste to the world, for networking, and to catch the eyes of many distributors and shops. We are also planning on creating competitions and prizes through our social media marketing plan.

Our prizes to you:

This is the fun part! You will receive some pretty nifty prizes for supporting and contributing to Blowpaste. The prizes range from a "thank you" to full size 2 oz tubes, sample pillow packs, bachelorette baggies, treasure chest full of samples and more!

No money to contribute? You can still help!

We can still use all the help we can get. If you love our product, but don't have the money to contribute then please "like us" or "share us" on facebook (facebook.com/blowpaste) and/or tweet about it (twitter.com/blowpaste). You can also write a review or put us in any forum that you are on. We are open to feedback or any advice. If you have any connections with magazines, TV networks, youtube channels, call us! Help us spread the word! All your efforts mean the world to us. We are thrilled when we spot a new review or a shout out to Blowpaste.

We are special. We are unlike any other lube:

-Non sticky

-Only lube that is good for your teeth

-Instant cool tingle for the receiver

-Excites the senses

-Fresh taste for the giver

-Cleans bad breath and teeth

-Vegan

-Gluten free

-No presevatives

-Made in the USA

Giving Back: We care about our community

OUR MISSION

In addition to bringing you high quality products, at CheekyChaCha we strive to be good citizens. As part of our mission, we are looking for ways to mix business and doing good deeds.

During our first event, Market Days, August 10-11, in Chicago, we are planning a "hugging booth" with a celebrity where proceeds will go to organizations that support and help those in need.  If you would like to volunteer/be part of this campaign, please contact us:  cheekychacha@yahoo.com and put in the subject line:  MarketDays/Help

Ingredients of our fantastic concoction:

Aloe Vera

Vegetable Glycerin

Distilled Water

Peppermint Oil

Wintergreen Oil

Sodium Bicarbonate

Xanthan Gum

And Love

Visit at CheekyChaCha.com

Thank you for reading and have a delicious day!

story:
Short Summary

  • Home Care Angels Inc.(HCAI), will be providing in-home care, both for persons after a hospital viSit and for persons just not wanting to give up their independence and move into an assisted living or nursing facility.
  • We are running a very successful, family owned, commercial painting business. We employ anywhere from about a half-dozen employees to three times that many, depending on our workload and backlog. So we have 30 years experience managing a labor-intensive business.
  • Having become very spiritual over the past 15 years or so, my wife and I want a way to give back to the community. We feel the home health, home care companion business is an avenue for us to accomplish this goal.Therefore, we formed a corporation, Home Care Angels, Inc.., and became licensed in the state of Florida. That license allows us to support the infirm and the elderly with "hands off" services, meaning food prep, laundry, errands, etc., but no "hands on" support, or nursing/nursing assistant related services. In going about our approach per our license, we received sizable inquiries about "hands on". At first we ignored the demand for those services, and plodded along. Then in preperation for the organization and expansion of HCAI, I had an opportunity to be in contact with, and then visit, an old friend who runs a "hands on" agency in Ohio that has been operating for nearly a decade and has about 100 employees. When I observed the good works that they are able to accomplish I was stunned...and overcome. Our modest goals, though quite safe and achievable, seem inadequate in the face of the real needs of our community. So I have committed us to the position of what could be called devine guidance, or fated committal. Whatever way the generosity of our donors is driven, will determine the speed and magnitued of our commitment.
  • We share office space and business machine/phone availability with HACI, but the capitol demands of our painting business do not allow us to commit enough money to cover the licensce and expansion without help from you. We would like to do this. As a small business owner/operator and the vice president of HCAI, I bring 35 years experience as a self-employed, small business owner. We are confident that we can successfully run this new endeavor, and are excited about providing in-home care to those who require it. 

 FUNDING

  • The license and the funding on deposit that is mandated by the state of Florida, requires us to raise $75,000.00 to launch this expansion.

 IMPACT

  • 10,00 baby boomers will retire every day for the next 20 years. Most do not need assistance right away, but that need sneaks up on you. We see that there will be an area of public service, lying somewere between the huge hospital corporations and the gigantic retirement homes, where our small business can be a beneficial public service to help individuals provide for their health and preserve their independence. Please help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Tell all their Facebook and Twitter friends about us.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
You’ve just seen a video written, produced, directed, and scored by Sarika, a 16-year old volunteer of Community Services Unlimited (CSU) and a graduate of our youth apprenticeship programs. We’re thrilled she’s shared her vision of South LA with you as part of our fundraising efforts to get CSU into a beautiful new community home at the Mercado LA Paloma.

Just imagine if South Los Angeles had readily available, affordable, fresh produce grown without pesticides, instead of an endless sea of fast food chains. Now imagine that produce was grown by a local community organization that created jobs for South LA residents, taught youth about where food comes from, and how to grow their own. CSU has steadily made this a reality in our community. We boast 3 urban farms and every week handle 1,300 lbs of produce harvested from our sites and by local farmers. This means thousands of fresh tomatoes, crisp apples, and newly picked kale on family tables in South LA. By the end of 2012, we’ll meet our target of providing produce to 1,000 local families. Now CSU has the chance to take our work to the next level.

As you can see from Sarika’s piece, we’ve outgrown our shared kitchen and desperately need to expand in order to get more produce to local residents and businesses. She’s captured the beauty in our work - the raised herb beds we built in our garden right off of King Blvd - but also our cramped, over-flowing workspace that simply is not big enough for the ways that CSU continues to grow.

Luckily, we have the amazing opportunity to reroot ourselves in the Mercado La Paloma, a vibrant community space in the Figueroa Corridor.

We know that by bringing Community Services Unlimited to the Mercado La Paloma, we will be able to feed more families, teach more youth about where their food comes from, and give more families the power to grow their own produce. Yes, that means more canning, jamming, and cooking together! We’ll be in the good company of local artists, small businesses, and community advocates. And, community members will be able to purchase produce from Monday-Friday, 9am-5pm at our new Village Market Place storefront.

But, we need your help!  A bigger space means a bigger rent check every month. And moving isn’t cheap. Besides paying the movers, we need new fridges to store our produce, new furniture that fits our space, and new signs so the community knows we’re here. We need $15,000 for our entire move, but if we raise just $8,500 it will really help us pay for our moving costs and get settled in our new home.

Please contribute and help get fresh produce into South LA. No gift is too small and every little bit helps! And don't forget to help spread the word by sharing this page with your friends on Facebook and with your Twitter followers.

Together, we can create a just, sustainable food system in South LA! Onward!

** Come pick up your donor perks at our new space in the Mercado. We'll be happy to see you and show you around our new home!

story:
Mike Ramsdell father of 4, grandfather of 8 has recently passed.  His Loving wife Denise has been left empty handed and has been trying to run the family lawn care business "MAR Landscaping" along with her son Craig.  Mike had built a sucsessful lawn business in the tight community of Dogtown.  Mike built this business with the greatest of sweat and hard work.   He was by far the hardest working man I have ever met in my life.  After his passing, His son Craig has worked feverishly to uphold the company and run it like his father.  While craig has been doing the hard labor, wife Denise has been left to run the scheduling, billing, payroll, and monies, not to mention she takes care of the kids and grand kids, cooks , cleans, and babysits for a large houshold. It has been a struggle for both as neither Craig nor Denise has ever run a business.  They have lost some accounts due to lack of knowlege on how Mike managed his business.  I am working hard with Denise to organize and regroup the business, to turn it around and make it profitable again so it may support the huge family that has counted on it for over 20 years.  The equipement is in disrepair, needs   fixing and upgrading.  On top of that they have recently have had 2 thefts, thier garage has been broken into, and some equipment has been stolen off the work trailer while at a yard job.  They also need a business laptop and quickbooks to help them keep track of the business properly.  Aside from the business declining, it has put the family in a serious financial bind with bills.  Thier house also needs many repairs and the A/C has been out for some time.

    Your small donations can create a huge impact on this family to turn this business around so this beautifaul family can get on thier feet, becaome strong, and live life again with out thier life support of the hard working Mike Ramsdell.

    Please help support in any finacial way possible.  If anyone in the St. Louis area need lawn care work or clean-up, they could use the extra work and accounts.

     Thank you and God bless.
