story:
What is your project?

My project is TechShop.  TechShop is a chain of open-access, membership based, DIY workshops, aka, a makerspace.  We have 8 locations around the country with more than 6,000 members.  I am the General Manager for the Pittsburgh location.  Our mission is to drive global innovation by engaging, enabling, and empowering makers to build their dreams.

I get to do work towards this mission every day in Pittsburgh, but TechShop also has a great team of dedicated, talented individuals who are pushing this concept across the nation, and soon, the world.

When I started working for TechShop in 2013 we were the 6th location, and since then I’ve had the pleasure of helping to train staff for 2 more locations.  Every week I get to work with teams all across the country to try to build our national and local communities by sharing our experiences.

This Millennial Train Project (MTP) trip will go through 2 cities that have TechShops and 1 city that has a TechShop in the planning stages.  I hope to use the MTP to meet with members of the unique maker community in each city and gain a better understanding of what TechShop can do to help grow the maker movement in new and existing communities.  I also want to learn from existing maker communities that differ from my own in Pittsburgh.


What is your perception of the future, and how does your project respond to that perception?

I believe that Makers are going to be a defining factor in the future global economy.  As Chris Anderson described in his book Makers: The New Industrial Revolution, we are about to enter an era of unprecedented growth in small, goods based businesses.  Much the same as how the internet democratized many service industries, the maker movement and businesses like TechShop are democratizing access to tools of innovation necessary to produce goods.

I believe that leaders in my generation, the Millennials, are already making this happen.  A shift is occurring to local communities, local businesses, and sustainability.  I believe these communities will become increasingly more interconnected through globalization.

TechShop embodies this view of the future.  Each TechShop location starts out with virtually the same business model and the same tools; a blank canvas.  As the location grows it becomes a part of the local community.  As the community grows and utilizes each space it begins to define itself organically based on the needs of that location; however, the underlying similarities between locations and the TechShop mission stays the same.  This allows for a connectivity between these different communities/regions that is amazing to see.  It’s very similar to the way our diverse members interact with one another within our facilities.  Artists, Architects, Engineers, Tradesmen, and Designers all meet and share ideas on a daily basis.  This cross-pollination spawns creativity and innovation like no place on earth.  As the connectivity between these communities (the entrepreneurial bay area, the Ford engineers in Detroit, steel city artists in Pittsburgh, etc.) grows this creative, productive, environment will not just impact each local community, but the world.


How will you use your time in each city to advance your project?

I will meet with key players in each community to discuss how their community benefits from Makerspaces and the Maker Movement.  I will also use these meetings to develop an understanding of what the Maker Movement looks like in each particular community.  These key players will be members of the maker community, community leaders, policy leaders, businesses, etc.


What is your project designed to accomplish?

I would like to accomplish three things primarily: (1) spread the word about TechShop and the Maker movement to new communities, (2) build a network of contacts in these new communities who are interested in helping the maker movement build a better future, and (3) develop a list of recommendations and stakeholders in each community that can help to grow the Maker Movement for that particular region, while comparing and contrasting recommendations for different regions.


How will you share the impact of your project and MTP experience with others?

I will release a series of blog posts which highlight my experiences and recommendations for each city.  After the trip I will also give a presentation on the trip which will be shared across the TechShop network to all 8 of our locations.


NOTE: if my campaign is among the first 20 to reach its $5,000 goal, all funds raised will go to MTP, which is a 501(c)3 organization. As such, they will be tax-deductible. These funds help to underwrite the costs of the journey and its associated programming, transportation, and hospitality costs. If I'm not among the first 20 applicants to reach their crowdfunding goal, none of my supporters will be charged.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I am Aiden, along with my friends João and Logan. We are three teenagers looking to establish a small coffee business and grow it into a company. This is a big deal for us, and we are ready to put down everything we have to create this dream of ours.

We want to create Kotzebue Café to assure lower priced coffee, and better quality as well, for the general public. Business like Starbucks often buy coffee at a cheap price and sell it for 5$, which is overpriced, and the public deserves better. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need 1,500$ to pay for this:

  • Coffee brewers
  • Coffee beans
  • Stands
  • Sugar, cream, other sweeteners, etc
  • Extra accessories including mugs and T-shirts

The Impact

We believe that when Kotzebue succeeds, we will inspire other hardworking teenagers to dive into the world of business and economics and start their own business, and learn what it takes to work hard and become an adult. This will be a turning point in the future of economics and teenagers, if we have your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please share this with your friends and family to help us start our business!

story:
Our Relationship

10 years ago, Shorewood High School (SHS) and Hogares Santa Maria de Guadalupe, a children's home in Guatemala, started a fantastic relationship.  Each year in June, Shorewood High School students have the unique opportunity to travel to Hogares for 10 days. The SHS students eat, sleep and play with the children at the home, building friendships that, for many, continue even after their stay has ended.  This experience has made a significant impact on how these student travelers view themselves, their country, and the world around them.

"Hogares" in Spanish means "homes." As we celebrate the 10th anniversary of our relationship with Hogares,  we are eager to raise at least $10,000 to support the place that many of us now consider to be our home away from home. 

All funds raised from this campaign go to Hogares Santa Maria de Guadalupe, the children's home in Guatemala.  SHS travelers are responsible for all of their own travel expenses. 


Who We Are

HOGARES SANTA MARIA DE GUADALUPE:  a children’s home in the indigenous (Kachiquel Maya) town of Santa Apolonia, in rural Guatemala.  The children’s home houses 55 children who are cared for by the home administrators and housemothers.  In most cases, each child has a living parent who is unable to care for him/her. The children attend local schools through high school.   The administrators at the home are members of the School Sisters of St. Francis. 

SHOREWOOD HIGH SCHOOL (SHS):  a public high school in Shorewood, WI.  Participants in the trip are typically students enrolled in Spanish classes, however the trip is open to all students. Students who travel to Hogares raise their own funds for travel through other fundraising efforts.  Fundraising efforts are coordinated through the Guatemala Club at the high school. 




Why Our Campaign Is Important

Since we have had 10 fantastic years of over 300 student experiences at Hogares, current SHS students and alumni are eager to make a SIGNIFICANT DONATION to Hogares in 2015 .  WE NEED YOUR HELP. 

Our goal is to raise $10,000 for 10 years - 10 for 10!

Your donation will go towards  the Hogares' general budget.  Hogares currently takes care of 55 children with an annual budget of $257,147.  That's only $4,675.00 per child per year! 

To put it into perspective, here's what your donation can provide:

$10 provides two months of tuition for a high school student.
$25 provides a school uniform for an elementary student.
$30 provides six months of tuition for a high school student.
$60 provides food for one child for one month.
$105 provides food for one child for seven weeks.
$225 provides one month of black beans for the children.


Vilma graduated from high school with a specialization in tailoring. 

Tita eating a dinner of tamales and black beans.

Why is our relationship unique?  

Well, let's hear what the travelers to Hogares have to say:

I learned that the cycle of  poverty is really difficult to understand.  Since the Civil War in Guatemala, when many of the indigenous communities in the area were impacted by atrocities, it has been difficult to recover stability in these communities...  Wow, that is a lot more than I would have imagined as the need for the children's home in this area.  Isaac, SHS alum. 

I have really learned that I have too much stuff.  Maybe I should think about having just one drawer of clothes and taking care of them better.  Nora, SHS

I was thrilled that I was able to spend 10 days in rural Guatemala with a whole group of kids my age and more.  Who gets to do that on their first experience to any country?  I now consider these kids my friends.   Sam, SHS

I would never have imagined that I could learn to like to eat black beans.  This experience taught me so much about food.  When you eat what is produced locally your diet is not that varied.  But, the gusto that each child has to dig into another plate of black beans (eaten at every meal!) with a homemade tortilla always made me think this was gourmet food!  Ceci, SHS alum

Reading to kids!  That was one of the big goals during my trips to Hogares.  When you live in a group home, you do not get the kind of attention you would from a parent tucking you in at night.  When we pulled out the children’s books from their small library, the typical frenzy of the Hogar came to a stand still.  What I loved was that the older kids at Hogares joined us in reading to the younger kids.  Those were pretty magical moments.  Becky, SHS alum

                                                                           ~~~~~~~

And the current and former director at Hogares say:  

The SHS students come with their hearts in their hands and share with us so that each child is paid attention to and loved.  The children here await their visit with lots of enthusiasm and, when new students are part of their group, they are accepted as family.  Many of the children at Hogares do not see their families much or not at all.  Shorewood comes to fill that emptiness as SHS students and teachers are part of their family now.  Dora Alicia Gutierrez, current director at Hogares Santa Maria de Guadalupe

The visit from the Shorewood students to the children's home was an incentive to be in solidarity with each other:  the example of young people working together in teams, the joy of the multicultural coexistence, and the surprise of feeling so loved.   Argelina Marroquín, director at Hogares Santa Maria de Guadalupe, 1999-2012.  

The Impact

Here’s why our project is valuable to you and to the world

Our relationship with Hogares has a lasting effect on the students that travel there. After building relationships at Hogares, many of us feel inspired to be more actively engaged citizens of the world and to join the global fight for justice and human rights. 

To get a sense of what we mean, read the following excerpt from a former SHS student:
At the University of Wisconsin-Madison I continued to explore my ties to Latin culture by majoring in history with concentrations in “The Americas” and “Imperialism, Colonialism, & Post-colonialism.” Through my studies I sought to understand the background behind the problems that I witnessed in Guatemala, the historical legacies that contributed to the poverty, lack of educational opportunities and overwhelming unemployment rampant in the region today.

I hope to build on the combination of my own personal history and undergraduate studies by attending law school and focusing on comparative law, particularly how the law can be utilized to ameliorate issues affecting women and children in Latin America today. I believe that my time in Guatemala, along with my study of the region’s history, give me an insight into the cultural and social structures that must be understood in order to enact effective policies that truly speak to the Latin American experience.  My hope is to become an advocate for change, and assist marginalized groups in successfully navigating the economic, social and cultural systems that have firmly entrenched this population into the bottom rung of many of the area’s societies.

                                                                     

Our Track Record


This alumni of Hogares was supported during high school with the SHS fund drive in 2007 to support expenses for high school students at Hogares.  He graduated at the top of his high school class and now, with a scholarship, continues studying for a degree in Mechanical Engineering at a university in Guatemala City. 


The generator in this photo was purchased with the funds raised during the SHS Guatemala Club 2010 fundraising event.  Some members of the Hogares' community are featured in the thank you photo.
Other Ways to Help

1.  Share our campaign with family and friends: www.igg.me/at/giveguatemala

    We need your help in spreading the word!

2.    If you prefer to make a cash (tax deductible) donation, please make a check payable to the "School Sisters of St. Francis" and mail it to the School Sisters of St. Francis, International Office of Mission Advancement, Catherine Alexander, 1501 S. Layton Blvd., Milwaukee, WI 53215, phone 414-384-3334.

3.    If you are local to Shorewood High School (1701 Capitol Drive, Shorewood, WI 53211), you can purchase 12 oz. of Guatemalan (Hunapú) Colectivo coffee  for $10 and ($5 profit for our campaign)/or 5 note cards with envelopes of scenes from Guatemala and Hogares for $7.  These fundraising opportunities are sponsored by the SHS Guatemala Club.  To purchase either coffee or note cards, please contact Troy and Jill Ferone at 4ferones@gmail.com

School District of Shorewood Guatemala Club: 

GUATEMALA CLUB AT SHOREWOOD HIGH SCHOOL (SHS) IS RUNNING THIS CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN TO SUPPORT HOGARES SANTA MARIA DE GUADALUPE.  GUATEMALA CLUB IS AN OFFICIAL SHS CLUB THAT ANNUALLY MAINTAINS THE CONNECTION TO HOGARES AT SHS WITH WEEKLY MEETINGS AND ACTIVITIES AND ANNUAL FUNDING EVENTS.

story:
Haarlem to Banjul; a Rally for Charity.

We will be driving the Antwerp - Banjul Challenge in October 2015. Our adventure starts in Haarlem, we will join up with other drivers in Antwerp, Belgium. From there the real journey starts which will take us through France, Spain, Morocco, Mauritania, Senegal and ends in Gambia.

We have found a car that has lost its value in Holland but is worth a lot more in Africa.  At the end of the trip our car will be auctioned of to raise more money for the charity project we chose. 


Medical post for Bulayhatte
Our project is to build a medical post in the village Bulayhatte. There is no medical post for miles, the situation calls for immediate help. People have to travel too far which results in a lot of unnecessary deaths. 

We are going to make a documentary of this trip to show how three guys put their energy and their effort towards getting their message across the world and help the people in Bulayhatte.

Donating to this project will make it possible for us to get there with our car. By auctioning this car of we will generate additional funds which will be added to the donations we have received so far. The funds and the donations will go directly towards the construction of the medical post.


Our Team

Sebastiaan Siderius
- Project Initiator
Sebastiaan is a entrepreneur who's goal in live is to make people smile. He wants to give to his friends, his family and everybody who wants to receive happiness en laughter. He creates business-events to let people experience certain unforgettable moments and feelings. This journey is not only a great experience for him but also for the people he's going to meet on this crazy adventure and the people who will follow the team.


Dirk van Dam
- Driver & Mechanic
Dirk has always been a dreamer, and when he heard about the project in Bulayhatte, his eyes lit up. By picking the crew Dirk was insured of good travel company and people he could rely on. Dirk is a gentle soul and therefor he's a excellent companion on this journey. With allot of hours spend on getting the vehicle in good condition he will be paying attention to the mechanics.


 Michiel van der Meer
- Filmmaker 
Michiel van der Meer is a filmmaker from Haarlem who is always looking for a good story. He joined the team to make sure that this story is told to the world. By crafting an engaging story he hopes to generate more attention for developing charity projects like this

To find out more about his work visit: www.michielvandermeer.nl

In this video we introduce ourselves and explain about our project.

Our adventure so far

We bought a bold pink Jeep Cherokee in December 2014. It's a great car but it needed some attention. We had to get a new engine because the old one was getting to hot. The new engine is being installed right now and we hope to get the car running smooth shortly.

We tried raising funds by creating a website, a Facebook-page, making alot of phone calls and sending out e-mails. We had some luck but we hope to raise a lot more money now by reaching out to the great Indiegogo community. 

The Impact

Bullyhatte is a farmers community about 60 miles from the capitol Banjul. There are about 100 families living in the village. Right now they don't have acces to healthcare like most of us. There are a lot of unnecessary deaths because they do not reach the nearest hospital in time which is miles away. The people in the village are eager to start with the building of the medical post. You have to imagine that most villagers live on a budget lower then 1$ a day so what they need is a financial push. 

By getting donations to them the construction can start and people can be treated accordingly. Diseases, accidents, pregnancies they all deserve to get medical attention.


Risks & Challenges

It’s called the Antwerp to Banjul Challenge for a reason. This will not be an easy ride there will be a lot of hurdles to jump during this journey. 

We have a team that is determined to overcome any of these obstacles by sheer willpower. There is no challenge great enough that it will make us back down from what we want to do, which is developing medical care and making sure this story is told.

If need be we can always call upon the help of the other contestants of this rally or get in touch with local people on the road that can help us push through these potential obstacles.


Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps, if you can’t contribute to this cause you can always help us through social media. Share our campaign on your Facebook, Twitter or other preferred social media channel.

By a simple press of the button you can contribute to developing medical care in Gambia and make sure these local projects get the attention they deserve.

If you have any questions about this project please leave a comment. We would like to thank you for taking the time to read through our project and hope to get your support!

story:
The Short of It...

That would be Rosa, she's only 5 ft... 
No really, we want to bring the best dumplings direct to your door with our Red Dumpling Truck.

Who Are These Dumpling Makers?

Hong Kong born Rosa Ross is a chef, cooking teacher, author, and owner of Scrimshaw Restaurant in Greenport on the North Fork of Long Island.

Rosa has been making dumplings, serving dumplings, and teaching others all about dumplings for over 20 years on the North Fork and in Manhattan. Folks just never seem to tire of her dumplings. 

After ten years, they are still the bestsellers at her restaurant. Not everyone makes it to the restaurant though... Struck by inspiration one day while preparing a cooking class, Rosa decided that she needed to bring her dumplings to the masses. The solution? A dumpling truck!

Chinese-American Greg is a talented chef who was raised by Rosa after she found him in a shipping container just outside of Philadelphia. He has been hand making dumplings ever since with stints as an Executive Chef at The Frisky Oyster, Prohibition Tap Room, The Riverhead Project, Oyster House Philly, and Industry Standard.

Greg's the tall of the operation. He is the creative force, the visionary, and comic relief. Passionate about food (when Rosa lets him out of folding mini dumpling wrappers) he also has remarkable wit, an eye for uncomfortable mid-century modern furniture, and has a solid Foghorn Leghorn impersonation.

An Idea is Born...

Rosa said, "Greg loved the idea of a truck. He wanted an old truck, but one in good condition, and it had to be red for good luck. Lady luck must have been on our side, because we quickly found our Red Truck, in sunny California; this meant no rust. Perfect, and shipping costs, were nominal. So we bought the truck and had it shipped to USA Mobile Commissary for the final build out. "

  • STEP 1 - DONE

    • Now our truck is now just waiting to be outfitted.


What We Need

We’ve done our homework: to fully outfit our truck and put it on the road we need:

  • Complete Custom Build Out w/ Stainless Steel Walls, Counters & Ceilings
  • Complete Electrical & Plumbing
  • 5KW Generator
  • Truck Graphics
  • Beverage Cooler
  • 27” Bain Marie
  • 2’ Flat Griddle
  • 2 - Full Pan Steam Table w/ Individual Thermostatic Controls
  • Fire Suppression System
  • Under Belly 40# Propane Tank
  • Custom Fabrication of Vending Windows w/ Individual Security Canopies
  • Truck Wrap – Design, Fabrication & Installation

Sounds like a long, expensive list. Well, it is, and we can handle a lot of it. 

But…We still need a little help from our friends to get this show on the road in time for our busy season. 

So come on, all you dumpling lovers, help us make the Red Dumpling Truck a reality.  

The Right Wrapper for the Right Filling..

When you make a dumpling you must have the right wrapper for the right filling. We think that you'll understand that the Red Dumpling Truck is the right business for the East End. Why? Because dumplings are delicious, fun, and easy to eat. By contributing to this venture you will be spreading Dumpling Love and also enriching the community. How?

  • Everyone loves Dumplings!
  • When people eat food made with love, they are happy.
  • No one is doing a Dumpling Truck on the East End. 
  • You'll be helping create jobs for locals and boosting the economy.
  • You'll be helping spread joy
  • You'll get Greg out of the shipping container that Rosa still makes him live in.

The Challenges

Time is the biggest hurdle with this venture. The summer season can be short on the East End which is why we are asking for your help now. Having operated many restaurants and establishments, and the combined experience of over 100 years of dumpling making we know that the Red Dumpling Truck will grow from strength to strength each season. 

We hope to not only do catered and private events but also be at the wineries and breweries of the East End.  In the winter the truck will go to Philadelphia and make dumplings year round. 

The more people we can reach with the truck the more Dumpling Love we can spread!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We want to thank you for taking the time to read our pitch and story. We hope you had a laugh and can see our vision as clearly as we do. Dumplings are for everyone!
  • Please help share this page with your friends, colleagues, or anyone who loves dumplings. The rewards are great and know that you'll be helping a startup get off the ground.

Dim Sum & Dumplings,


Rosa & Greg.

He has been hand making dumplings ever since with stints as an Executive Chef at The Frisky Oyster, Prohibition Tap Room, The Riverhead Project, Oyster House Philly, and Industry Standard.
Greg's the tall of the operation. He is the creative force, the visionary, and comic relief. Passionate about food (when Rosa lets him out of folding mini dumpling wrappers) he also has remarkable wit, an eye for uncomfortable mid-century modern furniture, and has a solid Foghorn Leghorn impersonation.
An Idea is Born...


Rosa said, "Greg loved the idea of a truck. He wanted
an old truck, but one in good condition, and it had to be red for good luck. Lady luck must have been on our side, because we quickly found our Red Truck, in sunny California; this meant no rust. Perfect, and shipping costs, were nominal. So we bought the truck and had it shipped to USA Mobile Commissary for the final build out. "


 STEP 1 - DONE Now our
truck is now just waiting to be outfitted.
 
  






What We Need 
We’ve done our homework: to fully outfit our truck and put it on the road we need:


Complete Custom Build Out w/ Stainless Steel Walls, Counters & Ceilings

Complete Electrical & Plumbing

5KW Generator

Truck Graphics
Beverage Cooler
27” Bain Marie

2’ Flat Griddle
2 - Full Pan Steam Table w/ Individual Thermostatic Controls

Fire Suppression System

Under Belly 40# Propane Tank

Custom Fabrication of Vending Windows w/ Individual Security Canopies

Truck Wrap – Design, Fabrication & Installation

Sounds like a long, expensive list. Well, it is, and we can handle a lot of it. 
But…We still need a little help from our friends to get this show on the road in time for our busy season. So come on, all you dumpling lovers, help us make the Red Dumpling Truck a reality.     The Right Wrapper for the Right Filling.. When you make a dumpling you must have the right wrapper for the right filling. We think that you'll understand that the Red Dumpling Truck is the right business for the East End. Why? Because dumplings are delicious, fun, and easy to eat. By contributing to this venture you will be spreading Dumpling Love and also enriching the community. How?  Everyone loves Dumplings!
When people eat food made with love, they are happy. No one is doing a Dumpling Truck on the East End.  You'll be helping create jobs for locals and boosting the economy.
You'll be helping spread joy
You'll get Greg out of the shipping container that Rosa still makes him live in.    

The Challenges  Time is the biggest hurdle with this venture. The summer season can be short on the East End which is why we are asking for your help now. Having operated many restaurants and establishments, and the combined experience of over 100 years of dumpling making we know that the Red Dumpling Truck will grow from strength to strength each season. 
We hope to not only do catered and private events but also be at the wineries and breweries of the East End.  In the winter the truck will go to Philadelphia and make dumplings year round. 
The more people we can reach with the truck the more Dumpling Love we can spread!   Other Ways You Can Help 
We want to thank you for taking the time to read our pitch and story. We hope you had a laugh and can see our vision as clearly as we do. Dumplings are for everyone! Please help share this page with your friends, colleagues, or anyone who loves dumplings. The rewards are great and know that you'll be helping a startup get off the ground.   Dim Sum & Dumplings,Rosa & Greg.

story:
I am fundraising for WIL-Uganda, where I will be working for 3 months from October to December as Teen Voices Intern. My goal is to raise £300, which will go towards the cost of in-country travel and accommodation and support WIL-Uganda's daily operations.

WIL(Women In Leadership)-Uganda is an NGO based in Busembatia, Uganda which works to improve the lives and prospects of women and girls in the local community through projects ranging from teaching literacy and business skills to career guidance to raising awareness on sexual health.

So far, WIL-Uganda has empowered 200 women and girls living in extreme poverty. Empowerment generates self-sustaining communities that enable women to lift themselves out of the poverty cycle and gives them the resources to provide for 800 deprived children.

No matter how small, your contribution today will make all the difference in helping WIL-Uganda build upon the foundations it has set for improving the lives of women and girls in Busembatia. It will also help us to take another step forward towards ending gender inequality and discrimination against women. It is quick and easy to donate online - and to raise awareness by sharing my campaign on social media!

Please also visit the website for more information about WIL-Uganda.

Thank you!

 

Working with girls on a previous overseas community project - Volta region, Ghana

story:
Short Summary

Imagine: a FREE creative play space for our community, inspiring kids to learn through discovery while their grownups unwind in a cozy environment and enjoy refreshments for purchase in a simple, self-serve coffee and snack bar.  This space will offer various Creative Play Stations such as a playhouse, dress-up area, book nook and train table, alongside a "Pay-to-Paint" Messy Art Studio where children can let their inner Picassos shine- and parents don't have to worry about the cleanup!  In addition to these regular features, this play space will offer a rotating calendar of classes, special events, incredible birthday parties, and provide local family-friendly businesses a unique space for meetings, advertisement opportunities and support!  

Our proposed location is off Glenwood Ave and Lynn Road in Raleigh.  We currently have approval for a one-year lease as a testing ground for this concept!  Pending inspection and building code approval, we plan to be in our space by September 2016! 

What We Need & What You Get

$1500 in 15 days!  The money raised from this campaign will go directly to the "no charge to play" aspects of our play space including: 
-$450 Foam floor tiles with a "hardwood" finish.  Soft, safe, durable and easy to clean/sanitize! 
- $500 Cafe furnishings including a community style dining table, comfy chairs, tables, and benches. 
- $250 Quality, hands-on "learning through discovery" style toys and toy storage.  
-  $200 Decor and ambiance. 
- $100 Non-toxic, child-safe cleaning solutions and equipment. 

If we EXCEED our goal we can provide even more services and items to meet the needs of our customers and community! 

In addition to the various levels of contributor perks, ALL donors will receive an invitation to a VIP Sneak Peek prior to our opening, just our small symbol of a HUGE THANK YOU!  

The Impact

Your contribution will help create a community space like no other: a gathering place to connect with others, a cozy space to plug into your laptop, a home away from home for you and your family!  By focusing on parental comfort as much as a child friendly environment, we hope to fill a need for many families in the Raleigh area! 

Risks & Challenges

As with any new venture, we expect to encounter various obstacles and learning opportunities along the way!  

Nicki Medford owned a business with a similar vision when she lived in Colorado Springs.  The business survived a year and brought in a small profit when she decided it was time to close doors, take a step back and spend a few years to refine and redevelop the concept.  Jenn Spencer has a keen business sense and has owned several successful e-commerce businesses.  Together, Nicki and Jenn are combining what they know, making a list of possible outcomes and solutions for any situation they may encounter.  They also hope to use community support as a sounding board to continue to meet the needs of guests if the business begins to miss any marks. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth is HUGE in this industry.  We need your encouragement and continued support by sharing our concept with your friends and joining our Facebook Group to make your voice heard!  YOU are the reason we are pushing so hard to bring this place to life in such a radical way.  THANK YOU!!

story:
A Brief History

Though Ophelia's Gypsy Caravan tends to use the "royal we" when referring to itself (it sounds more professional that way), the truth is that the business is and has always been operated by one person: a 31 year-old young adult fantasy writer in Tulsa, Oklahoma. I (Hanna Howard) graduated with a Bachelor's degree in English and Creative Writing in 2008, and while I have pursued professional novel writing ever since, I've also had an irrepressible doodling habit that, shortly after college, manifested itself in the painting of literary quotes and whimsical designs on ceramic coffee cups.

In 2010, I caved to the pressure of a good friend and opened an Etsy shop. Etsy was still pretty new at the time, and I didn't expect it to lead to much, but to my happy surprise, I found that the things I posted tended to sell, and gradually the business grew. It grew and grew and grew, and in 2015 I made the shift into full-time painting, no longer holding any other outside jobs. 

That same year, I also signed with a literary agent and began revising my book to rigorous new standards, working toward publication.

What I discovered in the course of the following year was that, within the time limitations of each week, and the balance of painting, shipping, business management, and writing, I could generate enough income to just barely, barely sustain myself and the business. With great reluctance, I began to consider moving the mug business to the back burner and seeking another "real" job. 

But I hated that idea. (And not just because "real" jobs are the worst.) I hated it because the little family of mug supporters that had been growing on Etsy and my shop Facebook page for the last five years was incredibly dear to me, and I didn't want to let them down. I hated it because I really loved painting mugs. And I hated it because it seemed like a waste to let a perfectly good business wither away just because the current model wasn't working quite well enough.

And so I began to brainstorm...

 

The Plan

It seemed to me that what I needed most was a way to make more mugs more quickly. Traditionally, as beloved as the hand-painted designs were, I knew one of my greatest limitations was the simple fact that I could only paint so much in a year. And while it was a beautiful thing to offer a unique piece to every single person who ordered, I had always fantasized about replicating my designs with a magic wand, so I wouldn't have to paint the same thing over and over again.

Another problem with the hand-painted mugs was that their paint was heat-set to bond with the surface of a glaze, and did not last forever. The paint's sturdy longevity had always been impressive, but nevertheless, another of my fantasies was to produce a mug whose design would last forever, no matter how roughly or frequently you washed it.

And so I did some research, and discovered a printing method called sublimation. By this process, I could hand-draw or paint designs with great detail and complexity, scan them into my computer, and with the right equipment, print onto a transfer that, exposed to high temperatures within a mug press, would produce a mug with my design permanently printed on its surface. 

With such an efficient method of production, I could spend more time creating design art, knowing that it could be used over and over again. I could market these designs more confidently, since they could be sold more than just once. And most excitingly, I could use this method to expand the business in new directions, stretching my creative muscles to more thoroughly fuse my products with the great love of my life: Story.  

Of course, introducing a new type of product to the Caravan would not mean the extinction of the original, hand-painted, eclectic coffee mugs; rather, it would mean that they are no longer the only option within the shop, opening up wider options for customers in both design and price.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Since the Caravan is currently a "pay the bills ONLY" level organization, I need a bit of help getting this new endeavor off the ground. But I want to offer something back for every contribution, no matter how small. So here's the breakdown of what I need, and what you'll get back:

Needs:

- Mug Press: $200+*
- Sublimation Printer: $200+
- Heat tape: $12
- Sublimation Ink ($30-$50)
- Sublimation paper ($20 ish)
- Pre-treated sublimation mugs ($1.50-$2 ea.): $200+
- Pens and paints for high-detail paper designs ($70)

*The campaign is a "flexible" one, meaning that I can raise both more and less than my goal. You can read more about what will happen if I don't meet my goal below, but the items above which have a plus sign (+) beside them are ones whose prices range greatly on the market. Raising more than my goal will give me more flexibility in choosing good equipment.

Also please note that the campaign goal total also reflects the funding I will need to fulfill perks. :)

Perks:

These are outlined in greater detail on the right sidebar, but I want to offer contributors a perk even if all you can give is $5. (Every little bit counts!) So I'm offering a range of neat and weird stuff, from hand-drawn doodles and notes mailed to your door, Ophelia car and nalgene stickers, and specially recorded story readings, to the first crop of new mugs printed on the press, brand new Caravan t-shirts, and original, hand drawn designs for the sublimation printer. And what I'm maybe most excited about: the chance to have a virtual or real-life tea party with Ophelia and I while I design mugs for you and your friends! 

Check out these mock-ups of a few of the perks! :)

What if we can't fund the project?

While I am hopeful that the goal number will not be too difficult to fund (especially if lots of people give in small increments!), I do know that it's possible I won't raise enough to purchase the equipment. In that case, with your permission, I will translate the money you gave into an equivalent order for you within my current Etsy shop.

 

The Impact

With your help, I believe I can grow Ophelia's Gypsy Caravan into a shop that offers more than just a perpetually limited selection of one-time-only products. With a greater potential for growth, I hope to grant the business more stability, ensuring production of the geeky and literary mugs that have made friends around the globe, while at the same time giving myself more time to devote to those customers who still want the originality, flair, and artistic value of a hand-painted piece.

By supporting the Caravan in this way (and with every purchase you make!), you are helping to sustain a small business, promote art, literary awareness, and creativity, and build toward a future in which those things continue to matter. And I thank you for it!!

 

Risks & Challenges

The risk in this endeavor is probably an obvious one: I have never before operated a sublimation mug press, and therefore, may not immediately produce a flawless result from my efforts. However, I have done lots of research, and feel I have a good grasp on how to get started. The things that will help soften the learning curve are...

- Good equipment. The most oft-repeated advice I have found has been to invest in a printer and press of good quality. 

- The freedom to mess up and try again without exhausting all resources. This is why it is important to fund more than just a "test sample" of this equipment.

- Enthusiasm, patience, and support from the mug family I have grown to love so much in the last six years! Knowing you guys are behind me has always meant so much.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help out! Please share the campaign with your friends (IndieGoGo has some great share tools), especially if they are the sort of people who like nerdy stuff. You can also share our Etsy shop page (opheliasgypsycaravan.etsy.com) with anyone who might like to see what we offer!

story:
The Plan

This Saturday, the 19th of September, we are driving to Calais to support the Refugees Welcome day of solidarity. (https://www.facebook.com/events/1141432775871410/).
As well as taking part in this event we would like to offer some contributions to the camps. The plan is to fill a van full of food, water and medical / sanitary supplies to donate.

The Event

The event is a call to action for all those that support the plight of refugees in Calais and across the world. It will be a day of peaceful protest, art and solidarity and is about bringing art and peace to the camp.

ART AND SOLIDARITY CEREMONIES “SOLIDARITY AGREEMENT SIGNING”
An agreement between UK and EU citizens and refugees, demanding the implementation of a real politic of Hospitality. 

 “RE-FACE THE FENCE”
A symbolic fence made from art canvasses will be painted with our names, stories, and pictures. It will become a visual symbol of the solidarity that transcends borders.

“WHO AM I?” 
 Are we human? Are we migrants? Are we refugees? Repossess the language of the debate by deciding who we are for ourselves. 

 “A MINUTE OF SILENCE” 
We will lie down together on the ground for one minute of silence to commemorate the tragedy of the lives lost along the way.



The Cause
Every one of us deserves clean living conditions, food and shelter. There are 3,000 men, women and children camped out at the border with next to nothing. These people need our help.

It's been incredibly inspiring to see so many people coming together to donate supplies through grassroots campaigns and the huge outpouring of support has left the camps with lots of tents, blankets and clothing but there is still a massive need for food, basic toiletries and sanitary items. 


How the money will be spent

We will fill the van full of basic necessities like: 
  • Food
  • Clean water
  • Baby food
  • Nappies
  • Tooth Brushes
  • Tooth Paste
  • Cleaning products
  • Soap
  • Toilet paper
  • First aid kits
And anything else we can think of that will help. If you have any suggestions then please let me know!
If enough money is raised we can make multiple trips to the camps.


Any small donations help and are appreciated, my deepest gratitude and thanks to anyone who is willing to donate to this cause. <3

Any small donations help and are appreciated, my deepest gratitude and thanks to anyone who is willing to donate to this cause. <3

story:
Summary

My name is Chad Wiltz and I'm the owner and mazer at Garagiste Meadery.  Along with my wife Sarah and our two children we live in Apollo Beach, Florida.  

You may be asking.... What's mead?  Mead is an ancient style of wine made from honey as opposed to traditional wine grapes.  Often mead is made with fruits, herbs, spices and other additives.  Whats most amazing about mead is the sheer enormity of flavors you can create.  We've made Key Lime Pie, Peanut Butter & Jelly, Strawberry Rhubarb Pie, Chocolate Coconut, Mixed Berry, Fruit Punch and this list goes on and on.  With mead you are truly limited only by your own imagination.  What's also remarkable is that mead is often organic and gluten free making it a product with universal appeal.  

I fell in love with mead in 2014 after trying some amazing mead made by a master meadmaker in Ferndale, Michigan.  It was a life altering experience for me and after my first sip I knew I had to have more.  So I set off to do just that, at which point I ran into a small problem.  There simply are not many meads available commercially and the amazing Ferndale meads were not available outside of Michigan.  At which point I had to make a decision, go without this amazing beverage or learn to make my own.  

It was this decision to make my own which spawned Garagiste Meadery.  As mead makers we've made every effort to keep our product local by sourcing our honey from local beekeepers and to the extent possible our fruits from local farmers.  In this we've tried to bring the farm to table experience into a single bottle.  Since we began meadmaking we've made hundreds of gallons and shared it with hundreds of people.  We've attended mead events and festivals and the response is overwhelmingly positive.  Independent raters from across the globe on services like Untappd rate our meads among the best available.

Our goal is to create a commercial Meadery focused on small batch artisanal meads and honey wines.  We want to make explosive and inspired meads and share them with you and indeed the world.  We are reaching out to you to help us make our dream come true.

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to collect $50,000 or more.  The process of building a winery or meadery requires numerous permits and these applications often take months to complete.  The money raised during this campaign will be used to secure a modest sized industrial space for our Meadery/Tasting Room and the equipment necessary to produce the quality of mead that we wish to offer.   Any additional monies generated will be used for necessary renovations and to keep our leases paid during this interim period where we wont be able to produce mead or generate revenue.  It's a long road but we are committed to seeing it through!

So what do you get?  We've set up a number of options to choose from to suit any taste or budget.

Our lowest cost options include some pretty awesome swag made by some pretty awesome people.  A simple set of stickers for you to display for $5.  Our Garagiste shirt is a premium tee with durable screen printing inks.  The Garagiste glassware is a superb drinking vessel that's equally well suited to be used with a mead or a fine whiskey.  The Garagiste "YOpener" bottle opener is a fantastic tool made by a father/son team in Tulsa, Oklahoma.  

The premium perk is our Garagiste Owners Group.  This perk entitles you to a selection of premium limited release meads once we get up and running.  In addition, we'll inscribe your name/city on the walls of our tasting room.  Plus you'll also get a 10% discount on all purchases, a Garagiste Owners Group t-shirt and an invite to an Owners Group Only blowout!

The Impact

To make Garagiste Meadery a reality we will need help.  We want to build a Meadery that our community and you as a contributor can be proud of.  We want to be the peoples Meadery and in this regard we think of ourselves as publicly owned.  This is why we chose the name "Garagiste Owners Group".  This Meadery is going to be built by you and for you!

Your generosity as a contributor cannot be thanked enough.  Simply put, without you none of this will be possible.

Risks & Challenges

As I mentioned previously, this process will take a while.  I fully recognize that it may be 2017 before our meads are available commercially.  Permits, licenses, bonds, attorneys, architects, insurance, taxes, distribution contracts, supply chain contracts, etc all must be taken care of before a single ounce of honey becomes an amazing mead.

I do have the good fortune of having an Master of Business Administration behind me and a track record of success; but, I will admit that the list is daunting.  With this in mind I've partnered with some industry insiders who have opened meaderies and wineries and they've been generous enough to offer their assistance.  The mead community is a small one but the people are great!

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully recognize that some people cannot contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Garagiste Meadery has both a Facebook and Instagram account, post a link and get the word out.

story:
Short Summary

Hello loyal and potential customers!  I am Joe Trojak - creator, chef, and owner of Monster Joe's Sauces. 

Monster Joe's is my own line of signature BBQ and buffalo wing sauces.  These are my own original BBQ and buffalo wing recipes with some unique spice levels. Wherever you cook your meats - in the kitchen, on the backyard grill, in the backyard smoker, or on the tailgate grill, my sauces are the perfect flavor compliment because they do not overpower the natural flavor of beef, pork, chicken, and even fish.  Yup - you read that right! My buffalo wing sauces are the perfect condiment for even eggs, mac-n-cheese, or even to personalize your own version of buffalo chicken dip! 

Monster Joe's Philosophy

As a consumer, you spend top dollar for your beef, pork, chicken, even fish and seafood. So why use a mass produced, under-performing sauce?  Your meat, poultry and seafood needs premium sauces with natural ingredients, that are gluten free. Sauces made in taste controlled small batches to ensure quality and the perfect combinations of flavors. All of our products are produced, and bottled, right here in Philadelphia - made in the U.S.A!

I come to you today seeking your help in the launch of my lifelong passion and vision, providing the best BBQ and buffalo wing sauces.  As my company expands, I have a list of new products I will be launching.

What Monster Joe Needs & What You Get

We've been testing our concept to rave reviews, and it's time to go big or go home. They don't call me Monster Joe for nothing! 
What We Need:
We $4155 to get started and to keep this dream alive so we can expand the business around the Philadelphia and South Jersey area.   You may ask 'what will be the outcome' of my contribution, and want to know what I plan to do with the money that is raised here. 
 By reaching the financial goal of $4155, I will begin by laying down the roots of my company and making this all official from:
  • Incorporation
  • All applicable Licenses, Insurance, and startup fees
  • Packaging and Label development
  • Logo design, artwork
  • Marketing / Partnership Materials 
  • Website Design
  • Advertisements and Signage
  • Supplies
  • Stock 
This isn't a hobby - this is a thriving, growing portfolio of sauces which will be growing as we create more interesting combinations and products.
What would you get for supporting my project?
Depending on the level of your contribution, you could get 1 or more of the following:
  • Our sincerest thanks
  • A special thanks on our website
  • Order discounts
  • Bottle(s) of sauce
  • Bottle of your choice for 6 months or a year
  • A catered wing event at your home or office for 15 people (how cool is that? definitely something worth bragging about!!!)
Take a chance on a local Joe, and invest in the local economy! And get some create sauces for your favorite meats, poultry, and fish. 

The Impact

Impact on you....

You spend your hard earned money on meats, poultry, and fish, and then your precious time in cooking and preparing.  You not only want to enjoy a good meal, you'd like others to enjoy as well.  Image parties, tailgates, backyard grillers, where people talk about your food for days, tell others about it, and ask for your secret recipe.  Just as much as you'd like that, you don't want the opposite either, average food.  Your contribution and perk will help you throw parties that people will rave about.

Impact on me ....

Your contribution will help me bring my passion to life. Have you ever had a dream, but got on with life and responsibilities and family and work, and by the time you woke up, half your life has passed by? 

I am a chef, making the best comfort food, and bar food wherever I go. People come out wherever I am at the helm of a kitchen. They wait in line for my wings and BBQ. They follow me to farmer's markets where I sell my product. They order from me through email, while at a bar, or when I'm drumming in my blues band. 

I've 'made due' with basic labels and a loyal following but now it's time to go big or go home. I've done my research, and have put something things into play. I have recipes that need to be perfected and shared, and other products to fill out the roster.  I can only do all this with your help.

I make sure people enjoy their food, and have a great time. I'm a a big guy and all about big flavor. I've done my research, and have some things all lined up ready to go.  I've got orders to fill and need funds to ramp up. Order a bottle through one of my perks, and give my sauces a try.  You won't be disappointed... and they have so many more uses than just for wings or meats!

Your contribution will not only help me bring my bold and saucy flavors to more people, faster, but to a more diversified base of people...so more people can experience the real flavor of BBQ meats, and the bold and spicy bite of wing sauces.

Support every second lifer working hard to bring their dreams alive - with their labors of love, undying passion, and commitment to a dream. 

Watch Monster Joe's grow into a neighborhood store near you as you help me bring this alive!  I've got farmer's markets scheduled, festivals, shows, special bar appearances... I'm working hard to make this grow... please help with your contribution!!

Risks & Challenges

Sure - it may look like I'm too new to build a business, but I mean business.  I've got a base portfolio of products, and have plans for expansion into different types of sauces and markets, 

What Qualifies me for this big endeavor, and to overcome these hurdles?

  • I've been a chef for 20 years, and have made my own creations all along the way.
  • All my creations receive rave reviews, so I know how to mix things up.
  • I'm a big guy, and have been a bouncer, and I'm a drummer in a blues band - I know how to handle big challenges.
  • I'm on my second life - that brings age, wisdom, a sense of humor and have finally found where my passion meets my skills.
  • I plan to surround myself with people who can fill in with the skills that I lack and have been building my team.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute right now, help me get the word out and make some noise about my sauces and my campaign here.  Please share where and when you can on Facebook, with your networks, and on other Social Media platforms.  I'm a local guy, but have big, hairy, audacious goals to get my sauces nationwide and I need this campaign to help be get some lift and momentum. One try and you'll be hooked.

I could use your help in anyway! If you've tried my sauces and BBQ - tell people here how much you liked it.

If you can refer me to store buyers, QVC connections, your name it - I'll take it. 

And that's all there is to it.  GET SAUCY WITH ME!!

HELP MAKE IT HAPPEN for Monster Joe's Sauces and Joe Trojak.

story:
Short Summary

My dream is simple, to do what I like as a job.

Hi my name is Joyce, born and raised in Singapore. I had been working on IT job for the past 8 years only to realize one thing; I do not like it and I'm not good at it either. So at the age of 32, I decided to pursue my own dreams.

I loved craftwork since young and for the past year, I started making jewellery and accessories containing real plants. I have been selling them on several online stores but the sales is not nearly enough to be considered a real job. What I lack is branding and awareness.

After tweaking around with product descriptions, social media accounts without much results, I believe I need to invest on advertising and branding.

What We Need & What You Get

I am not having enough sales to cover the cost incurred hence, unable to invest further on plans to raise product and brand awareness. Your help and donation can help make this come true.

I will mail different series of my product to you based on the amount donated. Essentially you will not be donating for nothing!

The Impact

Plans I have with the collected funds:

-advertising for products in online stores platform and social media account. 
- hire professional agencies for branding and product awareness 
-photography fees, mostly already paid for but unable to engage for new projects/products.

 

Risks & Challenges

  • Basically online advertising is to place my items at the very top when buyers search for products similar to mine, I scrolled past 15 pages without seeing my own item and those on top tend to have the word 'Ad' on it so..obvious isn't it, need to pay to be on top. I will start with the lowest amount allowed for the ad so as not to overspend since I am not sure how effective it is to start with
  • Branding and Product awareness is a big thing which I will probably plan it slow and ask for more advice before I dump in the money. 
  • Photography is certainly the next step I can invest on to continue providing great images and concept shots to entice buyers. Though the photographer is my best friend, it is his livelihood after all and I cannot always take advantage without filling his rice bowl ya?

Other Ways You Can Help

Do share my instagram account @thegreenjewels with your friends who might like my line of products and hopefully they will support me too! Should they not be keen to donate, they might simply like what I sell and buy it online, that is gonna help me too! 

Thank you in advance and I hope to gain your support in the next 2 months!

story:
Our Story

Do you remember the anticipation you’d feel throughout the chilly, rainy, days of late fall -- eagerly waiting for the day when your parents would finally give in to your nagging, bundle you up in a warm coat and take you downtown to see the incredible, animated displays in department store windows?

 

            You would huddle with family, friends, and complete strangers, noses pressed against the plate glass window, and gaze in wonder as Santa and his elves, Victorian store keepers, moving model trains, and fairytale figures, gestured and twirled across winter landscapes, and cheerful family settings.  It was a magical treat for young and old in cities all across the country.

 

         Well, a whole generation of kids never had that experience.  And, the Sacramento County Historical Society wants to provide if to them.  With your help we’ll recreate a full-sized holiday display window, using animated figures that once graced the windows of the Breuner’s department store in downtown Sacramento.

 

         The display will occupy the window of the former Roos Bros. department store building at 1001 K Street, the corner of 10th and K. Setup will take place during November 2010, with a “grand reveal” of the completed display the day after Thanksgiving, November 26, at noon. The display will remain in place until the first week of January, 2011.

 

            The theme for the 2010 Holiday Display Window is “Winter in the City,” an urban scene set in downtown Sacramento about 1910. Store windows containing period gifts and merchandise, a nickelodeon movie theater, and lighted architectural elements will reflect the holiday season. Animated Gaffney Display Company figures will interact with each other and their surroundings. We also hope to recreate the sense of wonder of holiday seasons past.

           

The Impact

           

         We hope this celebration of K Street’s past can also serve to inspire its future and encourage other cities across the country – and not just those big cities in the Midwest like Chicago, Philadelphia and New York, to do the same.


What We Need & What You Get

(Sacramento County Historical Society is organizing the fundraising effort, and our volunteers will build the display. In addition to starting funds provided by SCHS and several private contributors and local nonprofits, we have collected over 85% of our $10,000 funding goal, but we need your help to bring a piece of local history back to life.

 

Please consider a tax-deductible donation to this project

 

$25: Window Shopper Level contributors will have their names listed on the Grand Reveal event program and receive a set of two full-color photographic postcards of the 2010 Holiday Display window.

 

$100: Contributor Level contributors will have their names listed on the event program and a panel at the Holiday Display site, receive a one-year membership in the Sacramento County Historical Society (existing members will have their memberships extended by a year), the postcard set and a copy of the Sacramento History Journal Vol. 5 No. 2-4 featuring photos of Breuner’s and Weinstock & Lubin holiday displays and essays on the history of Sacramento’s department stores.

 

$250: Helper Level contributors will have their names listed on the event program and a panel at the Holiday Display site, receive the postcard set and a copy of the Sacramento History Journal Vol. 5 No. 2-4. They will also receive a two-year membership in the Sacramento County Historical Society (existing members will have their memberships extended). They will also be invited to a gala event to be held after the Grand Reveal of the display.

 


Other Ways You Can Help  

      Please pass the word!
story_txt:
Our Story
Do you remember the anticipation you’d feel
throughout the chilly, rainy, days of late fall -- eagerly waiting for the day
when your parents would finally give in to your nagging, bundle you up in a
warm coat and take you downtown to see the incredible, animated displays in
department store windows? 
 
            You
would huddle with family, friends, and complete strangers, noses pressed
against the plate glass window, and gaze in wonder as Santa and his elves,
Victorian store keepers, moving model trains, and fairytale figures, gestured
and twirled across winter landscapes, and cheerful family settings.  It was a magical treat for young and
old in cities all across the country.
 
         Well,
a whole generation of kids never had that experience.  And, the Sacramento County Historical Society wants to
provide if to them.  With your help
we’ll recreate a full-sized holiday display window, using animated
figures that once graced the windows of the Breuner’s department store in
downtown Sacramento. 
 
         The display will occupy
the window of the former Roos Bros. department store building at 1001 K Street,
the corner of 10th and K. Setup will take place during November 2010, with a “grand
reveal”
of the completed display the day after Thanksgiving, November 26, at noon. The display
will remain in place until the first week of January, 2011. 
 
            The
theme for the 2010 Holiday Display Window is “Winter in the City,” an urban scene set in
downtown Sacramento about 1910. Store windows containing period gifts and
merchandise, a nickelodeon movie theater, and lighted architectural elements
will reflect the holiday season. Animated Gaffney Display Company figures will
interact with each other and their surroundings. We also hope to recreate the
sense of wonder of holiday seasons past.
           
The Impact

           
         We hope this celebration of K Street’s past can also serve to inspire its future and encourage other cities across the country – and not just those big cities in the Midwest like Chicago, Philadelphia and New York, to do the same.

What We Need & What You Get
(Sacramento County Historical Society is
organizing the fundraising effort, and our volunteers will build the display.
In addition to starting funds provided by SCHS and several private contributors
and local nonprofits, we have collected over 85% of our $10,000 funding goal,
but we need your help to bring a piece of local history back to life.
 
Please consider a tax-deductible donation to
this project
 


$25: Window Shopper Level contributors will have
their names listed on the Grand Reveal event program and receive a set of two
full-color photographic postcards of the 2010 Holiday Display window.
 
$100: Contributor Level contributors will have
their names listed on the event program and a panel at the Holiday Display
site, receive a one-year membership in the Sacramento County Historical Society
(existing members will have their memberships extended by a year), the postcard
set and a copy of the Sacramento History Journal Vol. 5 No. 2-4 featuring
photos of Breuner’s and Weinstock & Lubin holiday displays and essays on
the history of Sacramento’s department stores.
 
$250: Helper Level contributors will have
their names listed on the event program and a panel at the Holiday Display
site, receive the postcard set and a copy of the Sacramento History Journal
Vol. 5 No. 2-4. They will also receive a two-year membership in the Sacramento
County Historical Society (existing members will have their memberships extended).
They will also be invited to a gala event to be held after the Grand Reveal of
the display.
 

Other Ways You Can Help        Please pass the word!

story:
My name is Chuck Park and I have had a passion for making wine for many years. Both grape wines as well fruit wines. Last year I had four wines win awards in the International Amateur Wine Makers competition.  It is my desire now to own and operate a small farm winery in western MD.

We now have the opportunity to purchase an older building that has the feel of Tuscany.  Our desire is to renovate the building, creating production and storage areas as well as building an elegant tasting room with a fireplace. This will provide a romantic place to enjoy wine tasting and friendship.

By establishing a winery here [the first in Allegany county, MD] it will bring additional tourism and revenue to our community providing a much needed economic boost.  As we grow in production we will be adding employees thus helping others reach their dreams.

This funding will be used for the partitioning of open areas into the tasting room, tank room, bonded warehouse, and crush pad areas.  In the tasting room we will be staining the floor a medium chocolate color and simi gloss floor finish. The room will also have a natural gas fireplace with lounge furniture providing a romantic setting for tasting wine and cheese.

The tank room will house up to 12 fermentation/aging tanks for the production of the wine. Once the wine is bulk aged and cleared it is bottled and moved to the bonded warehouse storage area to further age in the bottle. Then it is out to the customer.  We are in the process of building loyal customers across the state of Maryland, including individual customers, restaurants and distribution networks.

 

We are joining a Maryland industry that is experiencing growth exceeding 12 percent per year average over the past decade and the future looks even greater!  Our goal is to be in production for 2013!

In 2011 Maryland’s 50 wineries produced and sold 1,744,275 bottles of wine, making the average bottles sold per winery 34,885.

story:
August 6th UPDATE:  

As the deadline draws near for the campaign on Indiegogo, creative ideas are bursting at the seams!

From Now on the Car Campaign is focused on purchasing 8 1/2 x 11 in magnets @9.99 each.  Right now with $305, minus Indiegogos cut of the $ we have enough to purchase approximately 22!  That's 22 cars who will be driving around with a prominent Add for VOTING YES ON PROP 37.  

I am in the process of gathering "expert" (friends, collegues, supporters etc) opinions on actual/eventual design.  Feel free to suggest your own!  By two, one for each side! Above is the sample prototype for the Magnet bumper/side door sticker! 

Read below for details of how this campaign has altered since its inception. Given changes, and due to financial constraints I think I have finally hit upon the BEST BANG FOR OUR BUCK!!!! 

Driving a car, YOUR Car,  all over California, with Label GMO's Vote Yes on Prop 37,  is the Biggest BANG FOR our BUCK we can ask for.   We (meaning yes voters) will not be relying just on radio, or tv adds that are hit or miss with listeners, but the Label GMO Car Campaign gets them where they are - on the roads and highways of Calif. All 22Million!  Let's make this happen people.  I am one of a dozen people that happens to see the value in this unique way to educate the voters to approve this very important initiative, and I know there are many more out there.  

The Bang for your buck cannot be underestimated!  Help me get these magnets out to a hundred people -meaning YOU and your friends!

Thank you for donating! 

 

 

 

 

 

 ************** BREAKING NEWS UPDATE: JULY 21, 12 **************

                                           Fantastic News!

                          New Goal: For Car Wrap ONLY = $1700.00 -$2000

 The original goal included a rental car, gas and lodging -now that is off the table because of...

A "Prominent" Volunteer has agreed to wrap HER car! She is already driving all over the state of California promoting the Yes on 37 Campaign, so it's a no brainer that she has become the new "designated" driver -for the driving California Campaign !!!!!!  

more details to follow! Stay tuned...

Update: July 25th.  The opposition is slated to spend 75 million dollars against getting GMO's labeled here in California!  They know that when California votes to label GMO's the rest of the country will follow! 

Ask yourself this: If GMO's are so good - what's the problem with labeling them?

The Bumpersticker perk is now going to be: Label GMO's Vote Yes on Prop 37

     --------------------------------------------------------------------------

 Launched July 8, 2012 -and updated regularly

 I want to share this grassroots educational campaign idea with you. As many of you may know Californians are poised to vote that the labeling of GMO's be required, by law, in the state of California.

The problem is, that most of the people I speak with, here in Calif, have no idea about the ballot measure, or about how important it is to the entire country, that Californians vote YES for GMO labeling.

I want to do more than go to a rally with others who already know about the issue, I want to educate those that don't know.

Like you, I am one person who wants to make things better.

Look below for more information about the campaign and links.

WHAT I AM DOING

The Label GMO Car Campaign will be labeled with VOTE YES ON PROP 37 and the names and web addresses of the various non-profit and for profit supporters of the Non-GMO debate.

The Label GMO Car Campaign will be driven all over the entire state of California throughout the months of September and October, getting the word out to vote YES on this important issue. California is a BIG state!

Helping Californians be more aware about the importance of this issue is at the heart of this campaign.

HOW THE FUNDS WILL BE USED

-Purchase of a "Car Wrap" that contains the YES on PROP 37 labeling along with the other non-profit organizations supporting this campaign - A sign company here in Orange County is offering a discount for the wrap -in negotiations.

Cost: $1300 -$1700 -upto $2000 depending on teh graphics etc.

-Helping with fun perks!

ANY REMIANING FUNDS WILL be donated to the Non-Profits SUPPORTING anti GMO's - who are on the front lines of the GMO debate.

Thank you for supporting this campaign. By helping to get the word out to the people of the state of California about this important ballot initiative, together we can get GMO's labeled in California and hopefully the entire USA!

Come Join Me!

May we all prevail on this issue! Warmly,

- Label GMO Car Campaign -Driving Calif!

For more information you can contact Paula at Pjfitzh at gmail dot com.

         STAY TUNED FOR UPDATES AND LINKS and MORE PERKS!

 

Below are links for articles, organizations and leaders on the front line of the GMO debate.  More to follow...

http://www.kojoreport.com

http://www.cornucopia.org

http://carighttoknow.org/

http://www.nongmoproject.org/

http://labelgmos.org

http://seedsofdeception.com/

http://www.responsibletechnology.org/

http://articles.mercola.com/sites/articles/archive/2011/04/27/19-studies-link-gmo-foods-to-organ-disruption.aspx

 http://foodfreedom.wordpress.com

story:
Help an Indie Publisher Take Another Risk!

 

The Setting

 

New technology makes today’s publishing industry a paradise of opportunity for a small, nimble publisher like us. In this Indiegogo campaign, we’re asking you to help us take advantage of an awesome opportunity to expand our innovative business model—so we can publish more extraordinary writers!

 

The Backstory

The big, traditional publishing houses have been acquired by corporate parents and can’t afford to take risks on new talent the way they used to. Advances to even well-known writers are getting smaller and traditional distributors are taking up to 70% of a book’s profit to move paper around the world. Not so good for authors, established or new.

 

The Concept

The idea behind Water Street Press is to provide readers with beautiful, provocative books that are too ‘literary’ or too ‘niche’ or even too ‘dangerous’ for established publishers to take a risk on—and to do it while providing our writers some of the highest royalty rates in the industry. We use newer, and greener, ways to produce, distribute, and market books—and by that I mean both e-books, and print editions.

Let’s be clear: Water Street Press is not a self-publisher – not that there’s anything wrong with that. What we are is a small independent press that does everything an old-timey publisher would do: rigorous editing, pristine copyediting, gorgeous original covers—but when we do it, the one person who makes the most money from the whole process is the creator of the story: the author her- or himself.

 

Our Authors

Joyce Carol Oates calls one of our authors ‘wonderfully readable’ and ‘richly informed.’

Philip Lopate says that another is ‘priceless’ and ‘irresistible.’

One of our writers won the American Library Association’s Stonewall award for her first novel, Po Man's Child

and another’s novel was one of NPR’s top five picks of the year.

These are the kinds of writers you love to read—and we love taking risks for. 

           

The Plot Twist

Now Water Street Press has been offered a stunning opportunity. Our publishing model looks really good to some folks who hold the electronic rights to a few hundred backlist titles – books that are already written, edited and published as print books, but that haven’t yet been put into a digital format and released as ebooks.  Backlisted books that enjoy some level of evergreen, on-going sales, which means that a publisher like us can move forward with ever-increasing stability. Growing our list from twenty to over two hundred books in a short period of time means that we can afford to take more risks on more authors of more and more powerfully beautiful, provocative books—and put those books in your hands and on your e-readers.

 

The Happy Ending

This is where you come in.  Each backlist book is a whole lost less expensive to produce than an original manuscript. But it’s still not free. 

            We’re hoping to raise at least $5000 so that we can begin publishing the backlist, allowing us a bit of financial breathing room in the short term, while we build our own original catalog, so we can continue to fund and develop new writing talent and publish the books that the establishment ignores.

Thanks so much for caring about good books—for being an avid reader, and for considering becoming a part of Water Street Press.

 

You can give any amount, it doesn't have to fit neatly into one of the perks, and you are free to choose any perk up to the amount you have contributed. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but can't afford to contribute, that's fine! There are other things you can do if you’re a reader who is passionate about good books. For example, use the other buttons to share the campaign on Facebook or via email, word of mouth, or any other way you can get the word out to readers you think might be interested in helping some damned good writers get their words in print.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

 

Story Credits

Oh, and one more thing: You can’t do something like this solo. From literary to legal, to marketing and art direction, we have some formidable talent on our side. Check out all our people at www.waterstreetpressbooks.com.
