story:
Summary

Blue Grouse Bread will be a wholesale bread bakery in Norwood, Colorado, close to the resort town of Telluride.  Our breads will be boldly baked with a satisfying crust and a beautifully open and airy texture on the inside.  We are committed to preserving old world techniques of baking bread, using long fermentation times and our hearty sourdough starter to create a complex flavor profile.  We plan to be in grocery stores, restaurants and farmers markets so that our bread is available to you any day of the week, year round.  Our breads will be made with organic flours, with the goal of milling our own Colorado-sourced wheat within two years of production.  We will not just be a bread company. We will be building relationships with local farmers,  connecting with the vibrant (and growing) local food network on the Western Slope of Colorado.  Our goal in reaching out to you with this campaign is to involve you in our journey to make high quality food accessible to our community. We just need a little help to get things started!

Blue Grouse Bread is a collaboration between two cousins: Hannah and Ben Rossman.  Hannah hails from Vermont but has lived in the southwest for the last 7 years.  She has worked at Indian Ridge Farm and Bakery in Norwood, CO for the last 3 years.  Ben grew up in Philly, most recently he served as head baker for Persephone Bakery in Jackson Hole, WY.   

What We Need 

We have set the goal of raising $12,000 for our large capacity mixer and the construction of our walk-in refrigerator.  Our vision at Blue Grouse Bread is to reach as many people as possible with consistent (Monday, Wednesday, Friday) deliveries. In order to do that we need a BIG mixer and a BIG walk-in to supply the masses, while still keeping true to our standard of quality. 

We realize this is a lot of money to raise for bread!  Please know that every contribution helps, even if we are unable to meet our goal.  

We have included some incentives for your contribution.  Bread classes, party invites, and just plain ol' BREAD.  Your contribution is invaluable and we want to thank you for it!

Impact

We have several goals in running this fundraising campaign.  Our number one goal is to involve our community in the start of something BIG.  By donating to our campaign, you make a contribution to our business but your contribution is doing so much more. You are supporting more jobs in rural Colorado.  You are supporting local grain growers in the region and helping to create a network between small, local businesses that can build on one another.  You are supporting high quality, organic food produced on a small scale.  You are supporting preservation of the craft and art behind creating real, good, BREAD!

Other Ways You Can Help

Your support goes beyond just a monetary contribution, it is planting the seed for a long lasting network of high quality local food in Western Colorado.  We realize that not everyone is able to make a contribution.  We would greatly appreciate if you would at least help us spread the word!  Please share with friends on Facebook if you think they might be interested.  Thank you so much for taking the time to read this campaign and we hope to put some good bread in your hands by this summer!

story:
Hello friends, family and anonymous supporters!  My name is Timothy Harper and I live in Beloit, WI.  I am raising money to help accomplish my personal challenge to be the first person to ever walk along the entire shoreline/circumference of California's ailing Salton Sea. But this not just a personal challenge - I also hope to bring some much-needed attention and awareness to the current plight of the Salton Sea. 

 The entire journey will be along the actual shore (except where prohibited by law or where impossible due to safety issues) not on the streets or roadways and to make the journey even more challenging I will be attempting to do it in summer where temperatures can reach as high as 123°F.

  The total distance of the walk will be approximatley 116 miles, is expected to take 6 days, and is scheduled to begin on June 09, 2015.  This is such an extreme challenge that a documentary film, produced by Black Moon Productions, is being made about my journey that is planned for debut at the 2016 Palm Springs Film Festival.

 This is a death-defying challenge, and I can't do it alone! I will need to fund my safety & support team with fuel for the 4WD emergency vehicle, fuel for the motor home to store supplies, act as an emergency 'cool down' station and for sleeping each night. We need 2-way radios, food and water to support myself and the safety team for the week of the journey and boat rentals may also be necessary.  We also need to pay for fuel and lodging to cover the dozens of scouting trips and practice walks that have already begun.

 

Thank you.

story:
Help us to raise 10.000€ for independent and self-organised support of refugees after the eviction of Idomeni! Food, medical and legal help is needed urgently around Thessaloniki!


People left everything they had behind. Thousands overcame fences and borders, facing many barriers, violence andthe gatekeepers of the EU who then decide who is allowed to enter and who is stuck in inhumane and life-threatening conditions around the Mediterranean sea. After the closing of the Macedonian border and the deal between the Turkish government and the EuropeanUnion the situation got worse. With the eviction of the camp in Idomeni the problem has not been solved – in the contrary: more than ten thousand people have been violently replaced to several camps in the region and the closing of all land-borders forces people again to reach Europe by water. In the last three weeks alone, more than a thousand people died on their way across the Mediterranean Sea.

Thessaloniki, close to the borders of Macedonia, Turkey and the infamous islands in the Aegean Sea is one of the hotspots of Europe’s border regime. At the same time, it is hosting numerous solidarity groups, squatted houses for those who are forced to live on the streets while being trapped on their way north. So, it also has become a hotspot of resistance against the fortress of Europe.

From July 15th till 24th the NoBorder-Camp will take place in Thessaloniki. Thousands of people from all over Europe will gather in the city, to protest against the EU migration policies, to discuss possibilities of resistance and to support the self-organized and independentcollectives, that were build in the last years to struggle against the inhumane conditions people are forced to live on their flight.

The social centre “Mikropolis” is one of these spaces. Everyday refugees and activists meet here, to prepare food for the ones who can't afford it, to provide medical assistance to the ones without access to the health-care systems, to give legal advice needed for the further travel and to offer a place to stay for the ones without shelter. This is done without any support of governments, NGO's or other organisations, but by the force and will of uncounted volunteers who denied to accept the brutal reality of actual EU policies.

As a reaction to the first eviction of Idomeni in autumn 2015 a house was occupied in Thessaloniki. The "Orfanotrofio" gives shelter and space to refugees. It has a collective kitchen, medical support, store rooms for relief supplies, a room for gatherings, common and sleeping rooms. The occupation is organized through and by a daily gathering. Every one has a vote and decisions are made collectively. By this a participation for all is said to be granted.

Many more of these spaces of practical solidarity have been created in the last months and years and together with you, we want to support this spaces and the ideas behind. All the raised money will directly be used to financially support the material help for refugees in Thessaloniki and the political struggle these spaces represent. As part of the local NoBorder assembly in the city,we will coordinate and decide about all the supporting activisties collectivly with the ones involved. With the end of the fundraising campaign, we will report constantly where the funds are used and what was supported with your help.

This is no call for charity, this is a call for practical solidarity! Self-organization is an important part of a political struggle for global freedom of movement and a good live for all!

For further informations:

https://noborder.beyondeurope.net/

https://noborder2016.espivblogs.net/de/

http://micropolis-socialspace-en.blogspot.de/

Rote Hilfe Dresden
Subject: No-Border-Camp Thessaloniki
IBAN: DE72 3601 0043 0609 7604 34
BIC: PBNKDEFF 


Helfen Sie uns nach der Räumung von Idomeni (Thesaloniki) 10.000 € für selbstorganisierte Projekte von und für Geflüchtete zu sammeln! Lebensmittel, medizinische und juristische Hilfe sind dringend nötig!

Viele Menschen haben alles zurückgelassen, was sie besaßen. Tausende haben die Zäune und Grenzen der Europäischen Union überwunden, Kälte und Hunger in Kauf genommen und auf dem Weg nach Europa ihr Leben riskiert. Nach der Schließung der mazedonischen Grenze und dem Abkommen zwischen der türkischen Regierung und der Europäischen Union hat sich die Situation in Thessaloniki (Griechenland) für Menschen auf der Flucht noch verschlimmert. Mit der Räumung des Camps von Idomeni Ende Mai ist das Problem nicht gelöst – im Gegenteil: mehr als zehntausend Menschen wurden gewaltsam auf unterschiedliche Camps in der Region verteilt, in denen sie nun unter menschenunwürdigen Bedingungen leben müssen. Nach der Schließung aller Landgrenzen durch die Regierungen der EU, sind die Menschen wieder gezwungen den Weg über das Meer zu wagen. Allein in den letzten drei Wochen sind bei diesem Versuch mehr als 1000 Menschen um Leben gekommen. Wir werden nicht dabei zusehen.

Thessaloniki, nahe der mazedonischen und türkischen Grenze und den Grenzinseln, die im letzten Jahr traurige Berühmtheit erlangten, ist einer der Hotspots des europäischen Grenzregimes. Gleichzeitig existieren aber auch zahlreiche Solidaritätsgruppen, die selbstorganisiert und unabhängig Geflüchtete nach vollen Kräften unterstützen. Tausende Menschen stecken in Thessaloniki und Umgebung auf ihrem Weg gen Norden fest, weshalb sich hier ein zentraler Ort des Widerstands gegen die Festung Europa entwickelte.

Vom 15. bis zum 24. Juli wird deshalb in Thessaloniki das NoBorder-Camp 2016 stattfinden. Gemeinsam mit tausenden anderen werden wir einen Ort schaffen, an dem wir gegen die Grenzpolitik der EU protestieren, Möglichkeiten des Widerstands austauschen und diskutieren und praktisch-solidarisch diejenigen Orte unterstützen, die in den letzten Monaten und Jahren entstanden sind, um gegen die unmenschlichen Behandlung Geflüchteter zu kämpfen.

Das soziale Zentrum “Mikropolis” ist einer dieser Orte. Jeden Tag treffen sich hier Geflüchtete und Unterstützer*innen, um Lebensmittel für diejenige zu organisieren, die sich keine leisten können; um medizinische Hilfe anzubieten; um rechtliche Unterstützung zu leisten oder denen, die auf der Straße schlafen müssen, ein Dach über dem Kopf zu geben. All das wird möglich allein durch die Stärke kollektiver Selbstorganisierung – ohne staatliche Einflussnahme, ohne die 'Hilfe' von NGO's oder anderer Organisationen.

Als Reaktion auf die erste Räumung von Idomeni im Herbst 2015 wurde in Thessaloniki ein Haus besetzt. Das „Orfanotrofio“ bietet vielen Refugees einen Platz. Es besitzt eine kollektive Küche, medizinische Versorgung, Lagerräume für Hilfsgüter, einen Versammlungs- und Gemeinschaftsraum und Schlafzimmer. Organisiert wird es in und über tägliche Versammlungen, bei denen jede Person eine Stimme hat und Entscheidungen im Konsens getroffen werden. So soll eine Partizipation für alle gewährleistet werden.

Viele dieser Orte der praktischen Solidarität sind bereits entstanden und mit Ihrer Hilfe wollen wir diese Orte und die Idee, die hinter ihnen steckt, unterstützen. Alle gesammelten Spenden werden ohne Abzüge für die direkte materialle und politische Unterstützung Geflüchteter in Thessaloniki genutzt. Als Teil der lokalen NoBorder-Versammlung werden wir kollektiv über die konkrete Verwendung der Spenden entscheiden und diese direkt mit den Beteiligten koordinieren. Und alle diese Entscheidungen werden wir öffentlich nachvollziehbar darstellen und über die konkreten Ergebnisse der Unterstützung berichten.

Unser Anliegen ist es, gemeinsam mit Geflüchteten selbstorganisierte und unabhängige Unterstützungsnetzwerke zu stärken. Es geht weniger um Charity, als vielmehr um politische Solidarität.  Selbstorganisierung ist ein intergraler Teil eines politischen Kampfes für globale Bewegungsfreiheit und ein gutes Leben für alle Menschen!

Für weitere Informationen zu NoBorderCamp und den Unterstützungsnetzwerken:

https://noborder.beyondeurope.net/

https://noborder2016.espivblogs.net/de/

http://micropolis-socialspace-en.blogspot.de/

Rote Hilfe Dresden
Betrifft: No-Border-Camp Thessaloniki
IBAN: DE72 3601 0043 0609 7604 34
BIC: PBNKDEFF

story:
The Stylist LA needs your help!  This campaign will help us open a pop-up showroom in San Francisco for the upcoming 2016 holiday season.  The Stylist LA team wants to meet our SF customers face to face.  We want all of you Bay area girls to have first-hand access to our new selection of styles specifically chosen for you and your lifestyle. We’re creating a one-of-a-kind showroom where you’ll be able to try on different styles, work with our stylists, and personally choose your perfect dress.  We want to bring the full, in person, Stylist LA experience to YOU!


The Stylist LA is a designer dress rental company based in LA.  Women can rent dresses, rompers, and two-pieces for a fraction of the retail price in person in our showroom in LA or online where we ship nationwide.  Our dress rentals range from $30-$100 and dresses can be rented for 5 or 10 days at a time. 

The Stylist LA is committed to giving our customers the ultimate dress rental experience.  From excellent customer service to the best, most in demand designers and dresses, we guarantee that when we style you, you will be the best dressed at any of your events.  

Emily McDonald founded The Stylist LA 7 years ago out of her living room with one rack of dresses.  It was her larger vision to bring the most stylish and in-demand dresses to her clients at an affordable price that has made The Stylist LA the go to dress rental company in LA.  Our clients come back time and time again because our stylists have an eye for choosing the perfect outfit for every girl, making them look and feel their best for all occasions. 

The Stylist LA is the company we are today because of all of you.  We think of our clients (all of YOU) as our friends and as our family.  We are so excited to include you all in the expansion process!



By contributing to this campaign, you'll support The Stylist LA's mission to expand our reach and brand to Northern California.  Funds raised will be used for: 

Inventory: A curated selection of dresses with our San Francisco customer in mind will be available at the showroom as well as on line (where we ship throughout the U.S.!).   This inventory will reflect the Northern California style we love so much.  We will offer a mix of options from dresses to wear to fancy events in the city to perfect rompers and sundresses for weekends spent in wine country. 

Showroom Space: Our pop-up showroom will be located in the Marina in San Francisco.  We will use partial funding to secure a great, easily accessible spot.

Stylists: We will be hiring staff to work at the pop-up showroom.  These stylists will be instrumental in helping you pick the perfect outfit for each event.

Events & Marketing: We will host numerous events at the pop-up showroom and we will launch an extensive social media campaign to spread the word about our pop-up!


 We have numerous SF clients; in fact, this year 1/3 of our online orders have come from Norcal!   There are many women in the city that we want to meet and dress for all of their important events.  

Our company (and dresses!) embody a west coast style, which is why our next move is within California.  We built our foundation in LA and we are now ready to expand to another market in another great city in California - San Francisco.

We know that the SF vibe is different from LA's, which is why we will be investing in all new styles of inventory to bring with us to the pop-up!  



We need your help to launch this pop-up!  We want to expand with you and because of you.  Join the process and come along for the ride!

We will be posting updates on this page and on social media as the campaign progresses.  And NorCal, get ready to meet us November 2016!



If you want to donate, but are not interested in the perks, you can click the "back" button at the top of the page to donate a custom amount.

We understand you might not be able to help monetarily, but there are other ways you can help us with this campaign:

- Spread the word about this campaign by using the share tools above.

- Follow us on social media and stay involved as we expand!

- Remember, we ship nationwide!  So whenever you or your friends need dresses for events, think of us.

Please stay in touch with comments, questions, or feedback!  We look forward to hearing from you. Email us at info@thestylistla.com

story:
Our Story

My name is Ashley and I am raising money to bring people together for a holiday visit to dollywood on december 18th 2011. This will be a great night that we hope to repeat yearly if all things go well. Please donate what you can. The smallest dollar helps twords our goal of 800.


The Impact

This is going to bring a large group of people together and create stronger friendships and new bonds. 


What We Need 

We need 800 for cost of tickets, food, and gas. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to donate tickets straight to us. Please email me at ramenyumyum@yahoo.com thank you.

story:
Our Story

It's easy to see everyone as separate. A bit like two lines heading in opposite directions. But here's a cool perspective trick: if we think about it just a little differently, it's easy to see everyone as moving in parallel. And at Ollibean, we love thinking in parallels. When we start to have conversations about abilities that separate us, we'll start to realize that the abilities we have in common are much stronger. 


The Impact

We are working towards a world of global inclusion. That means everyone gets a fair shot at education through inclusion in their schools and communities, regardless of their physical abilities or ability to speak. OlliNepal is Ollibean's first international initiative to enable inclusion. 100% of the funds raised will go towards supplying technology to assist communication and education, and to provide area medical professionals with education on new physical therapy techniques.  


What We Need & What You Get

We have chosen to work with OLENepal to provide type to talk devices to the schools, along with therapy education and assistance in Nepal's Kathmandu region. Each device can give a child with a communication disability the opportunity to have their voice heard for the first time. Enabling communication can be the difference between providing a child a fulfilling life, equal opportunity for education and inclusion in their community, and your small donation can give them this incredible gift.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this link with others or visit www.ollibean.com/nepal to learn more about our cause. In addition to supporting via IndieGoGo, for every person who signs up for an Ollibean account, we will donate an additional $2 to the OlliNepal efforts. We have zero overhead for this initiative so 100% of the money raised will go directly towards making a difference in Nepal.
story_txt:
Our Story
It's easy to see everyone as separate. A bit like two lines heading in opposite directions. But here's a cool perspective trick: if we think about it just a little differently, it's easy to see everyone as moving in parallel. And at Ollibean, we love thinking in parallels. When we start to have conversations about abilities that separate us, we'll start to realize that the abilities we have in common are much stronger. 


The Impact
We are working towards a world of global inclusion. That means everyone gets a fair shot at education through inclusion in their schools and communities, regardless of their physical abilities or ability to speak. OlliNepal is Ollibean's first international initiative to enable inclusion. 100% of the funds raised will go towards supplying technology to assist communication and education, and to provide area medical professionals with education on new physical therapy techniques.

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone, the 4 of us (Josh Marsie, Simon Mills, Marybeth Werkmeister, Pat Peret) have been checking out an empty store front in downtown Pawcatuck. We got to thinking since all of us are heavily involved in different hobbies, i.e. collecting records, comic books, gaming, etc., then maybe we already have enough stock to start this thing. Plus we already have a few people that are going to keep their arcade games there for everyone's usage.
A large point in doing this is making a community spot where people can actually come hang out and indulge different interests.
We were originally looking at this 1800 square foot place, then the guy who owns it has us all come down in person just to say "nevermind, I don't want this here." Pretty huge let-down. So we have begun looking at several other spots that are unclaimed in Westerly/ Pawcatuck (believe me, there's plenty). Plus side-- most of these spots are about half as cheap on rent (about $400 to $600 a month). Downside-- probably won't be able to do our original idea of throwing D.I.Y. shows as well due to the downgrade in available square feet. Either way, gaming is still going to happen and it will still be right in downtown.
A few things we already have lined up:
-large amount of new and used records for sale- punk, grindcore, classic rock, metal, hip hop, etc. local bands/labels, plus we distribute records from about 20 different labels internationally already
-home office for local label Riotous Outburst Records (and possibly War Rhino Recs out of Danbury)
-gaming tournaments (Warhammer, Magic: The Gathering, etc)
-large amount of new and used comics and graphic novels for sale
-soda/snacks for sale
-somewhere around 2 to 4 arcade games on at all times
-old school action figures for sale                                                        -DVDs, video games, consoles
-people can come and put their whole collection for sale in our store on consignment

as far as the D.I.Y show spot for all ages stuff around here-- I'll be looking into that as a seperate entity entirely since we were denied our larger spot. Pretty lame of that landlord to lead us to believe everything would be legit at his spot and then deny us, but there's nothing we can do. People apparently dislike anything involved with kids in our community, so that needs to stop. Any help towards this goal in the downtown Pawcatuck/ Westerly area, ideas, suggestions, etc are greatly appreciated.

story:
To place an order, please visit our website: www.resilience.gives

 

Why Crowdfund?

We have one design currently on sale that's already had a measurable impact for 14-year-old Samaury Carter and his family.  We're launching this campaign to:

  • Allow us to send our first 1000 pairs of Lilli Hick's design into production and ship before the holidays.
  • Help the Hicks and Carter families pay for expenses related to treatment. This includes everything from hospital bills to living expenses. Half of net proceeds from each sock sale is donated to the respective families.

Why Support us?

  • You get to select from one of the awesome perks below depending on the amount of your contribution.
  • We love socks and you probably do too.
  • We believe treatment shouldn't be as economically debilitating as it is, and you probably agree.

Interested in placing a large order? Let us know.

 

 

The Lilli Owl

Since day one, owls have been an integral part of Lilli’s care. Whether it was simply a plush stuffed animal to cuddle when she was having trouble falling asleep in the hospital, or a symbol of strength and hope when her cancer returned, the owl will forever represent the calm among the chaos of cancer for the Hicks family.

Since cancer patients have body temperatures continuously on the flux, we’ve designed the Lilli Owl using acrylic thread, a soft and cozy material with a snug fit. These socks have an athletic feel that will embrace your feet with comfort whether you are working out or relaxing.

Made in North Carolina, just like Lilli.

 

The Samaury Carter

Representing Samaury and his battle, our first sock line features nine different colored ribbons, each symbolizing a different type of cancer. Half of net proceeds are donated to the Carter family to help them pay for expenses related to treatment.


We've crafted these socks using moisture wicking technology from ultra spun polyester to keep your feet dry and comfortable whether you're at work, on the town, in the hospital, or even working out. They are crew length and sit just below the calf.

Made in North Carolina, just like Samaury.

 

Resilience Sticker

 

Lilli Stronger: The Story of Lilli Hicks

Before the evening of December 13th, 2014, Lilli Hicks was living the normal life of a 12-year-old  with her family, growing up in Greensboro, North Carolina.  But on this night, with her favorite stuffed owl by her side, she was diagnosed with ALM Leukemia.  While her parents, Travis and Lou Anne, were numb as they attempted to process everything, Lilli worried about missing school on Monday.  Three days later, Lilli began intense chemotherapy.  Over the course of the following months, Lilli would receive her treatment in-patient for 28 days at a time, go home for a few days break, and begin this process over.  Lilli had to go through this process 4 different times.  After four cycles and many sleepless hospital nights clutching to that stuffed owl, Lilli went into remission and on March 28th, 2014.  Lilli was strong enough to beat her disease, but she would have to become stronger.  

    

Eleven months later, on February 26th , 2016, Lilli’s bloodwork showed signs that the leukemia had returned and a bone marrow biopsy confirmed with 89% blasts of immature blood forming cells in her bloodstream (normal is 5% or less).  After an intense work-up period with two more cycles of chemotherapy and every hospital test in the book, Lilli was admitted to Duke Children’s hospital on April 26th, 2016.  Enduring three days of chemotherapy at a time, following by two days of radiation, and then beginning the process over again, Lilli had to spend her days in quarantine as the intensity of the treatment weakened her immune system to near-nothing.  Finally, on May 23rd, 2016, Lilli received her transplant: cord blood donated by two different undisclosed donors.  Lilli was kept in-patient for about 6 weeks until she was strong enough to be transferred to Durham’s Ronald McDonald House on July 5th, 2016.  Even here, Lilli had to receive round-the-clock care.  She was surviving by feeding tube and tolerating never-ending blood labs and medicine pumps.  Working through the graph vs. host complications, Lilli was finally able to return to her home in Greensboro on August 29th, 2016.  Free of the feeding tube and finally stable, Lilli was delighted to be out of the hospital and back in her own house.     

Today, Lilli remains under “house arrest,” meaning she can only be at home, outside in open air, or in a hospital, until her immune system becomes stronger and her graft versus host problems are fully resolved.  She is able to pursue her schoolwork online and is skyping in to her classes at her old school.  Meanwhile, the Hicks family is attempting to recover from the financial costs of almost three years of hospital bills. Even with insurance picking up the larger portion of the tab, the family is still left trying to pay down a hefty balance. While both parents have returned to work to try and make up ground, finances remain a stressor for the family.

Throughout this three-year journey, Lilli’s friends and family have worked to lift Lilli’s spirits by sending stuffed owls and bearing the hashtag #lillistronger.  As simple as it is, these symbols have been a source of hope and happiness for the family on Lilli’s best and worst of days in the hospital.  

 

Samaury's Story

Few individuals hold the title of both grandson and hero, but that’s exactly what Samaury Carter is for his caretaker and grandmother, Delores Carter. Presenting with coughing and difficulty breathing, Samaury was diagnosed in June with Non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma, a cancer originating in the lymphatic system. Delores Carter recalls the diagnosis “I was trying to stay strong for him, but the memory of my parents losing the fight with cancer was too fresh.” Samaury is currently undergoing chemotherapy in of his hometown Winston-Salem, North Carolina.

Since Samaury’s diaper days, Delores has balanced jobs in retail and substitute teaching while she cared for Samaury, who required extra attention and resources because of his autism. She worked hard to stay afloat financially and look after her disabled grandchild, but Samaury’s cancer diagnosis upset this fine balance. Unable to work while she was shuttling Samaury to his many doctor appointments and treatments, Delores has been unemployed since June. Meanwhile, expenses continue to pile up. The majority of Samaury’s treatment is covered through Medicaid, but Delores is struggling to pay for necessities such as food, rent, and utilities.

Flush with new hormones, fourteen year olds are notoriously unpleasant and self-centered. You factor in a mental disability and cancer diagnosis, Samaury has every right to be the obnoxious teenager that many of us see hanging around the mall. And yet, big-hearted and smiling wide, Samaury infectiously greets hospital staff while he tolerates treatment like the mature individual he is. “I just want people to know he has a beautiful heart and enduring spirit. He’s my hero,” says Delores.

 

FAQ

Q: When will the socks be shipped?

a: Backers who have selected to receive The Samaury Carter can expect their order to be shipped Thursday, 12/8. Backers who have selected to receive The Lilli Owl or some combination of both can expect their order to be shipped by 12/20, guaranteed to be delivered in 3 days or less.

 

@resilience_project

story:
Our passion for baking... 

As Sweet Temptations Cupcakery founder, Jakki Prince, I started baking as a little girl in the kitchen with my Nana. Growing up in my grandparents home influenced my entire life. Some of my fondest memories of my grandmother were spent baking together - me licking spoons and putting sprinkles on sugar cookies on chilly winter afternoons. 

Since founding my business in October 2010, and first retailing cupcakes in May 2011 - my goal has been to open a storefront location for Sweet Temptations Cupcakery. Throughout the past three busy years my motivation has been sustained by the many celebrations I have been invited to bake for and by the smiling faces of families at the weekly local farmers' markets. I know residents of Guelph and area love our cupcakes because you voted! As Guelph Tribune Readers Choice Award Winners as Best Dessert and 2nd place Best Bakery, our storefront would be a welcome shop in the city.

A storefront location for Sweet Temptations Cupcakery would help me bring community and culture through small business to the growing south end of Guelph. The foundation of my business is unique and innovative ideas. My business has outgrown the current physical space in Aberfoyle. By supporting the campaign you will help me realize my dream of opening a storefront for our small cupcakery - so we can continue to support your families with our baking, and our local economy. 

Our campaign overview...  

Reaching our campaign goal of $16,000 will help complete the final piece of the puzzle necessary to opening our storefront doors this year. Your generous contributions will help us to: 

  • Upgrade and purchase a commercial, natural gas convection oven we need to scale our cupcake output to meet the demand of a storefront, 
  • Complete necessary renovations in our unit to construct an accessible bathroom,
  • Create a designated cupcake decorating party and lesson space,
  • Install a custom, low humidity walk-in cooler for storing ingredients and finished products.

Your IMPACTful Contribution... 

Our campaign relies on your IMPACT-ful contributions. With practical purchases and necessary renovations made possible by your contributions you will enable me to open our storefront in Guelph. We will work to demonstrate your real IMPACT:

  • I - Investing in our small business will enhance our city's south end by improving the diversity of locally owned business, 
  • M - Mean the world of difference to me - a young female self trained baker and entrepreneur - I appreciate any contribution to the campaign you can make, 
  • P - Purchasing large scale, commercial equipment is necessary for our growing operation - with this new equipment we can designate a separate space to prepare our products made without wheat flour - safer food for those with dietary needs and sensitivities,
  • A - Affordability - while I have been saving aggressively in order to open our storefront, and have made an application to the Canadian Youth Business Foundation for a loan, your contribution will enable me to have purchasing power to reach our goal,
  • C - Community is important to us - I want to raise a 'cupcake cheers' to you, our friendly supporters, and our storefront will help us meet more families like yours in our community - See our passion for community here on our Sweet Temptations Cupcakery - In the Community Page,
  • T - Today your support is needed to allow us to bake for your upcoming special events - our business and our city are growing and we need your support now to  expand Sweet Temptations Cupcakery for the future

Spread the word!

Thank you for taking the time to read our campaign details. I appreciate you just for connecting with us online! If you're not interested in making a contribution, you can help in many different ways! 

Please help by:

  • Sending a a personal email to your friends, family, neighbours, co-workers, and cupcake fans in your circle - encourage them to take a look at the campaign page here - I would be truly appreciative if you could help us reach others,
  • Share through social media on Twitter (@Sweet_T_Cakes) and Sweet Temptations Cupcakery Facebook - help us connect with potential supporters in our greater Guelph community,
  • Get excited - we're opening our storefront soon, and we are so eager to welcome you through the front doors - and raise a 'cupcake cheers' at our grand opening!

story:
Please help us make this happen!

Be sure to check out the referral contest at the bottom of the page!! 

Downtown St Petersburg is booming with condos and homes, and LOTS of cooks.  However, they have no place close by to shop for their utensils and cookware needs.  We're going to solve that problem! 

On the shoulders of our 7 years success, publishing two cookbooks, a website, selling at boat shows, and working on outfitting lots of yachts, we are opening a store and new website that will reach, not only our boating friends, but everyone who enjoys cooking.  Building on our existing inventory of gadgets, utensils, cookware, table top and entertaining items we are adding more great cooking tools. 


We're not just another kitchen store!  Our reputation in the boating world is stellar, with many customers returning frequently to shop with us, especially seeking us out for our knowledge, fairness of prices, and great customer service.  We carefully select our products, testing them for durability and to be sure they work as promised.  So, when you see a product in our line, you know it’s a great one.  We keep our prices fair and competitive, and honor our competitors list prices when we are higher.  And of course, all the products added for the store will also be available on our website.  So, if you live in the area, stop on by once we open!  If not, the website is a great place to find all your cooking needs.  There's a link to the site below, so go check it out!  And, keep coming back to see all the new and exciting products we are adding.  

www.yachtinggourmetstore.com


We're expanding the line to include items for the home cook, such as more small appliances, a baking section, additional cookware and even more table top and entertaining items.


We buy from the best lines out there such as VitaMix, Chef'n, Joseph-Joseph, Red Cup Living, Govino, Mr. Ice Bucket, Krups, Microplane, Sistema,Vino2Go, just to name a few.  



As an example of one of the fund new product lines we are adding, check out this campaign as well http://igg.me/at/WaveHooks/x/6719001.  It's a really fun and innovative product line!


Our store is more than just a place to shop for that perfect cooking tool.  We have planned a demo and education section where guest chefs and others will provide cooking demonstrations, product demonstrations and educational programs.


Downtown St Petersburg, FL is one of the most thriving downtown areas in the US.  And, the retail experience is growing by leaps and bounds every day.  The Urban Galley is opening in a prime location adjacent to the marinas,condo complexes, and surrounding residental areas providing a much needed product line.

The downtown retail corridor has a population of over 40,000 and about 20,000 households.  These numbers are on the rise with the development of new condos and homes.  And, the development of the Sundial Center (formerly BayWalk) is expected to draw 5-7000 visitors per day.  Given the resident population, the number of people from surrounding areas, and visitors to the area, there is a thriving retail market, with no kitchen store!

It's important for us to have a successful campaign so we can realize our dream and fill this much needed hole in the downtown shopping experience.  By funding our campaign, you can become a part of this great opportunity and receive an excellent perk in return. 

Since everything we sell will be reflected on our website, it doesn't matter where you live.  Everyone will benefit!

  

What We Need and What You'll Get

We need your help in raising the funds to complete our store.  Your contribution will go toward the following:

1.  Secure our space in a high traffic downtown shopping area.  Our broker is currently identifying and finalizing lease agreements.

2.  Build out the space, including fixtures, painting, flooring and lighting.

3.  Add additional products to our existing inventory to round out the product line for our expanded focus.  80% of our inventory is currently in the warehouse.  Funding will go toward expanding the inventory in order to open with the right mix for the new market.

4.  Implement international shipping on the website with the funding going toward the acquisition of the necessary software. 

5.  GET THE WORD OUT!  We are using social media as our primary media but also planning campaigns focused on the downtown residents and surrounding areas.  We are also implementing a program to partner with yacht brokers and real estate agents.

In exchange for your contribution, you will receive a fantastic perk from us!  Please see the list of Perks for more detail.

If you can't contribute, we understand.  You can still help us by sharing our campaign with your friends on social media!  It's a simple thing that would mean soooo much to us!!!  Each time you share this campaign using the button above (just under the video), we get points from Indiegogo.  The more points we get the better the visibility on their website.  There are people all over the globe that participate in funding campaigns, so this positioning is critical to our success.  The more points we get, the better visibility our campaign receives. That greater visibility is a key to our successful campaign!

                               


Stretch Goals

$40,000 - Add additional products we have on the "drawing board" to include some high end cookware, a robust tabletop department (including a greater selection of dinnerware, flatware and drink-ware), and even more small appliances.

$50,000 - Implement an aggressive advertising campaign focused on both the store and the website. 

$60,000 - Expand the demonstration facility to a high-end, fully functional demonstration kitchen and education area, and implement a regular series of guest chefs and special events focused on cooking, including VIP only events (see Perks).  


If we don't make our goal, all the funds will stay with the business and used to continue to develop the new website and work toward the store opening. 



Referral Contest!

One of the keys to our success is getting exposure on the Indiegogo.com website.  That happens when you Like and Share the campaign and someone that sees your post looks at the campaign.  Each time this happens, we get points.  The more points, the better the exposure.  To that end, we are having a referral contest!  Here's how it works:

1.  Create an Indiegogo account.  It's totally private and free!

2.  Right under the video above, there are share buttons for social media.  When you click on one of those buttons and share our campaign, anyone that comes to the campaign through your share will count as a referral from you.  You MUST use the buttons above to get counted.  (Sharing one of our posts within social media doesn't tie back to the contest.)

3.  Share often because the person that refers the most funders to our campaign will win a prize.  The prize is a set of 12 Red Cup Living 18 ounce Cups (see picture).  These are double-walled, non-breakable, dishwasher safe versions of the iconic cup.  And, we are also including lids and straws!!  AND, a set of red cup lights!!!  All in all, a $135 value.  We will ship anywhere within the continental US for free.  Just think what a hit they will be at your next backyard, boat or any get together!  If you're not into the red cup prize, we would be happy to have you choose something else from our website! 


Perk Pictures

Chillsner Set                                           Red Cup Lights

                          


Vino2Go/Set of 2                            Red Cup Wine/Set of 6                  

                           

          Nantucket Bag


For more information or to view our current product line, go to www.yachtinggourmetstore.com or to our blog, www.theyachtinggourmet.com. 


If you would like to contact us, please email: info@theyachtinggourmet.com.

story:
ShinDoFuJi was founded in 2014 with the vision of a space where good food, wine & people connect and create. 

For the past 3 months, the chefs & artists at ShinDoFuJi have put on weekly events featuring local chefs, farm fresh produce & eggs, meats & cheeses from around the world and world class wine. 

This all takes place in a beautiful old house on East Blvd in Charlotte's historic Dilworth Neighborhood. After long negotiation the bank has given us 45 days to pay off the remaining mortgage on the house ($100,000). If not, there is no guarantee that we will get anything out of this property, the land alone of which is worth at least $500,000. 

We don't want to stop doing what we are doing. We want it to grow. ShinDoFuJi Charlotte is just the beginning. Think NYC. Think LA. Think Southern Oregon. Think Osaka. Think about where we could take this and what it would do to the world. 

Thank you.

story:
Our Story

We started ISSUES in June of 2007 on a whim when we couldn't find a magazine that we were looking for anywhere.  We opened the store with the intention of being a place where print could thrive and we still have that mission today.  Over the years, we have been a hub of activity, hosting events such as art shows, book readings, and parties for the community.  We are proud to be part of the Oakland landscape.

Even with all of the support we have received over the past eleven years, we have realized that we need to make some bold changes in order to keep ISSUES in Oakland.  We couldn't bear to throw in the towel, so luckily we have found a new location near the MacArthur BART Station in the MacArthur Annex by our friends Contact Records and Subrosa Coffee.  By moving to this new space, we will be able to begin a new era for ISSUES, where we will focus on the best magazines of each topic, as well as independent magazines of all shapes and sizes.  We will also carry a wider selection of new and used books, plus we will continue to carry the band t-shirts and greeting cards that we have become known for.

We want to continue to be a place where print can thrive and where the community can come to experience it in all its glory.  There are so few places where magazines are available, especially the obscure and rare ones that we specialize in.  Please help us keep these titles alive and accessible for everyone.  Help keep ISSUES in Oakland.

Our Needs & Your Perks

In order to make this move happen we need your support.  We are moving into a store that is currently empty and just comprised of four walls.  It needs to be built out completely with custom magazine racks, book shelves, card racks, and a counter.  We then need to wrap up clean up and maintenance in our current location.  Next we need to move into our new space and get functional there.  Our total costs are $25,000 and that covers build out, moving expenses, and three months of expenses in our new location while we get on our feet, as well as Indiegogo fees.  

We have amazing perks to thank you for your donations!  We are offering over 40 perks from local businesses and artists that have donated towards the cause of keeping ISSUES in Oakland!  We also are offering ISSUES tote bags, ISSUES gift certificates, and a limited edition CD-R compiled by ISSUES Co-Owner Joe Colley!  

You may pick out as many perks as you like, all you need to do is check out separately for each unique perk.

Our Impact

For eleven years, we have been providing a space for the community to come and experience print media.  We don't want to see this resource go away.  Your contribution will help hold space for print in Oakland and beyond.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about our campaign!  We would be so thankful if you would please use the Indiegogo share tools on this page and share on your Facebook, Twitter, and other social media pages!  Any help would be much appreciated.  We are so grateful for all of your support, both now and over the past eleven years!

story:
Note: All our supporters will receive their contribution back (and doubled if possible) as soon as we reach an agreement with the automobile industry to develop and commercialize the SRC technology. Make a wise & green investment!

SRC stands for System of Reduction of Consumption. 

SRC is a new energy efficient technology to cut by more than 30% fuel consumption and CO2 emissions in all types of vehicles: cars, motorbikes and trucks as well as electric vehicles (30% less battery use).

SRC is the result of four years of research and development in automobile engineering. The technology has been invented by Naser (Mehregan) Hasanpour and Ramin Tajarrodi. 

SRC is an intelligent system that maximizes the use of kinetic energy in all vehicles. It is composed of a management computer, switches and sensors.

SRC automatically releases or engages the wheels, cutting fuel injection when appropriate.

SRC can make a vehicle move in free wheel mode for at least 30% of the time, greatly reducing fuel consumption and CO2 emissions.


Our Campaign Objective


The SRC campaign objective is to raise funds to cover the costs of the international patent application and the further development of the technology. 

Only fixed rates are predictible (around 55 000€). In such patent processess unpredictable fees might triple fixed fees. That is why our campaign objective is 150 000 USD.

The SRC Timeline

Raised funds will cover lawyers and legal translations as well as administrative fees of the international patent application. 


Fees and legal costs have been estimated by Gevers, an international law firm specialized in intellectual property rights and patents. 

SRC was patented in France in 2012.  Obtaining the international patent is a crucial step to ensure that this energy efficient technology is installed in all newly produced cars with no additional costs for end-consumers. 


How Does it Work? 

SRC optimizes the use of kinetic energy of any vehicle. Kinetic energy is the energy that any object has due to its motion. Think about the wheels of a bicycle or a skateboard. They keep moving for quite a while after just a single push. That is kinetic energy.



When you drive you are constantly injecting fuel.

SRC is an intelligent system which detects when you do not need fuel to keep your speed. 

In a fraction of a second, SRC cuts fuel injection and releases the wheels. The car then coasts.

If you suddenly wish to reduce your speed or further accelerate, SRC instantly engages the wheels and the car goes back to its regular conditions. 

In a constant speed situation, SRC activates the free wheel mode in a fraction of a second from 25 to 120 km per hour. It re-engages the wheels as soon as you accelerate, reduce speed or make a sudden maneuver.

SRC is the only technology which optimises the vehicle's kinetic energy and is fully automatic, secure and doesn't change anything on the way you drive. 


Why 30%? How do we calculate potential savings?

We can refer to two sources. The first is Panhard, the French car manufacturer which free wheel system in 1930’s already reached an average savings of 20%. The second reference is BOSCH, major industry supplier.  BOSCH recent tests showed that ‘the power of a car engine is not necessary during 30% of the ride’. Read BOSCH Press Release here (FR version).


Already in 1930's, the French car manufacturer Panhard demonstrated the feasability and benefits of a free-wheel car system. Read more. 


Today, car systems do not take full advantage of kinetic energy. The BMW 116d Efficient Dynamics Edition integrates a system to recuperate kinetic energy but it is far from SRC performance and it is not fully automatic. Read more. 

BOSCH, supplier of the automobile industry worldwide predicts that systems to exploit kinetic energy will be in all cars in the short term, with potential savings up to 10%. Read more. 

Specialised magazines certify that cars equipped with systems to recuperate kinetic energy is just a matter of time. Read more. 

The SRC original drawing - Access SRC full patent description. 


SRC is the technology with the highest possible performance, going far beyond BMW  systems and BOSCH predictions. 

Global Warming Needs Immediate Solutions

Before we all drive electric vehicles, we need immediate solutions to cut  pollution and costs from road vehicles. Transitional solutions such as SRC are a necessary step towards a zero emissions transport sector. 



Global warming is a major concern and we need immediate solutions to fight climate change. SRC is an immediate solution to cut emissions from the highly polluting transport sector.

Our cities face more and more pollution every day.

Today, on-road vehicles produce over a third of total air pollution in the world. Pollution spikes are becoming more and more frequent.

Current modes of transport are a danger for our environment and health. It costs us millions of barrels of fuel and of course, money.

Green technologies are crucial in tackling global warming, from renewable energies to energy efficient devices in the transport sector such as SRC.

Your Contribution Will Make a Big Impact

In environmental terms, the impact of the SRC system could be impressive -reducing CO2 emissions from the highly polluting transport sector by at least 30%.

The potential positive impact of this revolutionary, energy efficient technology is huge in economic, social and environmental terms.

SRC cut energy costs in the transport sector by 30% without changing our habits. Not only we will spend much less in fuel at an individual level, but the wide commercialisation of SRC will also mean drastically decreasing public and private expenditures in energy. This would have very positive effects in our societies as business and governments would be able to allocate savings to employment, education, social affairs and culture instead of oil and petrol.

Whether you drive every day or just care about the environment, please do support SRC. Every drop counts - and so will each and every one of your contributions. 

(: Thank you :)

story: 2 job working family of 3 desperately in need of reliable car. We share one car to get us both to work at alternating shifts so we can stay with our child when the other is working. This car is in very bad shape, in constant need of repairs we cannot afford. Due to repairs we are already behind in rent and bills. If we lose this car we are in fear of losing our jobs. Hard enough sharing one car, we've never each had one our whole marriage. Makes giving the kiddo extracurricular's impossible and errands all crammed into a couple hours we might have, At least gets us to work, we're in grave danger of losing that. Please help fund the purchase of a more reliable used car. Any little bit will help. We have never been able to purchase a car that lasts more than a year or two. It is our DREAM to have reliable transportation so we may continue to provide paycheck to paycheck without the worry of transportation issue or peril. Thank you so much, any amount we receive will truly be put towards repairs or a more reliable vehicle. Please help us to no longer have tow trucks be a part of every day life! Thank you so much again for any help and well wishes.
story_txt: 2 job working family of 3 desperately in need of reliable car. We  share one car to get us both to work at alternating shifts so we can stay with our child when the other is working. This car is in very bad shape, in constant need of repairs we cannot afford. Due to repairs we are already behind in rent and bills. If we lose this car we are in fear of losing our jobs. Hard enough sharing one car, we've never each had one our whole marriage. Makes giving the kiddo extracurricular's impossible and errands all crammed into a couple hours we might have, At least gets us to work, we're in grave danger of losing that. Please help fund the purchase of a more reliable used car. Any little bit will help. We have never been able to purchase a car that lasts more than a year or two. It is our DREAM to have reliable transportation so we may continue to provide paycheck to paycheck without the worry of transportation issue or peril. Thank you so much, any amount we receive will truly be put towards repairs or a more reliable vehicle. Please help us to no longer have tow trucks be a part of every day life! Thank you so much again for any help and well wishes.

story:
We Only Have One Mission:  Thanking Veterans, Everyday, Everywhere!

Short Summary

Thank you again for your interest in our mission.  My name is Vernon Davis, I am the founder of this mission and I appreciate your interest.  I started this mission out of love and appreciation for our men and women that have served this country in uniform (I too am a veterans 4th generation) in November 2012 and it has grown like a beautiful baby.  I started this mission because I got tired of shaking veterans hands, thanking them for their service and not putting anything in it, so I created what I call a Thank You Packet.  It is very simple, it consist of a Thank You Card, Military Tag (Dog Tag) that reads "Thank You For Your Service and Sacrifice You Are Appreciated" and an envelope.  I call them TYPs for short. 

Since this mission started , we have thanked over 7,700 veterans around the world. Free of charge to them or their families. 

This mission has been primarily funded out of my own resources.  I have a day job and I am a professional stand up comedian, so I take 10% of the money I make and put it into this mission, that accounts for about 80% of the funding, the other 20% has come from people like you that understand our mission and want to help and support it.  Even, if I gave up comedy tomorrow, this mission will continue. 

The reason I am reaching out to you for help with my campaign is simple.  As of May 2015 we have awarded over 7,700 Thank You Packets to veterans around the world. This has been a daunting task, yet I have enjoyed every moment and stuffed every envelope.  

The average cost of a TYP from start to finish is about $1.46 each.  Why so much? Because, I do not have the resources to buy in a large enough bulk to get the prices down.   That is why I am humbly asking for your donation.  If I can raise $10,000 I can then cover the production of the TYPs and postage to send and deliver them to the veterans around the country.  My primary focus is the veterans that are in Veteran Homes, World War II, Korean War and Vietnam Era veterans, yet I do not leave any veteran out.  I focus on the older veterans because we loose 800 - 1000 of the World War II Veterans a week.  I believe we need to thank them all before they leave us with nothing but a memory of them. 100% of your contribution will go into the mission.  

Where Does Your Money Go?

  • Production of Thank You Packets (Thank You Cards, Envelopes, Military Tags, Postage and Fuel cost to deliver these to our Veterans.
  • If we are not able to reach our goal, all the funds that are donated will be used to further our mission and thank as many veterans as we can, with what we have.    
 Touching People and Showing Appreciation

I have personally witness grown men with tears in their eyes after receiving a Thank You Packet thanking them for their service.  I have met veterans that have shared with me the fact that they have never been thanked for their service.  The hugs and handshakes mean more than life itself sometimes.  It is sad and often hurts a little bit when you see an older veteran take that dog tag out of the envelope and grasp it like it was the last one on earth.  I have had the privilege of witnessing this, almost brought me to tears.  These small tokens of appreciation mean so much to so many, so it is our duty to make it happen.  

Personally, if I could do this all day everyday, I would in a minute.  It has really been more than a blessing.

I understand that money is tight, for everyone, even me.  People often ask me "how do you afford this?  I can't tell you that it has been easy and there have been times when I did not have the funds available to proceed with the mission, but somehow and out of nowhere the funds come and I (we) continue with the mission.  

I Don't Have The Money To Help..What Can I Do?

I ask of you to do 4 things even if you can't help me financially:

Take every opportunity to Thank A Veteran

Spread the word about this mission 

Check out the web site www.ThankU4YourService.com

And pray for the veterans that we loose everyday.  Did you know that we loose 22 veterans a week to suicide.  Pray for them and check on them.

story:
When kids in foster care are moved from home to home, they are not able to form a supportive, stable relationship with a loving, responsive adult. Help us insist that our nation's foster care system do a better job reducing the number of kids who are moved haphazardly.

Meet Baby Tori


As a newborn,Tori* was placed in foster care because her parents had a history of domestic violence, child abuse, and sexual abuse. She was the ninth child born to a mother who had already lost custody of Tori’s eight older siblings.

Tori was an anxious baby by the time she moved to her fourth foster home at the age of ten months. But for the next eight months she grew and thrived with the love and support of her foster family—who hoped and prayed to be able to adopt her. 

Then one day, without careful planning and without regard to Tori's need to continue her relationship with the only stable adults she had ever known, Tori was abruptly returned to her biological parents, who were living in a homeless shelter,

                      despite their history of domestic violence

                      despite a no-contact order from criminal court.

Eight months after being removed from the only family that ever provided love and stability, Tori was starved and beaten to death at the hands of her parents.

* real name, real story
...........................................................................................................................................................


When courts and caseworkers make decisions about the lives of kids in foster care, they often move the child without a well-thought-out plan. 

Children heal, learn and grow through the primary relationship they experience with the person responsible for meeting their needs. If they bond with a parent or caregiver who is nurturing, protective, and responsive, they will thrive. When this bond doesn't occur or is abruptly severed, children suffer; sometimes for the rest of their lives. The effects of poor attachment have far-reaching consequences for children and their families as well as for their communities. 
25% of all new admissions to foster care are babies under age one. These babies change home and caregivers as many as six times in their first year of life, creating toxic stress on their rapidly-growing brains. 
Children who are not given the opportunity to develop a secure bond with a loving caregiver early in life are more likely to experience delays across all developmental domains, including cognitive, behavioral, and social-emotional. Their ability to form positive relationships with their peers and others becomes compromised, setting them up for a host of ongoing challenges.
Our communities face the effects of these consequences as well. Nearly half of prison inmates reported experiencing physical abuse as a child. When our children thrive, our communities and nation thrive as well.

Our goal is to help change the system so a child's need for a supportive, stable relationship with a loving, responsive adult is a top priority. 


How we will use this money:

As a non-profit, IKP has relied heavily upon the generosity of volunteers and donated services. To date, 11 people have donated more than 2,500 hours, including web and graphic designers, attorneys, accountants, videographers, copywriters, and marketing/publicity professionals. Free can only take us so far, and your financial support will enable us to continue moving forward at the pace foster kids deserve: sooner rather than later.

This campaign will fund three main projects: 

1. Change Letter Writing Campaign:

We have launched a national movement to send 1,837* letters to the Secretary of Health and Human Services, who is responsible for overseeing the foster care system nationally. These letters will help ensure that our system leaders realize the importance of stable relationships for kids—especially those who have been abused and neglected. The letters will also send a message that people care deeply about—and will not ignore—the ongoing trauma our nation's foster children experience in the very system designed to protect them. 

*These 1837 letters represent the 1837 kids who are confirmed victims of abuse or neglect every day in the United States.

2. Nationwide Training Programs:

Holly Schlaack is the Founder of IKP and trains nationally on topics related to abused children and the power of relationships to heal. Her audiences include caseworkers, CASAs, GALs, judges, magistrates, and policy makers on assessing, understanding, and ensuring the needs of abused and neglected infants and toddlers. Our goal is to expand our reach, adding webinars, training materials, and small group training. 

Additionally, IKP aims to cultivate the next generation of foster parents, caseworkers, attorneys, and advocates through presentations geared toward grade school, high school, and college students Such presentations are designed to empower and encourage their participation in creating positive change.

3. Storytelling Through Video

We are creating and distributing videos that highlight true stories of kids who have been moved multiple times in foster care, how they've fared since, and what this means for our communities. The videos will be used to train professionals as well as engage and motivate the general public to join our efforts and help push this issue until we start reducing the number of foster children who are moved haphazardly from home to home.


Every day in the United States, 1,837 kids are confirmed victims of child abuse or neglect. Foster care doesn't guarantee an end to their suffering.  

  • Foster kids are often grade levels behind their peers. 
  • Often they are over-medicated yet not receiving adequate mental health treatment.  
  • Many never graduate from high school; fewer than 4% graduate college. 
  • They are more likely to experience homelessness and less likely to have any kind of solid support system. 
  • A large number of prison inmates report a history of child abuse.

story:
The Story

More than three million children are treated as inpatients each year in a hospital. Medical staff is very aware that children’s emotional and behavioral requirements are much different from that of adult patients. When children are admitted to the hospital some feel a sense of alienation, loss of appetite, insomnia, depression, anxiety, fear and the list goes on. A very common occurrence for many is trying to overcome the absolute boredom that often ensues. If you or anyone you know has ever endured a hospitalization recovering from illness or injury then you probably already know the kind of boring we’re talking about. Through the eyes of a child it is even worse as days and nights seem to have days and nights of their own. In addition to shear boredom, those who face hospitalization may also deal with depression, anxiety, and countless other side effects. If only there was a way to provide a therapeutic distraction.


Good news! Video games have been known to provide a positive distraction for those recovering from illness or injury. They occupy the mind with creative thinking requiring cognitive skills replacing the boredom, depression, anxiety and anger that is often encountered while recovering and aides in the healing process.


Many hospitals already have video game consoles and games that have been previously donated. Unfortunately, in some cases these games are several gaming generations old. At the speed of today’s technology that is just far too much time. What’s worse is if a game or gaming console were to stop operating the hospital would be left in waiting hoping for additional equipment to come their way. The Gamesgiving Foundation plans to position itself as a friend of hospitals and their patients by providing a living library of video gaming equipment. We want to provide video gaming equipment at no cost to hospitals to make available to those who could use it most. When game systems break down, we want to replace them. When new games come out, we want provide them. This will help ensure that children recovering will have access to the latest and greatest games while hospitalized.

Reaching our campaign goal will allow us to purchase a mobile video game arcade for use at launch events. The arcade is outfitted with the latest video game consoles and games connected together to provide an amazing gamer's paradise. An arcade on wheels pulled up right to our partner hospitals for launching the relationship in that area. This will also prove useful for fundraising as we can offer video game themed parties and contests. A custom wrap on the trailer and tow vehicle serve as a moving billboard advertising our cause everywhere we go.


What We Need & What You Get

Many of those who enjoy video games only play new games for a short period of time and then they sell or trade them in for other games. Most of the time, trade-in value for a game is pennies on the dollar. Games that are donated to the Gamesgiving Foundation are met with a tax receipt showing the fair market value of the game donated. Games and equipment are then placed in a living inventory and made available to hospitals for their patients to enjoy. Because it is a living organization, hospitals need not worry about what to do if equipment stops working. They also benefit by having the games rotated so there are always new games available for playing. Just like other charitable organizations, the Gamesgiving Foundation also makes excess games available for purchase via their website at very reasonable rates. Multiple titles of the same games may be sold and the profits used to purchase new games that are not currently in the inventory.

Money raised through this campaign will allow us to purchase the mobile video game trailer. Any funds raised over the campaign goal will be spent on launching the Gamesgiving Foundation in as many areas as possible and providing the funding source for supplying new gaming equipment or refurbishing donated equipment.

You get the satisfaction of knowing that you are making a difference in the lives of those who could use an extra boost of healing power. There are also some pretty cool perks available for those contributing to the campaign. Helping us reach our goal will allow us to kick off relationships at launch events and create community giving in a way that benefits everyone. Equipment donations received throughout the year are tax deductible providing you with an additional benefit and reason to give.


The Impact

Studies show that creating a positive distraction during recovery from illness or injury aides in the healing process. By making video games available for use at hospitals we are providing a therapeutic service that makes the healing process more enjoyable. 

The Drive

As a child, our Founder and Executive Director was hospitalized after being diagnosed with meningitis. While he remembers spending a lot of time with family when they visited, he also recalls how cold and lonely it was. The thing that stands out to him the most was the sheer boredom. Family visits and stuffed animals are wonderful but in-between visits the boredom creeps back in.


In recent years our founder has had the opportunity to work with many charities across the United States. In many cities in which he has held various events, he has been afforded the opportunity to visit pediatric units of local hospitals. He was determined to see the progress made since his time in recovery. He found some good news and some bad.

While there is more available today for those in a similar situation, there is still room for improvement. Not all hospitals have video gaming equipment available for patients. For the ones that do, it is often through donated items. Some hospitals have been able to offer some level of video gaming entertainment but unfortunately, the game selection is not the greatest and the technology is quickly outdated. Plus, should a gaming console quit working or a game become unusable they are left hoping for a future donation. This can change. This should change.

Challenges

Our single biggest challenge is to create the exposure necessary to establish the relationships required for continued growth. Our vision cannot be realized without supporters.


Another challenge is to effectively change the way we normally do things. Many people trade in or sell their unused video gaming equipment to finance purchasing newer equipment. Too many times they are receiving pennies on the dollar for their equipment. We have to challenge each other to think larger than ourselves. In this case there is a bonus which is the fact that in many cases the fair market value tax deduction that can be realized will significantly outweigh the trade-in offer.

Risks

There are a few corporations out there that profit by offering low trade-in value to customers for their equipment and then retail the equipment at market value. Clearly the promotion of the Gamesgiving Foundation is taking a risk by offering an alternative, community minded approach. We are confident that with the support of like-minded individuals the reward will overshadow the risk.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out about the Gamesgiving Foundation. If you are unable to make a contribution you can still help by using the sharing this campaign with people in your network.

Your help through monetary and equipment donations make it possible for us to fulfill the mission of our organization. With your support we are able to provide a much needed distraction for those that need it most. Being fiscally sponsored by the Social Good Fund, a non-profit organization registered with the IRS as a 501c3 means that your contributions are tax deductible.

Before you trade-in or sell your used video game equipment, please consider donating. You will receive a tax receipt for the fair market value of your item and help the healing process. You can even deduct the cost of shipping your items!

Volunteer to get involved in your community. We could use your help at launch events, fundraising events and even helping us to collect used equipment as well as delivering it to hospitals.

Shop online with us, save and make a difference! Surplus equipment may be made available on our website at rates better than you could find elsewhere. The money raised through the online store goes right back into the mission and enables us to provide the latest gaming equipment.

Project Summary

Help us provide a great launch event in cities everywhere with a super-cool mobile video game arcade worthy of hosting amazing fundraisers. We will post a map on our website and place the Gamesgiving Foundation heart on every hospital that we support. Help us cover the map!


You're already enjoyed playing your games. When you're finished, donate and benefit more through charitable donation receipts than you would trading the equipment in. Help the healing process for someone who could really benefit from the provided positive distraction through the playing of video games. It's a win-win-win!

Play. Give. Heal.
