improvement. Not all hospitals have video gaming equipment available for
patients. For the ones that do, it is often through donated items. Some
hospitals have been able to offer some level of video gaming entertainment but
unfortunately, the game selection is not the greatest and the technology is
quickly outdated. Plus, should a gaming console quit working or a game become
unusable they are left hoping for a future donation. This can change. This
should change.
Challenges
Our single
biggest challenge is to create the exposure necessary to establish the
relationships required for continued growth. Our vision cannot be realized
without supporters.
Another
challenge is to effectively change the way we normally do things. Many people
trade in or sell their unused video gaming equipment to finance purchasing
newer equipment. Too many times they are receiving pennies on the dollar for
their equipment. We have to challenge each other to think larger than
ourselves. In this case there is a bonus which is the fact that in many cases
the fair market value tax deduction that can be realized will significantly
outweigh the trade-in offer.

Risks
There are a few
corporations out there that profit by offering low trade-in value to customers
for their equipment and then retail the equipment at market value. Clearly the
promotion of the Gamesgiving Foundation is taking a risk by offering an
alternative, community minded approach. We are confident that with the support
of like-minded individuals the reward will overshadow the risk.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please help us
get the word out about the Gamesgiving Foundation. If you are unable to make a
contribution you can still help by using the sharing this campaign with people
in your network.
Your help
through monetary and equipment donations make it possible for us to fulfill the
mission of our organization. With your support we are able to provide a much
needed distraction for those that need it most. Being fiscally sponsored by the
Social Good Fund, a non-profit organization registered with the IRS as a 501c3
means that your contributions are tax deductible.
Before you
trade-in or sell your used video game equipment, please consider donating. You
will receive a tax receipt for the fair market value of your item and help the
healing process. You can even deduct the cost of shipping your items!
Volunteer to
get involved in your community. We could use your help at launch events,
fundraising events and even helping us to collect used equipment as well as
delivering it to hospitals.
Shop online
with us, save and make a difference! Surplus equipment may be made available on
our website at rates better than you could find elsewhere. The money raised
through the online store goes right back into the mission and enables us to
provide the latest gaming equipment.

Project Summary
Help us provide a
great launch event in cities everywhere with a super-cool mobile video game
arcade worthy of hosting amazing fundraisers. We will post a map on our website
and place the Gamesgiving Foundation heart on every hospital that we support.
Help us cover the map!
You're already
enjoyed playing your games. When you're finished, donate and benefit more
through charitable donation receipts than you would trading the equipment in.
Help the healing process for someone who could really benefit from the provided
positive distraction through the playing of video games. It's a win-win-win!
Play. Give. Heal.

story:
We are 3 families that want to help refugee families with children have a safe journey to their awaiting relatives outside Syria.

After seeing another news article about another child that did not survive this journey, I wanted to do something about it. I met up with my 2 best friends and figured out that we have a lot of friends in the countries that the refugees transit. So we talked to a few of them and we came up with a plan to help and have a direct impact on young lives.

Due to the war in Syria, millions have fled, in the hope of starting a new life somewhere else. Many of them have relatives that live all over Europe. 

Families with young children have to endure the harsh traveling and sleeping conditions, when available. 


We have all seen the hostilities that take place everyday. Little children see and hear things that can mentally damage them for life. 

Their journey is full of hazards and we are trying to help 50 families with young children avoid the danger by offering them an alternative to the routes and means of transportation used by the main flow of refugees. 

We offer temporary housing with decent accommodations, food and also provide them with means of contacting their relatives and decide on a meeting point and a safe way of transportation.  

We need 50.000 EUR in order to help 50 families with children. The cost for one family is around 1.000 EUR and it includes transportation, housing, meals and basic medical care. We will try to help pay for the transportation they chose after leaving the housing also.

The cost breakdown is like this:

-Transportation to housing (this will be around 50-100eur, depending on the distance)

-Housing (50eur/day/family)

-Meals (50eur/day/family)

-Transportation from housing (this will be the most expensive one. We will pitch in with the remaining amount of money available per family. This depends on how many days they have to stay until they contact their relatives and chose a safe way to travel.)

The setbacks we might encounter are:

-refugees families will refuse help.

-we encounter resistance from other people outside the family.

-refugees families will come too many at once.

I believe that amongst the refugees, there are families with young children that are looking for a different way, a safer way towards a new life. 

If, by any chance, we don't succeed in our plan of helping them, we will pass on the donations to the Red Cross.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Leo Kastenberg. I am going on a 45 mile bike ride, from Center City Philadelphia, to Valley Forge and back, I will do this on April 19th 2015. This is to raise money for an organization called Kiva. I am doing this for my Bar Mitzvah project. Every dollar (except for a small fee for the website) will go to the organization Kiva. Kiva is a non-profit organization that does micro financing. I chose Kiva because they help people become self-sufficient.

What We Need & What You Get

Micro financing is when an organization, like Kiva, has people meet with other people in underdeveloped countries to give them small loans, which can go a long way. I am going to give this money to Kiva, as a donation, not a loan, but anybody make a loan to Kiva (click here for Kiva website), and get 100% repayment:

  • If you donate, I will do certain things on my bike ride, as listed on the side. Please send the specifics to leokastenberg@gmail.com

story:
Is CBD Legal?

It is legal in all 50 states and has none of the legal or regulatory hurdles associated with Cannabis. We verify that all CBD we purchase is at or below our standard of .01% THC by volume (Federal Law requires THC levels to be maintained below .03% by volume) using certified labs. 



Why We Need Funding:

Explained

  • Some Of The Funds Will Go To Buying Bottles & Ingredients To Fill Orders.
  • We Have The Recipe Down It's All Natural.. Sweet We Just Need Funds.
  • Funds For Fulfilling Orders & Money To Advertise To Get It Out There! 
  • We Have Had People Try This And It's Gonna Take Off
  • Your Funds Will Help Us Get In Dispensary's & Shops For CBD All Around The World!
  • If We Don't Meet Our Goal The Funds We Make Will Go To Make What We Can Use It For And Send Orders Out. To Those That Donated 
  • It's Made By Us License Caregiver's.
  •  So We Don't Need Manufacturing Funds.

Product Information:

  • We Use Solventless Concetrate(No Butane Etc)
  • All Ingredients Are All Natural
  • No Illegal Narcotic's Such As Codeine
  • All Of Our Stuff Is Medical Lab Tested

The Impact

Why CBD Will Change People's Life.

  • 1) CBD is an antibacterial and slows bacterial growth. This is significant for those of us who are dealing with an imbalance of bad bacteria which can cause health problems such as gum disease, heart disease, and intestinal issues.

    2) When you take CBD, it does not cause the typical “high” associated with cannabis.In fact, CBD works as a partner with THC to balance its psychoactive effects. My personal experience with high CBD cannabis medicines is that they leave me clear-headed, positive, energetic, and relaxed. I describe this state as feeling like myself.

    3) CBD reduces inflammation. Let me repeat that, CBD reduces inflammation!! Inflammation in the body causes disease. Less inflammation, less disease.

    4) CBD promotes bone growth. How many people do you know that have a musculoskeletal deficiency who would benefit from a non-toxic, natural medicine for bone growth? When I first learned that taking cannabis could keep my bones strong I think I may have teared up. There are not too many things I wouldn’t do to be able to age without a degenerating, scoliotic spine so to know that this is one of the potential benefits of the CBD medicine that I am taking leaves me feeling incredibly grateful.

    5) CBD reduces function in the immune system. If you suffer with an autoimmune disorder calming your overactive immune system down is vital for your continuing health. When my immune system is overactive I have all sorts of funky things happen to me: migraines, body pain, numb fingers and toes, and so on. Having a medicine that can help me regulate immune function is more valuable to me than the words can find.

    6) CBD relieves anxiety. How lovely is that? I’m a relatively even tempered person, I think, but I do deal with anxiety. I am aware that this is a side effect of having chronic pain but that doesn’t make it any easier to deal with. CBD’s allow me to relax and feel like somebody who can handle the regular stresses of life during spells of anxiety.

    7) CBD relieves pain. This is by far the most dramatic thing that CBD does for me personally. To be able to have relief from the pain that is debilitating you and locking you within your body feels like absolute freedom.

    8) CBD suppresses muscles spasms. I actually had to think about the last time I had muscle spasms because it has been a while. I used to get them all the time before I started using medicinal cannabis but now they are something that I used to get.

    9) CBD reduces blood sugar levels. High blood sugar can cause havoc in the body. Ask any person with diabetes and they will tell you that regulating your blood sugar is vital to one’s health and vitality.

    10) CBD reduces seizures. I don’t have personal experience with this one but I do know of people who have been able to reduce and in some cases stop the seizures that they experience by using high CBD cannabis.

    Bonus:

    11) CBD inhibits cancer cell growth. Oh, did I mention it fights cancer?

    I am just scratching the surface here of what CBDs  can do for the body but that is a pretty impressive list, isn’t it?

    How does one effectively get CBDs in their body? You’ll have to first seek out cannabis strains and medicines that contain high CBD. This will require a little homework and probably a little shopping around to find the one that is right for you. The most superior ways that I have found to get CBD through cannabis is by regularly taking it orally or applying it topically to the skin.

    I would just like to add that my life drastically changed for the better when I found cannabis medicines with high CBDs. Thankfully I live in a part of the world that allows me to have safe access to this medicine.

    May you have safe access to CBD too.


Risks & Challenges

Our Journey

  • It's Never Easy Overcoming Prohibition.
  • We Really Haven't Had To Many Risk Or Challenges
  • We Are 100% Law Abiding By Any Laws
  • Made Sure & Double Checked


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even If You Don't Contribute To Our Campaign
  • Do Research Yourself On CBD
  • Helping Kids To Veterans
  • Enlighten Others
  • One Love

story:
In Other Words is a non-profit, volunteer-run, feminist community center in Portland, Oregon. Our mission is to support, enrich, and empower our feminist communities through literature, art, and educational and cultural events. We have a storefront that serves as a book store, lending library, and venue for feminist community organizing meetings and events.

In Other Words is facing closure

Most years, October is a month of joy and gratitude as we celebrate our birthday.  This year, on our 21st birthday, felt bittersweet as we held an urgent community meeting on October 5th to talk about our capacity deficits and the fact that we are seriously considering closing our doors.  We heard your voices loud and clear that you don't want this to happen and that you are committed to having In Other Words around for years to come.  We gave ourselves until the end of the month to increase our capacity.  At the next public community meeting on November 8th, met to determine whether we have built enough capacity (re)commit to In Other Words so that we don't have to go out of business. The result of that meeting was that we have the volunteer and board capacity to make it through December 2015, but we need to keep fundraising in order to financially make it through 2015.

That said, now comes the hard part.  It is time to walk the walk.  We are in need of serious funding, and a serious increase in our volunteer capacity and our board of directors membership.  Part of increasing our volunteer leadership and board leadership includes asking YOU to help us lead In Other Words towards becoming the open and affirming feminist community organizing space we all crave and desire.

In addition to our critical need of increasing our volunteer base and developing our board of directors, we hope to raise at least $20,000 in order to keep our doors open, and ideally need to meet our annual goal of $60,000 in order to remain sustainable.  It costs us a bare minimum $5,000 per month in order just to squeak by, and we need all the support you can give in order for us to stay open into the year 2015.

We need to do some serious fundraising in the form of financial donations, and serious "friendraising" in the form of recruiting new volunteers and new board members:

-->To join our volunteer family, please email us your contact info and a little bit about yourself! volunteer@inotherwords.org!

-->To join our board of directors, please send us an email at humanresources@inotherwords.org to express interest, or to send us your resume and cover letter to apply for a board position.

We have just a few weeks in order to build up our capacity in terms of new volunteers, new board members, and new donations.  If we haven't met our capacity goals by December, we will need to close our doors.  Please contribute to this campaign to help us ensure that is not the case!

The question we get most often is, "but don't you make zillions of dollars off of the TV show Portlandia?!"  The short answer is:  NOPE.  Far from it.  Unfortunately, the fact that the TV show Portlandia features a regular feminist bookstore parody does not provide us with any substantial revenue flow and Portlandia-related donations are far from enough to pay our bills.  We aren't rolling in money from Portlandia, but we do have a great time meeting local celebrities Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein, and we enjoy chatting with them about feminism and community organizing in between shoots. 

Here's a photo of us with Carrie and Fred:

As you well know, we are an entirely volunteer-run feminist nonprofit community space that truly relies on volunteers and donations to keep going.  

Please help us increase our volunteer and board leadership, and please make generous financial gifts if you are able, in order to help In Other Words continue to grow in to the passionate, committed, brave, resilient feminist community organizing space we all need and want.

Please visit our website and our blog for more information about In Other Words!

story:
Short Summary

The team behind Fight White Genocide.com are coordinating a March Against White Genocide on March 21st 2015 to spread awareness that massive non-white immigration and forced assimilation in ALL white countries IS White Genocide.

Donations will be used to produce White Genocide marketing material to be distributed by activists on March 21st. 

What We Need & What You Get

  •  Money raised will go to the production and distribution of White Genocide marketing materials i.e Stickers, Flyers and Banners

  • We are looking to raise $1,000. Any additional funds will be put towards our #WhiteGenocide billboard project in the Northern USA.

  • Donating to this fundraiser is an active way to participate in Fighting White Genocide

  • All contributors will receive a White Genocide media kit for distribution, if desired

The Impact

Genocide is a crime. And flooding ALL white countries with MILLIONS of non-whites and force assimilating the populations IS White Genocide.

On March 21st we are looking to make a HUGE impact and one of our goals is to see #WhiteGenocide as a trending hashtag on twitter.

Currently we are seeing a massive number of impressions each day, but more attention and discussion of this crime is needed. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially,  there are so many ways you can contribute to the success of this event.

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign to help with fund raising.

  • On March 21st Get Out, Get Active & Get Pictures of your activism and send them in to FightWhiteGenocide.com.

  • Help make #WhiteGenocide a trending hashtag on twitter by posting and retweeting the hash.

  • Every little bit of activism helps towards forcing the conversation on White Genocide.

Fight White Genocide

story:
PROJECT CALM & SENSE

Have you ever wished a bar of soap could wash away yesterday's worries like it washes away yesterday's sweat and grime? 
Well, now it can. Just add water, an open mind, and a light heart.

REVITALIZE YOUR STATE OF MIND 

WITH BATHOLOGY

Bathology is a simple, effective and FUN daily practice 
that fuses soap & story to cleanse body & mind,
instantly turning frowns into smiles and worry into wonder.

All funds raised will launch  the Calm & Sense Club, 
a subscription service to keep you revitalized on a daily basis!

Before you read our campaign pitch, I'd like to ask a favor of you; to give Project Calm & Sense a moment of your time.

Imagine that you are not reading this on a computer screen, alone in your home. Instead, imagine you just stepped into my home, where I have poured you a cup of tea and asked you to hear about this incredible journey I have been on for the last 4 years, as if I just came home from a trip around the world and I was about to pull out my scrapbook.

Please take a seat, and enjoy what I am about to share with you. It will take a little time, but I've done my best to make it engaging, and this is something that my partner and I put a tremendous amount of energy and thought into so that it can truly help you. No matter what is buzzing about you tearing at your attention, please find a simple moment for some calm & sense. You have all the time in the world.  Really.  

- Deb Whitaker


OUR STORY:

Four years ago, on a hot July day, my partner Craig and I were lazily sipping martinis at an outdoor bistro in York Beach, Maine. Suddenly, in a surreal flash, a young woman rode by on a pink polka dot bicycle wearing a matching pink polka dot outfit, while talking on her neon green cellphone. It was the only thing surrounding her person that wasn’t pink. 

We were star struck. We just knew there was something magical about this fashionista we nicknamed Mzzz Pink.  For days we couldn't stop wondering about her, until we suddenly realized who she was. Mzzz Pink was the Madonna of an entire magical cartoon city we were about to create.  When that young woman pedaled by dripping in pink, we caught a glimpse of our future.

When asked to describe our cartoon world Splash City's beginnings, I often tell this story, and then watch the reactions of the listeners. Shoulders relax. Heads nod in rhythm to the stories peaks and valleys. Imagining Mzzz Pink, listener's eyes sparkled as if they were present at the event. Just what experience were we really sharing?

Perhaps it was years ago, perhaps it was yesterday, but at some point in their life, they had a similar experience. As I shared my story, they were most likely internally re-experiencing theirs; the day they brought home their new puppy, met a beloved celebrity at a coffee shop, or saw a double rainbow glistening over their house. The type of experience didn't matter. Something unexpected and extraordinary entered their life for a fleeting moment and then became a cherished memory that lasted for years. Why? What was so special about those moments?

When Mzzz Pink first showed up in our lives, we couldn't have answered that question.  Yet the travels that would come after following her lead helped us not only to understand, but to create a revolutionary method to both illuminate and sustain such a state. Over time, we came to understand that it's not the experience itself, but the all too rare state of being that the unique experience prompted; a state of wonder.

BATHOLOGY: Awaken to Wonder

Fusing Soap & Story to Cleanse Body & Mind

I am a Screenwriter and a Psychotherapist. My partner Craig is a Producer who is passionate about the art and science of the dream. We met when we were both at a point in our lives where we were ready for our next adventure. The moment we "met" Mzzz Pink sparked an incredible journey that has brought us here, to showcase the unique and comprehensive method we created to help make wonder last, through the unlikely fusion of cartoon, story and a simple bar of soap. 

Here's a brief introduction:

Bathology is a simple, effective and fun daily practice 
that fuses SOAP & STORY to cleanse the body & mind, 
instantly revitalizing our STATE; turning frowns into smiles 
and worry into wonder. 
THE SOAP:

Remember lather, rinse, repeat?

Scientists have recently shown we can revitalize our brains as we do our skin and hair.  It's kind of like lather, rinse, repeat, with an emphasis on repeat. 

Every day we take a shower to clean off yesterday's toxins on our body, but what about yesterday's emotional toxins?  Typically we step into the shower worrying about yesterday, and allow those toxins to churn into emotional muck.

Rather than regurgitating yesterday's troubles, our time in the shower could be better spent refreshing our state of mind. 


Using a colorful bar of aromatherapy scented Artisan soap (the one pictured above is Imagine That! (Cranberry Fig)), a quick empowering practice, and a cartoon image that cues a special Splash City story,  we can revitalize our state of mind, and awaken to wonder.


THE STORY:

"Telling stories is not just the oldest form of entertainment, it's the highest form of consciousness... Increasingly, success in the information age demands that we harness the power of stories... Stories are... state of the heart technology." - Producer Peter Guber, Psychology Today, 2011

What's the story you're telling about yourself? Is it humdrum... or vibrant?

It's the stories we tell ourselves daily without realizing it that often keep us stuck in a less than optimal state, yet it's also a new story that can free us.

Recent neuroscience studies suggest that when reading a story, different brain regions collaborate to create an experience that is much like imagining a real life, vivid event. In Splash City, we offer you an entire comical world for you to project into, lose yourself and experience-take; a new story to tell yourself.

All Splash City stories are written in the Hero's Journey format, especially designed to help "awaken the hero within,"while the fable format encourages you to repeat your experience; to read the stories over and over again, gaining new insight each time. 

The Splash City cartoon characters serve as a simple visual cue to instantly bring back your experience, every time you gaze at them. 

THE STATE:

Today, movies, TV & video games are playing in 3D. But what about us? Are we playing in 3D? Or are we living in a flat, 2D state of mind?

In today's fast-paced information age, many live their lives in a state of overwhelm and paralysis. This is the result of what we at Splash City Studios call the "How-to" world.

Like eating empty carbs, we stuff ourselves with information in the hopes of improving our lives and end up malnourished and wanting more, never achieving the results we were looking for, and often becoming disillusioned, cynical and operating in a flat, 2D state of mind.

Rather than piling on more information that can make you feel even more overwhelmed, Splash City Life Fables and Cartoon Mentors offer a common sense approach that is more nourishing to our souls, with heartfelt stories that are therapeutically woven to help us begin "playing in 3D".  


THE HIDDEN GEM:

Each book in the Splash City Bathology series tells a story of one exceptional Splash City character who reveals, in their own voice, the hidden gem they discovered on their journey. The gem found in each book is a coherent concept that is personified by a particular character so they may serve as a role model to help you discover and claim the gem within yourself. 


We identified and developed 11 concepts significant for "playing in 3D" and then simplified them into key phrases (the titles of each book) that are attributes of a particular character. Each Splash City Cartoon Mentor represents a particular concept that they have truly mastered, and teaches that concept through their unique and magical story. 

We then paired a particular scented soap with the Cartoon Mentor, and the 3D attribute associated with their story.  


We've written the first four books of what will eventually be 11 books, one for each Cartoon Mentor and their 3D attribute. (Illustrations of Ms. Bee Haven, Mzzz Pink and Uno are by Shay Burleigh.)The first three books are the foundation of "playing in 3D", or what we call the "Lost Arts" : Imagination, Self-reliance and Will. 


TESTIMONIALS: Whatever you focus on expands.

The daily practice of Bathology encourages BALANCE, FOCUS, CALM & SENSE, and of course WONDER.  

Here's a sample of what we are hearing from those who are currently practicing Bathology:

"I feel so moved after reading your latest book! It was authentic, lovingly written and powerful in its implications... The discussion on why story is so effective as a means of changing your brain and state of mind is really powerful... I was struck by cynicism being mistaken for critical thinking. That is a powerful observation and it's so relevant... unfortunately, many view cynicism as the new hip way to look at life. " - Dani S.,  Respite Director, Yoga Instructor 
"Feeling drained and overwhelmed, I stepped into a hot bathtub with a bar of Bathology soap and a Splash City Studios book.... aaahhh... easy to read yet so much depth.... a lasting experience that just might change your life."  - Laurie D., Business Owner
 "I was surprised to find that Miss Guided Light was a nurse. I am a nurse of 23 years... Miss Guided Light was as unhappy at her job as I was at mine.... I'm happy to say that, with a little help from Miss Guided Light... I was finally able to take my own leap of faith and have the courage to step away from what I knew was wrong for me and start looking for my real path." - Jeannine M. RN, BSN, LNC
"This is the best gift I've received in a long time... a powerful and much needed avenue for self-discovery."  Sande B., Certified Hypnotherapist 

We can't wait to hear about YOUR experience with Bathology!

Raising the BAR: An anti-Cynicism Campaign

Have you been singing to this choir?

At Splash City Soaps, we're raising the BAR toward WONDER, and we're also raising the BAR to override cynicism. 

You probably see it every day. All over the media are"qualified" experts that have a formula to dictate the means to get whatever it is we want. These experts come in the form of pundits, talk show hosts, judges on reality TV shows, and even educators. We are bombarded with them to the extent that it has become a form of "How-to" programming that shapes our beliefs, decisions, and the direction of our lives, and has helped produce an epidemic of cynicism. 

Cynicism has become so acceptable it is all too often misconstrued as critical thinking, but it is actually a form of righteous naivete that allows little or no room for serendipity, imagination, or wonder. 

Cynicism is not critical thinking. Cynicism is the opposite of wonder. It's really bullying in disguise.

At Splash City Soaps, we created a special bar of Citrus, Cedar & Sage soap dedicated to overriding cynicism. We call it:

Circles of Life: An Anti-cynic Soap.



Help us create the Calm & Sense Club: 

We need your help to help you begin "playing in 3D!" 

Creating the cartoon world Splash City (on our website) was the first phase of our journey. The stories were written during the second phase, while creating Bathology, self-publishing the books and designing the products, was the third,  It has been a phenomenal journey into the unknown, with Calm & Sense as our constant guides. (Calm & Sense are even the names of characters in the first two books.)

We have done all of this over the last four years on limited resources, and now it's time to take it to the next level - to you. 

Not only do we want to build a community and an audience, we have reached the point where our business is ready to launch. 

THE NEXT PHASE OF OUR JOURNEY:

Just like with a diet or exercise routine, for Bathology to be effective, it must be practiced daily and over a period of time. It's extremely important to use the same cues (the soap, its aroma, and images of the Cartoon Mentors). 

A Calm & Sense subscription service makes it as easy as possible for you to make Bathology a regular part of your life. 

Advantages of Bathology and our Calm & Sense Club:

  • An exclusive Spa Treatment like no other in your very own home!
  • Convenience. Bathology comes to your door, and takes no extra time out of your busy schedule. Practice Bathology during your daily shower.
  • Change worry into wonder.
  • Improve your focus.
  • Begin your day with a sense of balance.
  • Enhance a state of gratitude.
  • Raise your BAR to override CYNICISM

With the funds we raise here, beginning in the spring of 2015 (we will keep you constantly updated!), we will launch the Calm & Sense subscription service. 

In the Calm & Sense Club, you simply sign up, and every three months we will send you refills and a fresh splash of wonder from our cartoon world.

For a small monthly fee, every three months a package will arrive at your door filled with soaps, books, and as always, a splash of wonder.  

The funds we raise in this campaign will pay for the set up of the Subscription service, inventory, and marketing. After the subscription service is up and running, we plan to add more soaps to our product line, one for each of our 11 Cartoon Mentors. We would also like to do a Bathology demonstration video, to be up and running on our website in time for the launch of the Calm & Sense Club.

Unfortunately, we are unable to get you started on the subscription service now, but we will be notifying you with an update here as soon as its ready so you can sign up. If you are interested, please watch for our updates, and feel free to contact us with any questions at splashcitysoaps@gmail.com.

To those of you who want to gather together to begin "playing in 3D", we also offer a Story Circle Guide which directs you inside the Splash City fables and helps you rewrite your own story, alongside your friends. (Are you a Wellness Practitioner? We can also sell the books and product line to you wholesale, so you can bring Bathology to your students or clients.)

HELP US SURPASS OUR GOAL and FREE OUR 3D CARTOON MENTORS FROM THE 2D WORLD!

As it now stands, our Cartoon Mentors are used only as icons on our websites and the covers of our books.  They are 3D characters stuck in a 2D world!


Help us free them! We'd like to animate them so they can come alive and talk, and help you begin playing in 3D. 

If we surpass our goal, we can hire animators, artists, and voice over talent to start making the first short (less than one minute) animated videos. The first Splash City story we'd like to turn into a short video is The Anger Bank...

If we really, really surpass our goal, we can make an app! With a Splash City app, you can cue your Cartoon Mentors to bring you back to a 3D state whenever you need a recharge. And, you can also splash your friends on the go! 

Somewhere in the midst of all this excitement, we hope to finish the fifth book in the series: Rise Up to the Wave by Justin Tide: "A new kid in town, surfer Justin Tide arrives in Splash City to discover its residents carry ladders, not surfboards. An outcast until he opens his own surf shop in an abandoned beach shack, Justin teaches his new Splash City friends the life-changing power of riding a wave."

PERKS:  JOIN US ON THIS INCREDIBLE JOURNEY!

Become a part of our community and help us to help others begin "playing in 3D". 

When you make a donation, you have many choices; Mind & Body bars, Bathology Life Fable sets, autographed copies of all four books, and more. 

If you want to know more about our books and products, or simply would like to have fun in our Cartoon World and get to know the characters, check out our Splash City website.  We have just begun to build our Cartoon World.  We have countless stories to tell. 

Once you receive your perks and begin practicing Bathology, we would love to hear from you! Some folks we've heard from are already having life-changing results.

Our campaign ends on Thanksgiving, which we feel is fitting, for Bathology is all about encouraging gratitude.

Bathology makes a great gift.  Since it is so late in the year, we are not able to offer shipments in time for Christmas. However, ebooks will be emailed JUST before Christmas (and all our books are available through Amazon via our website.)

And...what better way to begin the new year but with Bathology?! 

Make 2015 a NO HUMDRUM YEAR!

SPLASH YOUR FRIENDS!

Everyone knows someone who feels stuck in a cage like Uno,  who has lost her way like Miss Guided Light, who has a dream like Velocity but doesn't know how to make it come true, or someone who needs Ms. Bee Haven's help to "see the music" and add a splash of enchantment to their life. 


If you are unable to make a donation, you can still be a BIG help by splashing this campaign around to friends through your social media sites, email, or just by talking it up! And don't forget to LIKE us on Facebook! 

Thanks for all your help in helping us splash our world with love, light and laughter! RAISE THE BAR!
story_txt:
PROJECT CALM & SENSE



Have you ever wished a bar of soap could wash away yesterday's worries like it washes away yesterday's sweat and grime? 


Well, now it can. Just add water, an open mind, and a light heart.

REVITALIZE YOUR STATE OF MIND 
WITH BATHOLOGY
Bathology is a simple, effective and FUN daily practice 
that fuses soap & story to cleanse body & mind,
instantly turning frowns into smiles and worry into wonder.

All funds raised will launch  the Calm & Sense Club, 
a subscription service to keep you revitalized on a daily basis!


Before you read our campaign pitch, I'd like to ask a favor of you; to give Project Calm & Sense a moment of your time.
Imagine that you are not reading this on a computer screen, alone in your home. Instead, imagine you just stepped into my home, where I have poured you a cup of tea and asked you to hear about this incredible journey I have been on for the last 4 years, as if I just came home from a trip around the world and I was about to pull out my scrapbook.
Please take a seat, and enjoy what I am about to share with you. It will take a little time, but I've done my best to make it engaging, and this is something that my partner and I put a tremendous amount of energy and thought into so that it can truly help you. No matter what is buzzing about you tearing at your attention, please find a simple moment for some calm & sense. You have all the time in the world.  Really.  
- Deb Whitaker

Thanks for all your help in helping us splash our world with love, light and laughter! RAISE THE BAR!

story:
About Me

Hi!  My name is Lisa Goetz, also known as The Vegan Petsitter.

Working with animals is my passion, and as my business goes through a period of amazing growth, I've definitely been able to do that work a lot!  I often find myself working 7-days/week, without enough spare time for the tasks I desperately want to complete to take my company to the next level.  This includes:

  • Hiring and training stellar employees
  • Expanding my own animal care education
  • Creating valuable free blog content for pet parents
  • Advertising and connecting with new clients

Normally I would bootstrap these costs myself, but I've recently returned to school to finish my degree in Biology, and finances are especially tight.  Having an employee will also help me expedite my graduation (I'm very close!), and focus on additional outside coursework and training related to helping animals.

What will donations pay for?

  • Growing & training a fantastic team
  • Professional coaching and mentorship
  • Legal guidance
  • Accounting
  • Animal care courses and certifications
  • Advertising, marketing, and branding

I will continue to post updates via my blog (veganpetsitter.com/blog) and social media, so you can follow the accomplishments of this campaign!

What if I don't reach my fundraising goal?  What if I surpass it?

I will be pushing for these goals even if we don’t meet our fundraising target.  If we surpass it, even better!  I've been planning to pursue certification in feline behavior through the Companion Animal Sciences Institute (CASI), with the aim of offering behavior consultations.  I've also seen the benefits of massage and physical therapy for animals with mobility and other issues, and would love to take courses at the Ojai School of Canine Massage.  The more funds we raise, the sooner this education can happen, and the more I will have to give back to the animals.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've read this far, I appreciate your investment in my project!  Here are a few additional ways to support The Vegan Petsitter:

  • Sign up for e-mail updates, and share with your network
  • Stay connected with on social media and at VeganPetsitter.com
  • If you are a current or past client, please take a moment to write a review on Yelp and/or Google.  These are often the first things potential clients look at, and they are so valuable!

Thank you so much for your support!

~ Lisa

story:
History

Touré Aide began  as most projects do, very humbly in our livingroom. My husband is from Senegal,West Africa and now living in Canada. In 2011, Hubby and I went to Senegal on holidays and brought extra suitcases filled with clothing we no longer needed/wanted. Aware that most of the villagers did not have more than the bare necessities, we had planned to go back to the village where he grew up, to donate this extra clothing. It was so heartwarming to see the appreciation shown to us by those who received these small gifts.

In 2012, I thought it would be a nice gesture to send more clothing back to this tiny village, so I asked my collegues at work if anyone had extra clothing/shoes they would like to donate to our project. We would collect it, organize it and ship it to Sénégal, where my sister in law would pick it up at customs and arrange for delivery to "the village".

Following my request and a great response from my co-workers, my hubby Ousmane and I were able to send 4 huge Rubbermaid containers filled with clothing to Sénégal, at a cost of  just over $400.00 These articles were distributed among the families in my husband’s village. Men, women and children, all were touched by this generosity and kindness.

 As people were so generous last year, we decided repeat the experience. Once again we hope to send to send clothing and shoes by boat by mid-February 2014, for adults and children. We have received almost 3 times more items, with more coming in, and will be shipping, if all goes well, a minimum of 5 cardboard crates (9cu feet each). Coats, pants, dresses, tops, shoes, all will be put to good use. Once the items arrive in Dakar, Sénégal, my sister in law will be retrieving this from Customs and will make sure it gets to the village.  The elders there will distribute to families in need, in the village and surrounding areas.

Here is how you can help

Last year,  it cost us just over $400.00 to ship our Rubbermaid containers. We left Ottawa in the morning, drove out to Montreal and made arrangements with a company that ships by container.

This year, we have received even more donations, and it will probably cost us closer to $800 to ship our boxes. Last year we were able to fit everything in our car, but this year we will have to rent a U-Haul trailer to bring the boxes from Ottawa, where we live to Montreal, from where everything will be shipped via containers on boats.

Any monetary donation will be greatly appreciated, and all monies will be used for getting those boxes to their destination in Dakar, Senegal. As we would like to do this on a yearly basis, should there happen to be any extra money, it will be put in a savings account, to be used the next time we send clothing to Senegal. There is no "middleman" and any money donated will be used strictly for this project. This is not a business, this is just a married couple, doing our best to help out a little and put a smile on someone's face, and if you can help us do that, then you will also put a smile on our faces and sunshine in our hearts. Even a small contribution of $5.00 will help us along.


The Impact

I have travelled to little villages in Senegal, and have been welcomed in the homes of local families. They have little to eat, but gladly share, they have a small sleeping area, but will insist that you sleep in their room, while they camp out in the yard, their generosity is unconditionnal. By our standards, they are poor, but their Faith in God and in humanity is inspiring.

Seeing their joy and appreciation when we present these gifts of clothing, shoes, blankets to them is heartwarming and humbling. It put everything back in perspective and provided us an awareness of what is really important in life.

And really, new clothes always makes one feel a little bit better, a little more proud.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you think this is a good cause, a worthwile project, a valuable action, but cannot contribute financially, please help us out by telling your friends about us. Any donation, no matter how small will make a difference and help us clothe a whole village.

story:
Help us provide the InfoSec community with the best, FREE conference in Las Vegas, and join us in celebrating our fifth anniversary!!

Who we are/why we do this:

BSidesLV is a labor of love, for and by members of the Information Security community. During the conference, we have over 100 volunteers present including ~ 20 core volunteer staff, some of whom put in months of work before hand, to make this event come together. What started in 2009 as two days of like-minded friends getting together for a handful of talks in a rented house, with a trunkload of burgers, buns and a grill, has grown in scope and size to a 5 track, 1000+ participant, 100 speaker event in a small Las Vegas hotel conference center. That first event has launched a worldwide movement of community organized Security BSides conferences. BSidesLV 2014 will mark the fifth anniversary of the Security BSides phenomena and will be the 134th global event. For more information on Security BSides, our mission, and our reach, please visit our main website at securitybsides.org. All proceeds from this project will be combined with corporate sponsorship dollars to ensure that we can host the best conference possible and still keep it free for students, the unemployed looking for work in InfoSec, and those who feel that many conferences are overpriced. 

What BSidesLV is:

We offer two days of Information Security talks over 5 tracks, including a Speaker Development Mentorship program for first-time national speakers. We host a Joes vs. Pros Capture the Flag competition, the World Championship Social Engineering Capture the Flag contest, a Locksport Village, a huge chill-out space, multiple workshops, and access to representatives from hackersforcharity.org, EFF.org, and other organizations, including our annual "Ask the EFF" panel in our Off-the-Record track. We host a silent auction to benefit the charitable organizations we support, and a 50/50 raffle to give away some great prizes from our sponsors. There are no "attendees" at a BSides event, only participants. Every person who walks through our doors is there to engage the hottest minds in InfoSec - and be engaged by them. This is a two way street.

This year, we're combining forces and space with PasswordsCon.org, giving all of our participants a 2-for-1 conference experience. All for the low, low admission price of free!

Where will my money be going?

Here is a general breakdown of costs from our 2013 event. This will give you a rough estimate of what it will cost us to produce this year's event, as well.

$86K on Venue - F&B, A/V, rooms for supported charities and staff, pool buyout
$8.2K on Credentials (badges/wristbands)
$6.8K on T-shirts
$5.6K on Shuttles to the other InfoSec conferences in town
$5K down payment on Venue for 2014
$5K Legal Fees/Attorney
$3.5K Miscellaneous
$2K Accountant
$1.5K on Printing (track signage, Wall of Support)
$717 on Event insurance
$650 on Radio rental

It cost us around $125K to throw last year's event. $102K of that came from our corporate sponsors. The remainder came from generous donors like you.

This year, we are hoping to increase our budget by another $25K, to ensure a GREAT fifth anniversary conference. With your help, we can make that goal!

What is with the meal tickets?

The loudest feedback we received last year was that we couldn't provide meals for everyone. We wish we could enjoy community meals the way we did at the first BSidesLV events, but that is no longer feasible. We still can't afford to feed everyone, but we can invite you to dine with us. So please, pick-up a meal ticket or four and join the staff, speakers, sponsors, and volunteers for a hot buffet-style breakfast and lunch, and continue the conversation, without having to leave the conference area. Or get a couple of four-packs and feed a friend or co-worker. You could even pay it forward and let us distribute them for you, to a student or another participant in want of a meal. The bottom line is, we would love for you to break bread with us.

Why IndieGoGo?

This campaign is designed to augment our corporate sponsorship drive and give our community members a way to give back. Too many of those in InfoSec work 60-80hr weeks and just don't have the time or energy to volunteer their hours, but have asked how they might help us in other ways. We developed the levels here as a way to ensure that our donors receive recognition and even more return on their investment. Last year, we created a private WePay page and collected donations through Twitter and our website, but WePay recently changed their model forcing us to find a better outlet for collection. We chose IndieGoGo because they offer flex-funding, as well as the ability to control our reward levels. If this campaign isn't fully funded, the producer is well aware of where to make adjustments to the budget. Of course we hope this won't happen, because our industry is so supportive, but if it does, BSidesLV will go on.

Please help us further our mission of providing free education to this generation of Information Security specialists, by donating a few dollars. If you'll be in Vegas for "Security Summer Camp" in August, consider enhancing your BSidesLV experience by purchasing a Supporter, Rock, or Beam package.

Thank you,

-= Team BSidesLV and the Security BSides Las Vegas, Inc. Board of Directors =-

Security BSides Las Vegas, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) Educational and Charitable Corporation

story:
ABOUT OUR TOWN

Nestled at the foot of the Green Mountains, Bristol is a quaint community of about 3800 friends and neighbors. It is a quintessential New England village, complete with a gazebo on the town green, an historic downtown, and what Vermont Life calls the best natural swimming hole in the state. And we all look out for each other’s children and senior family members. Bristol is a unique place.

Bristol’s town green is the heart of our community and has long served as a gathering place for families, non-profit groups, events, a showcase for local crafts, and a safe place for children to play. Many families come to the playground on the green even though in its present state there is not much there for them; two sets of swings over 50 years old and a climber that no longer meets national or ADA standards. There are several children in our area who have mobility challenges and the present pea stone foundation for play equipment makes it impossible for them to take part without assistance.

WHO WE ARE

The Bristol Green Playground Committee was formed in the spring of 2013 by the Bristol Recreation Department, the Bristol Downtown Community Partnership (BDCP) and community members from our surrounding five town area to evaluate the current playground structures on the town green and propose a plan for renovation and upgrades.

All of us on the committee have been working hard to envision an updated play space accessible to all abilities and ages, that would include separate areas for toddlers, school-age and older kids, and a natural playscape area for everyone!

ABOUT THE PROJECT

The natural playscape design has come from a contest that was open to anyone in Bristol or surrounding towns that wanted to participate. They were asked to design a playscape that is defined not by clear boundaries but through a shaping of the landscape to encourage play and interaction. Natural playscapes offer a wide range of open-ended play options that allow people to be creative and use their imagination. They offer a wide range of developmental benefits to children, rehabilitation programs and all people in general.

Playground concept design by Mary Beth Stilwell, MB architecture + design

We received 5 great design entries and 1 of them was from a family design team of a dad and 2 sons together! The contest winner, and our playground designer is Mary Beth Stilwell of MB architecture + design. Our new plan has to stay in the same space and fit in the same area as the current playground. It makes for a challenge but we need to leave plenty of space for all of the other wonderful activities and events that happen on the park every year.

We hope to break ground on our new playground in June 2014 but we need your help to make it happen! While we are applying for many grants to complete the project, we can't do it without the support from all of you! Let your kids know that your family has helped build this awesome community treasure.

We have a very special community here. Donate what you can and help us make it an even better place to live for all our kids, and yours. Come and visit and play and contribute today!

story: Heidi's not even a month old car was broken into after the performance of Seattle Vice last Saturday night. Evil thieves stole everything; her lap top, her stage makeup, many valued personal items and even part of her Cinnamon costume. Those of you who know Heidi can attest that she has a sweet, optimistic nature but even so, money doesn't grow on trees. Mark and Opal, the producers of Seattle Vice, are pulling together funds to cover the costume and makeup but a donation towards replacing her computer  and towards damages not covered by insurance would be greatly appreciated. If you enjoyed her performance in Seattle Vice, please dig a little deeper and help out a young lady who didn't deserve this.

story:
Home made energy generation by GDE

Español

Today, we are going to introduce you to a revolutionary approach in heat and power generation. It will enable homes and small businesses to significantly lower energy costs and emissions, while also allowing them to generate a profit.

GasDecEngine Technology designs and develops ultra-high efficiency micro-combined heat and power (micro CHP) steam engines for the international market based on two patents that we own. Our products are ideal substitutes for the five million boilers replaced in Europe each year.

We are seeking to raise US$150,000 to build a market prototype of our engine.  It will be augmented by a grant worth US$ 180.000 from Innovation Norway. 

With the world reached peak fuel consumption, the pressure on governments to lower CO2 emissions to address climate change increases. European governments are providing incentives to homeowners and businesses to use fuel more efficiently.

Most of our energy today is created using inefficient fuel sources and is later distributed by electrical grids (contributing to more energy loss). For example, a typical coal-fired power plant converts about 30% of the coal into electricity, giving it a 30% efficiency rating. The remainder of the energy is released into the atmosphere as heat exhaust. Even more of the energy is lost when it is transferred and distributed over the grid system to the end user.


Distributed energy (or co-location, in which energy is generated at a business, a home or within a community) is a growing trend being promoted by many governments to lower emissions and reduce wasted energy and therefore lowering energy costs. Solar, wind and geothermal energy are great examples. However, current implementations of these technologies are not sufficient to provide all our electrical and heating needs. As we shift towards a carbon-neutral economy, we need technologies that make a more efficient use of fossil and most off all renewable fuels -- similar to hybrid vehicles.


Combined heat and power, known as CHP, is a more efficient solution which uses  conventional and renewable fuels, while reducing emissions and improving efficiency. CHP engines create electricity and capture the exhaust to use as heat, making them much more efficient. And because they are located on site, there is no loss from transmission.

Although older CHP engines were used by large industrial buildings, modern CHP engines are more efficient and small enough to be used in a home or small business, such as a hospital, hotel, school or nursing home. These are referred to as micro-CHP engines.

Boilers tend to only provide heat. Micro-CHP engines are more efficient because they use fuel to create electricity, and then capture the exhaust to be used as heat. Excess electricity generated by the micro-CHP engine can also generate revenues in certain markets like Germany and the United Kingdom by being sold back to the electricity provider or used at home.


However, even micro-CHP engines have their limitations. Micro-CHP engines being produced today have relatively low efficiency in terms of electricity generation. Typically, CHP engines are able to convert 15 to 35% percent of their energy into electricity, with most of the remainder being used for internal consumbtion to run the engine. Our engine has a mechanical efficiency for the generation of electricity of 62%, and a combined efficiency of 95%. Our engine’s higher mechanical efficiency translates into lower operating costs and a higher return on investment for our customers, which we believe creates a competitive advantage for GasDecEngine.

Our patented technology makes our engine the Toyota Prius of energy generation: unlike conventional boilers, our micro-CHP allows you to lower your emissions today by using any conventional fuel source (e.g. natural gas) or even agricultural waste. In the future, our technology will allow us to build our engines to accept zero-carbon energy sources such as solar, wind and geothermal energy.


We are seeking $150,000 to build a demo CHP based on our engine. For those kind enough to provide us with money to build our costumer demo CHP, we will provide a number of gifts which will enable you to have your own environmentally-friendly heat and power generator to lower your energy costs and protect the environment. Depending on the level of support you provide, we will give you either a blueprint or parts and instructions so that you can build your own engine. Or we can provide you with a fully-assembled engine.

Please click below to make your donation. Thank you!



Working principles

Our engine is a steam type engine. Steam engines shaped countries and industries. Steam engines connected continents before any electrical current flow through a line. Even today, the modern industry can not live without steam.

Behind the scenes, steam is still moving us. Almost every product we take in our hands are connected to steam.

GasDecEngine has develop a mechanism that brings the steam process in a modern way in our homes. It is so simple, by converting the movement of a linear piston to rotating shaft output.


Prototyp - proof of concept

By replacing the crankshaft we where able to get a much more powerful and efficient mechanism.

This engine have not the properties to work as an combustion engine, but as a steam engine it works much better as all other engines in conjunction with combined heat power production. In application like that low revolution and high torque are must for a long lifespan.

So fare we have build several prototypes and tested them in closed thermodynamical cycles. Due to combined experience we have an overlook over the costs and effect of the planned demo CHP.

Our experience with the prototypes shows us that we have to make a casting pattern for the engine block, so that we can manage the high torque. Further we have to implement a new type of burner for very low emissions. With our technology we are 40% under the emission from a conventional micro-CHP.

We see us in a way as an environmental company and trying the best to live up to that. That´s why we do not send goods around the world without any practical use. We think that paying for your electricity is a fair way to stay in contact with us. For people in direct technology interest we offer some special technology transfer.

A lot of tech user around the world want to build their own power plant, but they need a real robust working horse in their drive train. That's why we offer for those supporters a technology transfer to collaborate aiming at further solutions with our engine. For that we can also provide the support from our production partners with their experience in machine building.

Time line

  • July 2014 ordering mold pattern for the engine , the mold will hold for  2000 engines
  • August 2014 - ordering control system for the engine and heating system
  • September 2014 - machining of the engine parts
  • November 2014 - assembling of the engine
  • December 2014 - mounting of the electro magnetic valves
  • February 2015  - connecting heating and heat exchanger system
  • April 2015 - performance tests and performance verification
  • June 2015 - public presentation
  • July 2015 - first round of perks delivering

The Impact

In the first step our company will sell around 600 micro CHP per year. This means at least 600 homes and small businesses that get grid independent and generate their own energy by making also small profits by doing so. These micro CHP are prepared to work with natural gas, with the lowest emission on the marked. We are targeting the Western European country's as well the US and Canadian marked. In the second step we prepare the technology to use other liquid or gaseous renewable combustibles.

By further marked penetration we like to  modify our heating system to be used in heat recovery and converting of solar energy to electricity and cooling. With that we will partnering interested companies for local independent grid solutions.

With all that, our technology will contribute in short terms to the efficient use of natural resources and make people grid independent. 

Together we make the difference

We also like to get in touch with individuals and company's that are interested in local grid development and self building projects around the world. The more funds we raise, the more specific burners and possibilities can we provide. With that we can build service teams to provide the local needed development know-how.  Our outreach is to share the technology and the idea about home made energy self efficiency. Please share the project with your contacts.

Inside of the engine


Demo plant engine with 400 Nm torque at 300 rpm. Engine block in casted iron.

The Perks

Since we are convinced that renewable energy is part of our future life we also try not to overstress natural resources.  We will provide some gifts for example that we pay you some of your used kilowatts over the next years. The idea is that you have us in your mind and may be one day you are a owner of a micro CHP. Of course we like that you buy one of ours. Further we give away drawings parts or engines for those who like to build their own steam engine process. We think that with every engine we give away the energy community will be more focused on efficient local heat and power generation.


Please take out your last energy invoice and think about it. How would it be to transfer that financial post to an income instead? Please support our project and make it real!

Home made energy generation by GDE

Español
Today, we are
going to introduce you to a revolutionary approach in heat and power
generation. It will enable homes  and small businesses to
significantly lower energy costs and emissions, while also allowing
them to generate a profit. 

GasDecEngine Technology designs and
develops ultra-high efficiency micro-combined heat and power (micro
CHP) steam engines for the international market based on two patents
that we own.   Our products are ideal substitutes for the five
million boilers replaced in Europe each year. We
 are seeking to raise US$150,000 to build a market prototype of our 
engine.  It will be augmented by a grant worth US$ 180.000 from Innovation 
Norway.  
With the world reached peak fuel consumption, the pressure on governments to lower CO2 emissions to address climate
change increases. European governments are providing incentives to homeowners
and businesses to use fuel more efficiently.  

Most of our energy today is created using inefficient fuel sources and is later distributed by electrical grids (contributing to more energy loss). For example, a typical coal-fired power plant converts about 30% of the coal into electricity, giving it a 30% efficiency rating. The remainder of the energy is released into the atmosphere as heat exhaust. Even more of the energy is lost when it is transferred and distributed over the grid system to the end user.
Distributed energy (or co-location, in
which energy is generated at a business, a home or within a
community)  is a growing trend being promoted by many governments to
lower emissions and reduce wasted energy and therefore lowering energy costs.  
Solar, wind and geothermal energy are great examples. However, current implementations of these technologies are not sufficient to provide all our
electrical and heating needs.  As we shift towards a carbon-neutral
economy, we need technologies that make a more efficient use of fossil and most off all
renewable fuels -- similar to hybrid vehicles.
